Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lana_S720
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April 2012. The location is second to none. Right behind the Kodak Theatre and the Hollywood Highland Shopping complex. Despite being so close to the main tourist circuit of Hollywood, the street was very quiet. It was the simple things which made this hotel good - onsite guest parking, walking distance to a train station, simple yet reasonable free breakfast, very helpful staff, free wifi and computer access in the lobby. Rooms were big and clean. If there is any fault, it might be a little dated, but this is trivial really. Given the opportunity, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Find”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 2012 for four nights. Perfect location, steps away from everything, yet quiet. Add in the free continental breakfast, wifi and parking and you've got a real bargain. Rooms are large and clean - not luxurious by any means, but then you don't expect that for the price. Staff very nice and helpful. Hope they got the ice machine fixed and re-opened their small gym, but those are minor quibbles. Will definitely stay there again when coming to Hollywood. In fact, almost didn't write a review in the hopes of keeping this little gem a secret.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Michelle H
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights after a carribean cruise and stay in Las Vegas, and it was nice to stay somewhere small and friendly. Room was great with little kitchen and dining table. And location, well couldn't have got much better, couldn't believe how close we were to everything, awesome, short walk to walk of fame etc. Yet such a quiet little street, loved it...

Reviews.Title: “Faultless. Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Beach8um
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2012 and can't really fault it. Yes it was basic motel style accomodation. 3 to 3.5 stars in Australia. But the rooms were large and clean. The location was unreal. Quiet yet close to everything. The bathrooms were well lit and the free continental breakfast was quite good. The staff here really try to please which seems to be a dying art these days. Alvin in particular could not do more to help in any aspect of our stay. Really appreciated it. Awesome thankyou. Would stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: k8travels15
Reviews.Content: This hotel was is in a great location in Hollywood. It is connected to the Hollywood mall and is convienient for reaching many of the tourist attractions. The room itself was simple, plain and sufficient. I cannot say enough about the customer service. The man working at the front desk was VERY friendly and so helpful. Also, if you are looking to rent a car there is a Hertz rental within a hotel about a block away. This was important for us. Overall, it is not a luxury hotel but the price and location were right!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Bard_M
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews here and it was an excellent choice. It's close to all the sights and a short cab ride away from Universal Studios. It's a little dated in places but very clean and the bedrooms are big. There is no restaurant but there are tables outside for breakfast and there are also table and chairs in the rooms. Staff are friendly and helpful, especially Alvin on the front desk. Overall it's excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PAPattyK
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience staying in a small hotel. We chose it because of the location, as we did not want to rent a car while in Hollywood. It was perfect. The hotel staff was extremely helpful, the hotel, while a little dated, was very clean. All the sights were within walking distance and Universal Studios was just one stop away on the Metro. If you want to be amazingly close to everything this is definitely the place to stay. Would chose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Celebrity”
Reviews.Author: KW82
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel three times now - I love it for its location and friendly staff as well as the free internet and continental breakfast. Just a quick walk and you're right there in the middle of Hollywood and just around the corner from a subway station with easy access to all the LA sights. Great terrace our front for catching some morning sunshine. The staff are fantastic - always super helpful and polite. Will be staying there again in the near future, already looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “well positioned small friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheshireMarion
Reviews.Content: This is a great mid budget hotel only 2 minutes walk to Hollywood and Highland centre which is a shopping mall incorporating the Kodak Theatre (oscars). Alongside the shops is Grauman Chinese Theatre(hand and footprints), walk of fame and the pick up for Starline tours. The hotel is clean and friendly. There is plenty for breakfast but only from a selection of muffins, croisants and toast, tea, coffee chocolate etc. There is no breakfast room but you can take your tray back to your room or eat outside on the front patio which is pleasant if the sun is out. The road is quiet and the area seemed safe to us. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a quick visit”
Reviews.Author: Julmich
Reviews.Content: Only had one day and one night in LA. First time visitors so chose Hollywood as a location to stay the night. Hollywood Celebrity Hotel is conveniently located to all of the tourist sites on Hollywood & Highland. Accommodation itself was basic, but clean. Spacious rooms spacious with small kitchenette. Attentive staff upon early checkin and early check out. Very hand to have coffee on hand all hours. You can pretty much tick the boxes along this strip, such as : - Photos of the Hollywood Sign from the H&H Complex next door - Check out where the Academy Awards are held at the Kodak Theatre - Compare your foot and hand size to that of the famous at Graumans Chinese Theatre - Be amazed or shake your head at the impersonators along the strip - Walk to Hollywood & Vine for Capitol Records and Lennons, McCarthey & Orbison stars Some good eating and drinking around this location too. We caught the train from Union Station to the corner of H&H, so saved some major dollars on taxi's to arrive into Hollywood. We also walked over to Beverley Hills & Rodeo Drive (not for the faint hearted or those without solid walking shoes) ... so everything is within a walk or taxi trip. I would definately stay here again if heading that way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bridget H
Reviews.Content: I was leary of the hotel when we booked because there are so many bad areas in LA. However, we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Very quaint hotel 2 blocks from the Kodak theatre included free parking and breakfast. Parking was tight and made me nervous but the hotel staff was always willing to move our car for us! No compliants when parking is included in your stay! The staff was very helpful and friendly. We took advantage of the Universal Studios ticket discount and brochures in the lobby. The room and bed were better then we anticipated and the fridge in the room was great! I would stay here again because it was very easy for us to drive everywhere we wanted to go and keep our belongings in one place. I only have 3 small compliants which would be the property next door got a little loud over the weekend but when I shut the window it was fine. The room was scented with some type of inscents but we kept the windows open most of the time to air it out and it was fine. The fitness center wasn't much and 2 of the 4 pieces of equipment were broken. Good thing we didn't require a workout.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, Location a plus!”
Reviews.Author: SirMrMits
Reviews.Content: Ok let’s get this right, this hotel does not claim to be the second coming when it comes to hotels. However this hotel overall is better than average, but would I come here again, probably not. The reason being that would probably stay closer to the beautiful Santa Monica, as getting around is not difficult so less emphasis on the location of attractions, but more for the beauty and elegance of Santa Monica. We arrived here on our first leg of a tour of fantastic California, and the location was perfect especially when travelling with a toddler, located literally on Hollywood Blvd with Kodak Theatre, good restaurants, walk of fame etc so location wise it is excellent, but do remember we hired a car so were driving from here to all over LA - and there was plenty of driving to be done to get to other areas of LA (4 nights). Oh and no real issues with parking, like some have moaned, we usually found parking outside the hotel or just around the corner, the world is becoming lazy! The hotel itself is standard - reminds me of a typical 3 star, the rooms for comfortable, clean and the bathroom did its job. The breakfast was basically, but the food was fresh, however we usually went out for a brunch as there is so much choice. The comments about the staff are inaccurate and probably unfair, they are nice people and do the job, always helpful perhaps could smile a little more. Not much more I could add, we used this as the hub to travel to Beverly Hills, Universal Studios, Sunset Boulevard, Santa Monica, Venice Beach, Pietersburg Museum, and other places, good hotel for that reason and good value for money especially as we spent so much on worthwhile excursions.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...quirky room!”
Reviews.Author: CWJ-CPC
Reviews.Content: LA was our last stop before we started our road trip up to San Francisco. We chose the hotel primarily for its proximity to Hollywood Boulevard, combined with a relatively reasonable price. The hotel is about 2 minutes walk from the back entrance to the Hollywood and Highland Mall and included free parking and breakfast in the price we paid. Our room had a massive mural on the wall of the four characters from the Wizard of Oz, which added a certain fun to the place. From the glimpses we got of other rooms when they were being serviced, they all had the red murals depicting various films! Our room had two double beds in, a small area to eat, a wardrobe/dressing area (including a mirror with lights round it) and a bathroom. The one thing that let it down was that the carpet was pretty dirty - it appeared clean, but when we spilt some water and went to clean it up, the dirt that came up shocked us - yuck! Breakfast was simple, but sufficient for the three mornings we were there; toast, jam, muffins yoghurt, juice, tea, coffee etc. It was starting to get a bit boring by morning 3 though! The hotel was in an art deco style and had framed pictures and posters of hollywood legends in the corridors, Reception were helpful and sorted our tickets for Universal, as well as pointing us in the right direction for dinner when we arrived. Overall, great for the price and location. If we did have any plans to go back to LA (which we don't), we would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: RoyalsFan60
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on several occasions and have found it to be an affordable option with a convenient location to Hollywood. In fact, you're just a 2-minute walk from the Hollywood & Highland/Kodak Theater complex on Hollywood Blvd. The beds here are comfortable and the rooms are large, especially for the price you're paying. They have a computer in the lobby for guests to use at no additional charge, free parking on the north side of the building, and they serve muffins and croissants with juice in the morning which is also complementary. The front desk staff are very friendly and aim to please. The building is somewhat older but is nicely maintained and very clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel, particularly if you plan to see and do things in the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank B
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hollywood Celebrity was an overal very good experience. You cannot beat the location. The hotel itself is showing its age but is kept surprisingly well. The rooms are basic but spacious and the walls are very thin and you can hear everything around you. I don't know if I'd stay he with my children but for adults it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: 60plusretiree
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop in Southern California before leaving for the UK and we were very pleased with our choice; our room was comfortable, with excellent internet access, a fridge, and a plenty of room for our stuff. Breakfast was rather basic, but the people at reception were very helpful, and we were within easy reach of some fabulous attractions (eg the Getty Centre and the Chinese Theatre) and we found excellent places to dine. Car parking was no problem. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Emily N
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fantastic stay at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel. As grad students we travel on a budget, and we really feel that we got a lot of bang for our buck at this hotel. The room was large and clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “We won't stay anywhere else in LA”
Reviews.Author: Djanaba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights in December 2011 and found this to be a goldmine. The hotel manager Alben and all of the staff were generous, helpful and very kind to us. The hotel had everything we were after and the location is perfect. On all future trips to LA we will be back at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel. Thank you Alben...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, large room”
Reviews.Author: 629sophie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights with our family of 4 in a room with 2 queen beds. The large room was comfortable as well as the beds, and had a nice view. The location is excellent, only a short walk to the walk of fame and Kodak theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hotel is average”
Reviews.Author: FlyboySydney
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Celebrity is in a great location but the hotel is very noisy as it is an old hotel with minimal sound proofing, if you are on the ground floor you can hear everything above you on the first floor. We had 3 rooms 2 on the ground and 1 on the first floor and none of the rooms had water in the showers that worked properly for our entire stay of 3nts. The water was either boiling hot or freezing cold and the third room on the first floor had hardly any water at all running in the shower. The hallways are tiles which may look nice but are very very noisy when people are coming home at 1 or 2 in the morning and walking past your door and the noise is so so loud. The "gym" consisted of a few pieces of exercise equipment but guess what they were "out of order" the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: trevisa86
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel from 28th January for 4 days and thought it was fabulous. The location was great, the walk of fame and kodak theatre is less than a 5 minute walk. The staff in the hotel were very helpful and very nice, Our room was grand, very clean and everything we needed was there, The complimentary breakfast in the morning was lovely. I would recommend anyone to stay in this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kim R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hollywood Celebrity Hotel in January 2012.. It is an amazing location... Hotel Staff were great... had to be one of the best places of our holiday

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: As everyone else says, price is right, location is perfect, place is clean. Sure, decor could be updated, but it doesn't impact the stay. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Only two things could have been better: have some fresh fruit with the continental breakfast for those who are health conscious, and stop using the room deodorizer. When we arrived our room had just been prepared and the deodorizer was so over-whelming. I don't have sensitivities to things like that, but I could hardly breathe. We left a note for the cleaning staff each morning to not use it in our room while we were there. The place is clean, there is no need to use such products. They kindly obliged but it took almost the entire length of our stay (5 days) for it to dissipate from when we arrived (and that was with windows open the entire time).

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Aliseya
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to express my sincere gratitude to all the wonderful staff at Hollywood Celebrity Hotel, they all made us feel at home. Albin, in particular was very helpful and always pleasant to talk with. Our stay was truly a wonderful experience. We stayed for over ten days and very happy with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Price :-)”
Reviews.Author: HappyMatilda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days. Hollywood Hotel is located at heart of Hollywood. The rooms were spacious and clean. We were all comfortable with our rooms. The staff are very sweet and accomodating making our stay more fun. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sean G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on a holiday from Australia. Its in a great location with heaps of shops, restaurants, transportation and things to do really close. There were 5 of us and the room was great with lots of room. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the overall hotel was very well kept. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy S
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in this hotel...Great location, comfortable bed, free parking, free breakfast, free wifi and amazing and friendly staff. Good value for money. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel at excellent situation”
Reviews.Author: Joelle C
Reviews.Content: This place is situated right behind the Grauman's Chinese Theather and the Wolk of Fame. Absolutely perfect situation at an residential area, with free parking. The rooms are spacious, simply furnished but there is a dining place and a corner for ladies to make theri make ups. I loved it ! We had our breakfast on the little terrace and you would not believe me, we had every morning a little small animal for company. Once we had a wonderful "Colibri" = Bird of Paradies, the next day a squirrel and then some other birds too. Also easy to access, close the the tube. From There we visited whole LA! We loved this place. Also the prices for period Jan-Feburary were very reasonable. I can only recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, wonderful friendly staff, great price!”
Reviews.Author: EdreaT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my own from 31 Jan - 4 Feb 2012. The staff were unfalteringly friendly and helpful - they offered me tips on where to eat where I could do my laundry, what streets in Hollywood weren't safe to wander alone, warned me against drinking the tap water, made change for me on several occasions, explained the best way to get to Santa Monica... they were wonderful! The room was lovely and spacious - the photos on the hotel's website are accurate. It has a dining nook (fridge, microwave, little table and 2 chairs) and a decent-sized bathroom with classic black and white floor tiles. Even though Hollywood Boulevard is literally around the corner, I didn't have any trouble with noise. I noticed there were some recent reviews complaining about the cable TV not working - I can't say I had any problems with it; I must've flicked through all 500+ channels after getting in each night and they all worked just fine. The free continental breakfast is perfectly adequate for getting you up and going in the morning - it consists of toast (with basic spreads - margarine, jam, jelly, marmalade), croissants, muffins (chocolate, orange poppyseed, raisin, bran), instant oatmeal, yoghurt, coffee, tea and juice. The coffee and tea are available 24/7 and there is fresh milk (which was a big plus for me - not such a fan of non-dairy creamer). There is free wireless internet which worked perfectly for me in my time there - the connection was very fast and it really helped me to stay in touch with loved ones at home. They also provide a cable in the TV cabinet drawer if you prefer a wired connection. Showers were hot with good water pressure. Everything was immaculately clean (ran my finger along the windowsill - not a skerrick of dust) and the room was made up promptly around 10ish each morning. I'm sure most reviews have already mentioned this, but I'll say it again - if you're keen to see the Hollywood sights, this hotel's location could not be better. It's around the corner from the Kodak Theatre/Hollywood and Highland Center, the middle of the Hollywood Walk of Fame and Madame Tussauds, and an easy walk (not more than 10-15 minutes at a leisurely pace) to the Hollywood Museum, Red Line Tours, Grauman's Chinese and Egyptian Theatres, and the Hollywood/Highland Metro station (on the red line). In my time there I also visited Universal Studios LA by riding the Metro one stop to Universal City (do this! it'll cost you $1.50 each way instead of $9 for a shuttle or more for a cab), and Warner Bros Studios, which was a $17 cab ride from the Renaissance Hotel cab rank (2 minutes from Hollywood Celebrity Hotel. There are heaps of dining options close to the hotel which was a big help to me as well (although I think they do have rooms that include a kitchenette, mine wasn't one of these). The hotel can also organise shuttles to LAX at a reasonable flat rate (do NOT take a cab!) All this at a price tag of under $125 per night for 2 queen beds? Can't complain at all! I would definitely stay here again if and when I return to Hollywood, and will be recommending this hotel to friends and family. The friendly staff in particular were incredibly comforting to a girl travelling overseas alone for the first time. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “The name isn't reflecting the reality”
Reviews.Author: Joergstravel
Reviews.Content: Pros: good location at Hollywood (next to walk of fame, kodak cinema, Hollywood museum) / free parking (own car is a must in LA) / big room / free (simple,in room to take) breakfast / free internet / prompt repair of defects at room (except cable internet:-() Cons: too 'cheap' decoration and furnishing of the room / often not working wifi and cable not working at all / too limited choice of TV channels / annoying room smell (overlay of...?) / too noisy (although efficient) aircon

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Erika A
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location about a block and a half off of Hollywood Blvd. Plus, it has free parking! Albeit a tiny lot, parking is at a premium in LA and they let us stay parked there after check out. We left the car and walked to H&H, the El Capitan, Mels, and Madame Toussauds. Staff are very courteous and helpful, they made checking in a breeze. Hotel is an older building, from the deco era but is very clean and the double queen room was spacious- bathroom, vanity area, sitting area, and large bed area. Our room backed up to Franklin so there was car noise but it was not intolerable. The hotel itself was mostly quiet with the excception of a cackling lady around 1 am (just a single outburst) and a really loud pipe from a neighboring bathroom (lasted a few minutes). They do not have an elevator so if you have mobility issues, request a 1st floor room. They did offer to help carry bags. They serve continental breakfast from 8-10 am (croissants, yogurt, coffee, tea, etc). Free WiFi. Overall, a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: sharonr03
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel mainly for the location, it is easy walking distance to large shopping center, theatres, Grauman's Chinese theatre, etc. the hotel is older but kept clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. the staff even moved our car to the parking lot so we would not get a ticket, free parking was included. Breakfast is muffins, croissants, juice, yogurt and is included. They gave us a room with a kitchen but we were only there for 1 night so did not really need it, would have been handy if we were there longer. there is free Wifi

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Matthew W
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It is a minute walk to get to the tourist sights on Hollywood Boulevarde. You can also walk to Runyon Canyon Park easily to get a great view of Los Angeles. The hotel itself is a little old and obviously given its price it's not going to be the flashiest hotel, however we had no problem with it. There was plently of space in the rooms. The walls did seem to be thin but I was never bothered by noise. The staff of the hotel were definitely a highlight. They were always friendly and always helpful. There is a computer available to use for free internet browsing and there is also free wifi, although I found the wifi a bit slow. Overall I was very happy with the hotel. I think it would be hard to find hotels of the same quality at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: MDM1962
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel to stay at. A little date, nothing fancy, but was clean and the staff was friendly. The room was clean and you are close to the Hollywood strip.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cli0na
Reviews.Content: This hotel may look a little old (older than it seems on the pictures anyway) but it is well maintained, pretty, with a fun 1930's theme.It is also very clean, and quite inexpensive, considering its location. The hotel is close to hollywood boulevard (a five minutes walk) where there's a lot of attractions (lots of tour buses depart from there, and a lot of attractions are in the hollywood area). Also there's a mall nearby for restaurants and shopping. Rooms are really nice if a little bare,and the big flatscreen is great :) Staff is really friendly and helpful. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, free parking”
Reviews.Author: mojomiller
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok, has the vintage fusty smell, but what do you expect from an older hotel. Yes parking is free but the parking lot is small, be prepared to reverse out onto a busy road. But this hotel is a good price, free breakfast, free parking. Has its plus points and bad points. Was ok for 1 nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “A solid value in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: TravelGoobers
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel was very good. It's a small, older hotel located on short Orchid Street behind the Kodak Theater, but located literally within a couple of minutes of Hollywood Blvd. tourist mania. Because of its age the hotel has a little post-art deco decor; it's clean; the staff is accessible and professional; our room had two pretty good beds, a fridge, microwave, HDTV with SatTV box -- everything worked well. Even though the hotel is located steps from bewildering Hollywood Blvd., it was quiet inside and out. My wife commented a couple of times how strange it was to be so near a shopping mall and the crush of thousands of tourists and yet the street was so quiet. Our two night stay cost less than $300, a hard to beat price in this section of LA. We recommend HCH.

Reviews.Title: “The best location with parking!”
Reviews.Author: Keffali
Reviews.Content: Great little find! Two mins walk from Hollywood Blvd and all it's sights. Rooms large and clean, Alber on the front desk is fantastic, helpful and friendly! breakfast is easy and plentiful , free wifi and parking.. Too easy! Stayed with husband and we loved it! It's probably the equivalent of an Australian 3 star motel. Not glamorous but perfect for a cheap stay in Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated but great value”
Reviews.Author: artoodetoo
Reviews.Content: My search was for a hotel in LA with good location, free breakfast & parking, wifi, good value. I stayed for 2 weeks in January 2012. You get more than what you paid for, but it doesn't mean that you should have great expectation. Pros: free wifi (although instable and sometimes only at the lobby), cable tv ok, free parking; basic breakfast (enough for my family), clean, kitchen, great location very near Kodak, Hollywood Blvd, food court. Staff is corteous. Cons: beds are very basic as its sheets, thin walls/ some noise, old carpeting (beware allergics!!), old hotel overall, wall noisy AC . If beds were better I'd give 5 stars, but it's below average. Really missed a better one. Would recommend but advise about the cons. For the price, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “First stay”
Reviews.Author: Barbara R
Reviews.Content: Last minute, looked on trip advisor, saw good reviews, booked same day, was driving on very unfamiliar streets, wound up calling, panicked I was so lost, the person who answered phone was just great, he stayed with me, until I found location. excellent location, parking was a breeze, breakfast in morning was wonderful. Found myself taking an early walk, Chinese theatre, walk of fame within 2-3 minutes, Starbucks, places for a nice lunch/dinner all very close. The staff truly enjoys their work, would go out of my way to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Andrea00100
Reviews.Content: I was looking for accommodations near the Chinese Theater and saw this hotel. After reading other not so great reviews of hotels around the area I decided to go with this hotel and I am glad I did. This hotel was close to everything and I didn't feel unsafe walking to Hollywood Blvd which was a short walk around the corner. Parking was interesting, very small lot, but secure. Room was clean and comfy and larger then I thought. Good selection for a continental breakfast which consisted of muffins, croissants, toast, yogurt, juice and coffee. If I return to Hollywood again I would definitely say here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MrsA7
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on price and requirement for 3 adults to share room. Small hotel in ideal location just 2 minutes walk to Hollywood Boulevard via shopping centre. A bonus was the provision of a basic breakfast. Hotel was a little 'tired' and the a/c was old and noisy. However it was clean and beds very comfortable, and the location and free parking made up for the rather tired decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: JMcKern
Reviews.Content: Located right behind the Kodak Theatre/highland shopping mall, this Hotel is very spacious with friendly helpful customer service. The location is ideal for tourists, literally took us 3 minutes to walk to famous landmarks. But as well being on a back street, it is very quiet

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: MsFickle
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 4 travelling from Australia, and had to book our accommodation in Los Angeles very last minute as we had been waiting on confirmation of another activity. Lots of emails went back and forth, and the staff were friendly and helpful and assisted with all enquiries. We ended up with a double king room - a spacious suite with kitchenette. All the amenties were great for the reasonable price - we were a few steps from the heart of Hollywood, had free parking, an outdoor area to sit (good for smoker), and free breakfast daily. Although parking was difficult, it was no problem for us to just park and leave our keys with staff to move and re-park if necessary. The hotel was busy, but we didn't find any problems with getting our requests met. For the price, location and amenties, I would definitely stay here again, and recommend the Hotel Celebrity!

Reviews.Title: “you've been warned”
Reviews.Author: jobdrob
Reviews.Content: the indian hindu people that own this place are not nice and look for ways to scam you... i was charged xtra for a cup that they left in a cabinet... this place is a totoal scam, no parking and no way can u have any fun after 11 p.m they are unbeleivable.. they're motto should be "attack, attack" we can charge u for breathing in this room lol... just a heads up, look for some pace more hospitable... this place is owned by foreigners who dont care if u ever come back... they just wanna make as much money on u then as possible...

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: JorjaAus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hollywood twice over our trip, and with hindsight would have spent the whole time at this hotel. You walked out and 2 minutes later you were at Hollywood and Highland Mall! What a great location! They also let us check in hours early, which was great as we had driven up from our last leg in San Diego and were exhausted. The room was clean and spacious with a little kitchenette. The decor of the hotel was very cute also. If you're like us and you have a LOT of luggage, ask for a downstairs room. The hotel is 2 storeys, but there is no elevator, and we would have struggled to carry it all upstairs, but they didn't mind at all and just switched our room. Location was also perfect for Hollywood Bowl, as we were going to a concert there and it meant we could just walk up the street, which was even more appreciated on the way home when we saw the crazy traffic trying to get out of the parking lot! Overall, great hotel, and would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Tryteds
Reviews.Content: We were there for a holiday vacation passing through the area. The staff were polite and professional. The hotel is art deco jewel in great repair. Our room a 1bedroom King size suite with kitchinette and diner table. Bed was very comfortable and new. Clean, historic, and up to date. Excellent side street location in the heart of hollywood. Breakfast and parking under $150 a night, can not be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: K F
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but the hotel made quite an impression on us. The hotel itself is full of nostalgia and is set up to look like it did during the golden age of Hollywood. Both the lobby and our room were very clean and kept up quite well. The only issue we had was with limited parking, but we were able to leave our car in the parking garage of the Kodak Theater and the hotel refunded the money it cost to park. I would recommend this hotel to anyone vacationing in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free parking, breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: Salitini
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, and were really happy with the location. We could walk to Graumann's Chinese Theatre. The rooms were super clean and very big. We were right next to the breakfast area, so were woken up at 7.45 every morning by people outside of our door. We chose not to ask for a room change as we wanted to be up early, however if you like your sleep, ask for a room far away from the breakfast table! The breakfast consisted of toast (white and wholemeal) with different spreads, croissants, muffins, yoghurts and juice. Each day we'd have breakfast and take some muffins and yoghurts back to our room to have as a snack during the day. Would have been great if the hotel had a pool, as we were there in the summer. The air conditioning was excellent and the staff incredibly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Kodak Theatre etc”
Reviews.Author: Speegal
Reviews.Content: In terms of location, this hotel is located just behind the Kodak Theatre and three doors up from Hollywood Orchid Suites. No better location for Hollywood Blvd, Maddam Taussads and Walk of fame etc. Staff were friendly and helpful - especially trying to sort out the late checkout we had requested but they had not received. Saed on the front desk is especially helpful and friendly - we enjoyed chatting to him. Our room was very large with two beds and a small kitchenette area (with microwave and fridge only). Rooms are getting old so are dated but nevertheless, are clean and tidy. Breakfast provided was basic but enough to get you going for the day. They provided free internet access and also a computer in the foyer if you don't have your own. Air conditioning were older style units that were quite loud when operated. The hotel is great value for money considering the location and we would stay here again, but next time would book one of the rooms with a full kitchen. (we got sick of eating out after a couple of weeks and I missed my vegies).

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Sam_David_au
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location close to everything. V. Large rooms, clean but a tad dated. Good quality linen, comfortable beds (sofa and roll away beds not comfortable though). Back street reasonably quiet. Staff helpful and friendly. Cons: Included breakfast consists of toast, muffins, croissants and yogurt. No fruit or cereal and not served till 8 am - so bad luck if you're out and about early. Showers need updating; poor pressure and really need new fittings. Internet advertised as included had such poor signal was unusable, so if this is important to you either go somewhere else or organize your own (which is quite difficult when from another country). All in all, good value for money, but the lack of Internet really lets it down - its important in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Value AND location”
Reviews.Author: TheSteggs
Reviews.Content: Our main criteria was location and value for money, and both of these are what we got. A very short walk to Hollywood Boulevard and all it's attractions, along with great value for money and car parking. The beds were amongst the most comfortable we have come across, the staff were great, and the hotel was clean and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “good choise”
Reviews.Author: Andreasupertamp
Reviews.Content: I've been there in november 2011, the hotel is little but pretty, it's in a really good position cause is five minutes walk from hollywood blv. the price is not too high and the service is good. It's really quite in the evening cause it's behind the main road. definally i suggest this little cheap hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very handy....”
Reviews.Author: MintzAuckland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated behind the Kodak Theatre, central Hollywood. There is a shopping mall very close by which includes a food hall. The Hotel itself is very clean, quiet and comfortable. It has old bathroom fittings but if you stay in a double queen room there is plenty of room for suitcases. This room has a separate small kitchen with fridge and microwave. There is also a microwave for use in the lobby. The breakfast consisted of muffins, croissants, orange juice, bread, tea, coffee and yoghurt. Staff were friendly and the desk staff very helpful. If you are a light sleeper then I suggest you don't stay by the stairs. Free internet use is available in the lobby. We found this hotel to be centrally located in a quiet street with easy access to buses and tours. I suggest you book your tours in Hollywood as there are deals to be had, esp the Hollywood Famous Homes tours. For the price I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful reception”
Reviews.Author: HolidayForUs
Reviews.Content: The room was well equipped with air conditioning, one double (large) bed, a living and small dining area with a fridge, table and chairs, an open area to hang clothes and a bath/shower room. The carpet looked basic. There was free wi-fi that worked well. We had a bit of noise during the night from the residents in the apartments opposite, but otherwise the hotel is in a quiet area. Within five minutes' walk there is a shopping mall with plenty of places to eat, theatres and the Hollywood Walk of Fame. You can see the Hollywood sign from the bridge in the shopping centre. The metro (Hollywood/Highland on the Red Line) is also about five minutes walk from the hotel, a single journey is $1.50 or it is $5 for a day pass. We even visited the attractions out at Long Beach, which took around 1.5 hours to reach for this price. Always check the directions to places for yourself, the hotel gave us a sheet of how to reach attractions but this sent us in the wrong direction for the Autry Museum, then we had 2 bus journeys and we wasted 90 minutes extra of our precious time trying to get there. We stayed for two nights in the Hollywood Celebrity during October 2011. We took the shared ride shuttle from LAX airport for $15 per person (there are several service providers, we took the one operated by Prime Time), which was a cheap way to reach the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Tania999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first stop of our USA honeymoon. I booked this hotel as it had good reviews on trip advisor. The rooms are very large, ours having a very comfortable king size bed. Bathroom contains a shower/bath and is also a good size. Although no kitchenette there is a fridge- this was fine for us but something to keep in mind if traveling with small children. The only problem is the walls are thin. This was fine on the first 2 nights of our stay but was very annoying for the last 2 nights when our rude and loud neighbors talked all night! This was more a problem with our neighbors than the hotel itself. Breakfast is served daily consisting of toast, muffins and drinks. It's basic but enough to start your day. Location is great, situated directly behind Hollywood Blv and all it's attractions. Easy to catch a bus from here to all of LAs major attractions! Overall this was good for us, at half the price of any other LA hotel, I'd rather use my money for shopping than a fancy room. Would recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Conrad S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently for 5 nights. Its in a great location. Clean rooms and good value. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: i_an_outtathaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The rooms and breakfast and location was great. Only complaint was when you are booking your accomodation online on their website, i assumed by putting in my credit card details that payment was being made but the credit card details are only as a guarantor so that if you dont show they will take the payment then. This meant when we arrived our accomodation was not paid for, as they only charge your credit card when you check out. So we had not budget $1000 for the accomodation. That was very frustrating as I always assume that when I put my credit card number in and receive a receipt that payment had been made. So just be carefull there, so you are not out of pocket when you arrive and have to find extra money somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and basic, but helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BreezeandBrandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and the first night was a Saturday. We were put in a downstairs room right next to the stairs and hardly slept the first night. We could hear people thundering up and down the stairs and the corridor above our room, and the drinks machine was right next to our door, so we could hear every loud whirr and clang! At around midnight we went to ask if we could be moved to another room, but because the hotel was full, we were told we would have to wait until the next day to move. People were still coming back to their rooms at 3.30am so we didn't get more than an hour's uninterupted sleep. We were moved to another room upstairs the next day and it was much quieter. We weren't offered a refund for the first night, which would have been appropriate. The room was basic but clean. Breakfast was included, but served in the downstairs corridor so you had to carry anything you had to your room. Staff were helpful and moved our car for us when we couldn't park in the carpark due to a fire up the road. Parking was free. We wouldn't stay here again because it was just too basic and noisy. Noting special at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: Well it`s a little bit tired but location is fantastic, great for tour buses, and Hollywood BLVD. very freindly staff, free coffee 24hrs, but the breakfast was only basic. but all in all you could pay a lot more for the location just to get a flash hotel with flashy rates

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: PNL04
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in Hollywood for a few days or even longer, this hotel is in a great location, is clean, is value for money and the staff are wonderful, my husband and I will definitely stay here again next year

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: hushieprints
Reviews.Content: Good location at Hollywood area. Near metro if you are visiting Universal Studios. Breakfast was mediocre with muffins, croissants, breads, yoghurt, juices and coffee/tea. When we arrived at night, there was no one at the reception and we waited like 10-15 mins and finally saw someone at the end of the hotel moving some stuff. So he was the reception hiding somewhere. Not very helpful. Parking was tough! Though parking lot was near, there were no clear signage and the reception was not too bothered in giving proper directions. It was not very helpful being the first night in LA and arriving late at night and still had to look for the "hidden" parking lot. When we finally found it, there was only 1 lot left and parking was so tight! Room was big and there's a separate living room and kitchenette. Bathroom was small and i did not like the glaring spotlights in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a quick stay in Hollywood - Ottimo per visitare Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: morotrip
Reviews.Content: PROS: - In the heart of Hollywood, just behind the Hollywood Blvd. & the Kodak Theatre. - 100m from the Metro Station - Clean and quite silent rooms. - Free internet connection in the rooms. CONS: - Very basic breakfast - The staff at the reception didn't seem very prepared to meet the needs of the guests; I mean, just an example, we needed an electric A/C adapter, they didn't have one. - Not very clear online reservation procedure; when you make the reservation, you don't get to understand if you have paid or if you'll have to pay at the arrival (unless you check your bank account).

Reviews.Title: “Value plus quality.”
Reviews.Author: segreenie
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Celebrity's location is unique...quiet street but in the heart of Hollywood. The continental breakfast is OK but some additions, such as cereal (or maybe I didn't see it), would make it excellent. Parking is tight but FREE and the staff makes sure you get your car parked even when crowded. The staff is very professional and friendly. The hotel/rooms are "older" but nicely decorated and very well maintained. We 've stay at the Hollywood Celebrity whenever we visit Los Angeles because it is a quality hotel at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bob D
Reviews.Content: Older establishment with large clean rooms and complimentary Continental breakfast including yoghurts,toast, muffins and crossants. Hot tea/coffee available 24 hours in foyer.The location is perfect for a stay in Hollywood. Staff are excedingly friendly and helpful. Book your tours through the hotel for much less than you pay on the street. On your door step is the underground. Ride the underground one stop to Universal Studios for $1.50 each way. Don't pay tour operators $29 for a shuttle. The only down side for us was a noisy air conditioner. Despite this I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: MehulDesaiUK
Reviews.Content: We took one of the larger rooms which included living room and kitchen. Had no problems whatsoever. Good value and a great location. Ideal for first timers to Hollwood.

Reviews.Title: “best value fo money in all LA”
Reviews.Author: john-w1310
Reviews.Content: A great location only two minutes walk to the 'walk of fame". Wec were travelling with kids and the centralness to everything was geat Free parking in a secure area just topped it off. Management were always there to help and always had a smile on, wheather it was to order a pizza or find directions to a shopping mall for the mrs, they were awesome. Will be re-booking here for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: deb323
Reviews.Content: this hotel was fantastic, we have stayed in hollywood before, and had thought that was a great hotel, but this by far was the best! it is one of only 3 hotels in hollywood who dont charge for parking (most charge$25 per day) free tea/coffee 24 hours a day, free breakfast between 8- 10 free, with fresh muffins, cereal, yogurt, crosionts, toast. room we had was a king size room, with kitchen , this was fantastic as the kids where in the front area with own t.v and high speed internet which was also free, and the main bedroom with king size bed with t.v and internet acess. the location cant be beaten, a very short walk to main hollywood area, with shops and plenty of food areas, very quite location. the service with the staff was excellent extremely friendly and very happy. i would definatley recommend this hotel for familys staying in hollywood, as very secure location. if ever coming back to hollywood we would definatley stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelfooder
Reviews.Content: Best value for money in Hollywood. Minutes walk to walk of fame, staff extremly helpful and friendly. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Angela D
Reviews.Content: This Hotel ticked a lot of boxes for our recent visit. The location felt "safe" (travelling with children), it was handy to Kodak Theatre, Hollywood Walk, Restaurants etc. The rooms were clean, well priced and the staff friendly. The movie posters throughout certainly added to the charm of being in Hollywood. The complimentary breakfast was ok (cereal & fruit would have been nice but it was free). The free WiFi & Parking is a bonus and although there is no guest laundry it was an easy walk to a laundromat. The "California Pizza Kitchen" nearby did a great well priced meal with good service. We will certainly recommend this Hotel to family & friends and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: melanne41
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in October 2011 for 5 nights and found the following: Pros: -convenient,central location to Hollywood boulevard,easy, quick walk -continental breakfast included -free wifi (reasonably fast) in the room and free computer with Internet in the lobby -large room -free parking -mostly friendly staff although housekeeping could give a smile back when they are given one,only had contact 2 or 3 times with front desk staff, that includes check in cons: -strong overpowering cleaning product smell in the room,it didn't clear even after 5 days and our clothes reeked of it -bed only had one bedside table -the floors in the hallway is not carpeted so every footstep or luggage being wheeled is extremely loud (we were on the ground floor). overall though we liked the location the best, I would consider staying again for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Dont let looks deceive you.”
Reviews.Author: sussan_au
Reviews.Content: On first look at the Hotel we thought oh what have we done, but when we got inside we were pleasantly suprised. There was a large foyer area with reception desk. We were greeted by some friendly staff. The room was huge,king size bed,fridge ,table and chairs for eating breakfast also 2 large comfortable lounge chairs which could be re-vamped as they look a bit tired The hotel owners were in the middle of painting some of the rooms. And car parking at the rear with video surveillance. A 5 minute walk to Hollywood Blvd. The Complementry Breakfast was a great start for the day. We would stay here again and the price for our stay was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very good location.”
Reviews.Author: ilillo Posted by a Despegar traveler
Reviews.Content: Excelent service, front desk staff very kind and willing to help. The hotel room (Deluxe 2 King beds) was clean and everything was in order. Bathroom was clean allso. Hot water in the shower was dificult to regulate, but nothing terrible. Would come back to this hotel again. Parking was included in the rate. The parking lot is a bit small, but if you cant park there they refund the parking fee from a near parking lot at the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Kim S
Reviews.Content: The location was extremely convenient. If it weren't for the traffic you could be anywhere in 10-15 minutes. We felt very safe at the hotel and when walking to shopping and attractions. The Hollywood Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre and Chinese Theatre are just a minute walk away. It only took 10 minutes to drive to the Hollywood sign (a residential address I found online), less than 30 minutes to Venice, Santa Monica & Malibu beaches, less than 20 minutes to Rodeo Dr and tons of great shopping. The parking is free (unlike everywhere else you go in the area) but the parking lot is small and hard to maneuver. The room was clean but there was an air freshner smell when the a/c was running. The internet pictures are accurate but look much prettier than the real thing (like most hotels I'm sure). Overall it was a great experience and I would stay there again for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: KimD2009
Reviews.Content: Before writing this review I read the recent reviews from other recent travellers. I agree with all the comments. location is good for Universal Studios and Hollywood Walk of Fame, you feel safe walking around at night, the staff are friendly and helpful, the beds are comfortable and everything is clean. The free parking is a bonus and the breakfast is great - yoghurt, muffins, toast, coffee, juice. If you want 5* this isn't your place, but if you want a clean, comfortable, well situated hotel with helpful staff this is a great little hotel. I'd stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: Casey P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between 1 Oct and 5 Oct. They are in an amazing location behind the kodak theatre. It is incredibly close to everything but amazingly quiet! The room was very large. The only downside would be the smell of paint in the bathroom, as it had been freshly painted. I would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: taffydi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basically at the rear of the Kodak theatre right by the walk of fame, Chinese theatre and other Hollywood landmarks. Universal studios is a 10minute drive. It is safe to walk out at night and I was by myself for 1night. The rooms are clean, spacious and have kitchen facilities in most. The room I stayed in had a fridge, microwave and table, all I want is a fridge to keep my water cool. Maid service is daily and you choose if you want your towels changed by leaving them on the floor or hanging them up if you are going to use them again. They are equipped with a hairdryer, iron and ironing board. The tv has plenty of channels to watch, there is also an alarm clock radio and telephone. The telephone in my room wasn't working properly, I could hear the caller they couldn't hear me. I had about 6 calls from reception who couldn't seem to comprehend that the phone wasn't working properly and even had to check when I went to tell them. They asked me to return to the room to wait for someone to come up and check, I did this and was waiting 15minutes and no one came so I went to get my breakfast. Halfway through my breakfast the person came to check my phone and low and behold told me it wasn't working!!!! They changed it with a phone from another room. The breakfast is continental and complimentary and consists of bread for toasting, jam and marmalade, assorted cakes and pastries, fresh fruit, cereals, fruit juice, tea, coffee and water. They advertise breakfast is available until 10am and bang on 10am all the breakfast items are taken away. Just the tea and coffee are left which are available 24/7. Another plus point to this hotel is the free parking!!!!! A rare occurance in LA. The staff are helpful and knowledgable. The hotel is located in a quiet area, so noise when you are trying to sleep is not a problem. Although I did find the air con a bit noisy but I generally do anyway. A safe in the room would be a bonus, but I believe they are available at reception. Would I stay here again?.....Yes. Would I recommend it to a friend?....Yes

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: angwr
Reviews.Content: very close to major tourist sights. excellent service by friendly and helpfull staff. rooms large and comfy as well as clean. would definately recommend to friends and family. have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: CEMoore
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I recently stayed here. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A free continental breakfast is included, nothing fancy but is great to get the day started. The room was spacious and came with a full kitchen - great for bringing back leftovers. The interior of the hotel is a great reminder of old Hollywood which was perfect for us as complete movie buffs! We were in walking distance to just about everything we wanted to do. Even though the location is right behind the Kodak Theater and the shops at Hollywood and Highland with all the hustle and bustle, the room was incredibly quiet. The only minor complaints about the room were that there was some cosmetic fixes that needed to be made, but the building is probably an older building. Also, I think the carpet in our room had just been cleaned, so there was a strong soap smell when we first arrived. Having the fan on and the windows opened took care of the problem. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay and would return. Recommended for the location, staff and reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Clean and Comfortable, Friendly Staff, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyGray
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay in Hollywood. Close to Hollywood Blvd and the Walk of Fame, Kodak Theater, Graumann's Chinese Theatre, The Wax Museum and not far from Universal and Warner Bros Studios. The hotel was clean and comfortable, interesting retro styled decor, kitchenette in our room, free Wi-Fi, free parking, quiet, Highland Mall just a few steps away for all shopping needs and you could see the Hollywood sign from there also. The staff were awesome, nothing was ever too much trouble and service with a smile and friendly word always. Breakfast was included each morning and was adequate with pastries, toast and tea/coffee/juice. Recommend this hotel to anyone wanting good value, location, cleanliness and comfort and a smile to go with it!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff wonderful, central location.”
Reviews.Author: ShibbyandTank
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were surpassed when after arriving tired from a long flight we arrived approx 9.30 am and much to our surprise we were able to check in!! We had hoped for access to a shower room to freshen up but this was better still! I apologise that I can't recall the lady's name at reception but she was so friendly and helpful and clearly a great asset to the hotel. The room was clean, cool, adequate size and beds were comfortable. Being so close to all Hollywood's attractions and Kodak theatre meant we could walk everywhere local. The buses run regularly and were also easy to locate. Our only criticism is our room was adjacent to the hotel parking lot so we were disturbed from sleep both nights we stayed due to taxis/lifts arriving, tooting, bright headlights shining in our room and other guests coming and going on Harley motorbikes. It was no fault of the hotel or the very friendly staff but some guests do themselves and their country a great disservice by their inconsiderate behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel - Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Kim957
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Within walking distance of the kodak theatre and shopping centre. The staff here were so helpful and friendly they make your stay more enjoyable. Clean and spacious rooms. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location. Free parking”
Reviews.Author: nscott83
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night. It is in an amazing location, but in a quiet area. The room was large and comfortable, with a kitchen area so you can cook for yourself if on a budget. breakfast was reasonable, but could be improved with a health option, such as fruit.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AssafCohen
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of hollywood only 1 min from kodak theatre but in a quite street this hotel has the best location in the city. We absolutly loved it. Free parking (you can get a refund for pay parking), nice breakfast and h-u-g-e rooms make it a good value. Staff was helpful, and there was a free computer for interent!. We highly recommend it and for sure we will come back. *The only problem was that there was no safe in the room

Reviews.Title: “Great small boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mims6321
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with a friend whilst on a travelling trip of the usa and really enjoyed my stay. The location is fab as it is situated just behind the Kodak Theatre, and Hollywood Boulevard, so its very easy to walk to alot of the main attractions, or to be able to get to all the public transport links. We had a car so we ventured a little further, one great thing was that they had free parking at the hotel which is rare in LA. The hotel was very clean, great size rooms, comfortable beds and all rooms came with a small area with a fridge, microwave and table& chairs. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and there was a free continental breakfast and free wifi!! i work for thomas cook and travel alot staying in high grade of hotels and i would definatley recommend this hotel to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Harnesto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right behind the Kodak Theater and the area is quiet. The parking is small, but the rooms are quite big. They even have kitchen! They gave us a room just in the lobby and we thought we could not sleep, but we didn't hear any noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GourmetTravellers
Reviews.Content: This cute Art Deco hotel is in a great location, just one block from Hollywood Boulevard, literally behind the Kodak Theatre so its about a 5 minute walk to the attractions, bus tours and restaurants. The hotel itself is small but the room we had was huge, with a separate dressing area and small dining alcove with fridge. Wi-fi was free as was the breakfast although it is limited to toast, muffins, croissants and yoghurt and only started at 8am which is a bit late and everyone seemed to descend on it at the same time. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is no lift at this hotel and even though there are only two floors, you will have to carry your cases up the stairs. This is a good, clean, value for money budget option in a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “This is a really great place to stay, right in the heart on town.”
Reviews.Author: Phillip P
Reviews.Content: If you can go to the Magic Castle dinner a great night out, book a late dinner and go early to see more shows.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed for four nights in an Executive King Room on the ground floor and were very impressed with the accommodation in terms of value for money, service and location. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Super Clean”
Reviews.Author: sluggerdog_as
Reviews.Content: Everything we could have wanted in a place to stay. Very clean, the breakfast was good and the location was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “For a short visit of Hollywood and Beverly Hills, it is a great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Sorpheus
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located great to visit Hollywood and Beverly Hills. Low standard Hotel. Free Parking. WiFi was availible, but did not work in our room. No restaurant, but many availible in walking distance. Rate ok for summer and the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Room, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: funlovingcouple157
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel from the moment we walked in. The hotel is literally right behind all the tourist attractions of Hollywood. We parked the car and walked everywhere...loved that!! The hotel is small but very nice. The room was clean, smelled great, and was very very large. This is not a luxury hotel, but what you get for the money is very valuable. On top of that, when leaving town, the interstate is nice and nearby and easily accessible. We would stay here again if we visit Hollywood again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location ever!”
Reviews.Author: tessamc
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have to be the best location to everything. First timers to LA and this hotel had everything we needed , including exceptional service. The staff were so helpful and answered all our tourist questions without any problems. Hotel was really clean and nothing was a problem to staff. Would definitely stay there again and recommend 100%!!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: FaySJ
Reviews.Content: close to hollywood blvd only one block away, 5-10 minutes walk. free parking but very limited, about 13 parking spots, so if you go out at night and come back, there might not be a parking spot for you. the hotel info book posted that if there's no parking available they will get you a parking lot nearby but I don't know how close it would be. free breakfast with coffee, milk, juices, croissant, muffins, bread, yogurts. i got 2 full beds room to me was pretty spacious with a little table with 2 chairs, microwave, fridge. bathroom clean but the water kinda hard to adjust whether hot or cold, old style. they also charge for extra person for $20 each if you have more than 2. we have 2 adults and 2 kids so they charged only $10. overall good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!, Loved it!! Will definately be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gail V
Reviews.Content: What a Great Hotel! Rooms clean, comfortable, large - love the art deco style. Couldn't ask for a better location - steps away from everything. Staff, so nice and helpful. We enjoyed a wonderful breakfast on the outdoor patio. Loved the Hollywood photo's throughout the hotel. We had a wonderful stay, I just love this hotel!!! I'll be back!! Thank you, Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gi076
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good and the location is great!!!!Very close to Hollywood Boulevard. We enjoy out stay. I strongly suggest this hotel both for family and for friends. It is very good location also to go to Universal Studio, Griffith Park, Beverly Hills and downtown. Room are very spaciuos.Only the breakfast should be improved.

Reviews.Title: “overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: zac62
Reviews.Content: Definitely overrated , you pay much more than what you get. Stained carpet in the corridor, noisy air conditioning impossible to set on the right temperature, no elevator, no help with luggage the wireless did not reach our room, confusing informations from the staff.... For lower price you can get much more, even in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, Good location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: terezargh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights with my family in June. Our flight arrived early in the morning, however we only had to wait a little over an hour before our room was ready. Due to the location we were able to take a walk around Hollywood and Highland to pass time which was a short 2 minute walk from the hotel. Staff were incredibly friend and we usually got a cheery greeting every time we walked past the lobby. They were also very prompt when I sent email's to them before the trip. Breakfast provided in the morning, the same thing everyday but my family and I don't eat much so the Coffee, OJ and yoghurt were plenty for us. TV system was upgraded to HD while we were there so I assume there will be HD in every room now. Aircon system was an old one, so it was loud but it worked. Rooms were a good size with a little eating area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable - good location and parking”
Reviews.Author: crichterj
Reviews.Content: We had a fine room for a 4 persons family. No problems with car parking. Great location for Hollywood visits. Breakfast not too good. Not a room for breakfast - you should have the breakfast either at one of the four tables outside - or you should bring the breakfast to your room. Free internet worked fine. Front desk very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all... Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July at the start of a long trip along the West Coast... The hotel lobby is clean and the staff were friendly, even though it took an hour to get checked in because they claimed we had to pay for the room after I had pre-paid... They spent a lot of time messing around making phone calls to confirm all was in order... To be fair, they were not rude and there was obviously just a misunderstanding... After a long flight from Ireland, it was the last thing we needed, but it was comfortable in the air conditioned lobby and they apologised for keeping us before allocating the rooms... There is no elevator, so be prepared to haul you cases up a flight of stairs... The rooms were large and although dated, they were clean enough and comfortable enough for our short stay... Nothing special, but really OK. It was close to all the action, and a short walk down the street meant you were in the middle of a lot of shopping and restaurants... LA is huge, and you could easily end up a long walk from anything worth seeing... The car park was small and it was a tight squeeze to park the rental car up for the night and to get it out in the morning to do all the sight seeing... The breakfast was ok, with toast, juice, coffee, tea etc... But nothing special... There is no bar at this hotel. THINGS TO DO... Take a walk down the street where there is plenty do do, day or night... Drive up the the HOLLYWOOD SIGN... But be prepared to be unimpressed... You cant get as close as you would hope, but a short drive up all the interesting winding roads, past all the nice houses and you can get some good photo's and beautiful views of the city... Bring a Sat Nav... BRING. A. SAT. NAV. If you like Jim Morrison and The Doors, take a drive down Hollywood Boulevard and visit the Whisky a Go Go... There is also a motel (celta cienega) where there is a Jim Morrison room that he stayed in... There was no one in the room when we went, so we gave the guy a 5 dollar tip to let us look inside... It was very cool, and you can sign your name/messgae on the walls that are covered with messages from fellow fans... BEVERLY HILLS... Once again, be prepared to be unimpressed, but its still interesting... We bought a "Star Map" from one of the many people selling them on the street around that area... You can use your Sat Nav to go see the houses belonging all the biggest stars... The problem is, the are all super stars houses are pretty well hidden, but at least you can drive around all the mansions, and see how the other half live... VENICE BEACH... Its a 20 minute drive away, but it was excellent... Its just a really cool place... We wished we were staying around Venice Beach for a day or two... Lots to see, lots to do, street performers, shops, stalls, restaurants and plenty of characters... Really stood out for us... Don't miss it... T-Bag from the TV show Prison Break sat beside us and had his lunch... I could sit there all day having a few beers and watching the world go by. Al in all, the Hotel was a decent base, and we really only used it to sleep... We did have a few drinks in the rooms before we went out and it was quiet at night... We stayed in much nicer hotels during our trip, but it was fine, and if you want to be close to the action, then this is a perfect base. Any questions, just ask.

Reviews.Title: “OK but room was noisy”
Reviews.Author: Davidhatter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Hotel was OK but the room we had overlooked an apartment block where for two nights young people sat outside drinking & loud music could be heard up to 03:00 am. And we requested a quiet room! So I wouldn't necessarily expect a good night's sleep! Having said that, we could have asked to move rooms so I can't complain too much. Apart from that everything was fine.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location - Great non chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBBBracknell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to be close to hollywood and couldn't have chosen a better spot. Very quiet for the area with very little noise. Breakfast was ideal, what do other people expect, a full cooked breakfast, parking was easy, room was much bigger than your average chain and slept 3 with ease. Friendly receptionist and left our bags safely after checkout. Only gripes, room was next to the ice machine so some noise there and some talking outside room in a very large corridor/lounge. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & not a cookie-cutter motel”
Reviews.Author: CliftonTriangle
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for seeing the main part of Hollywood. The room was very large with a dressing nook, eating nook, refrigerator, and microwave. It was very comfortable for 4 people. We were in the "Shirley Temple" room. I'm guessing each room had a theme. Breakfast was minimal but adequate for continental breakfast and sitting outside under the umbrella tables was a nice way to start the day. Parking was free but required leaving your key with the desk so they could jockey in more cars. If you want a motel with character and close to Hollywood sights for a reasonable price, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “So-So Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deecog
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location for visiting Hollywood Blvd. The room was right by the front door and the lobby. Poeple were talking at 2:00am in the morning. My kids could not sleep. And the noise from the side walk was very loud all night long. The breakfast was just pastries and toast. Coffee was not very hot. But the customer service at the hotel was great. Very nice people at the front desk. The room was just in a bad location. It was room 102.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not the greatest stay.”
Reviews.Author: julesrf
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect for sightseeing on Hollywood Boulevard. The parking lot is extremely small (someone actually parked behind me, blocking me in). The only entrance is the front, even though the parking is in the back. The room was okay, but not the nicest I have stayed in. The door to the room wouldn't close properly, so we had to slam against it and lock it to get it to stay closed. The bathroom was a little run down and had a few ants in it. The kitchenette was a nice addition, but I didn't feel it was clean enough to actually use. The complimentary breakfast was late, so we were walking out as they were bringing it in. They did let us keep our car in the lot on the day of check-out so we could walk around for a little bit. The lobby is beautiful and there is a nice patio in front.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: graystoke62
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but the service was excellent - our luggage was looked after for two days - before check-in and after check-out. As mentioned elsewhere great location to the Kodak and Graumann's and not too far from Universal Studios. Large studio room with kitchen, continental breakfast with tables outside, perfect for the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: MwChan
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff are fantastic - so friendly, helpful, genuine - just some of the loveliest people I've ever met in a hotel!! Location is great - really close to some of the major Hollywood attractions. This hotel has no elevator though; understandable because its a really old building and only 2 levels, but will be a bit of a struggle if you're travelling with loads of luggage and your room is on the 2nd level but, no biggie. Breakfast is only so-so but rooms are clean and lovely; good value for money. Overall, a hotel that I'll definitely recommend to people!!

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: JandJ1376
Reviews.Content: We loved our 4 day stay at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel. The accomodations and breakfast were fantastic and there is a very nice and capable young man at the front desk named Raj who is really accomodating and goes above and beyond the call of duty. The water pressure was a bit low in the shower, but all in all we loved the hotel, and would easily stay there again. Coudos Raj - you're the man!!! Jim and Jeanne, (from Florida...June 29 - July 3).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BladesOnTour2011
Reviews.Content: Holiday couple from UK travelling California Hotels are a little pricey in LA and this seemed to fit our budget. We were glad we made the choice as the location is absolutely perfect, directly behind Kodak and Graumans theatre and safe (we didn't walk around after 10pm as it's LA after all) but before 10pm was fine. The staff are helpful and friendly and the rooms are fairly spacious and clean with A/C, HD TV and a dining table too. There is no restaurant, you can only get food at breakfast which is a nice spread of muffins, croissants, and bread/toast, jam, tea, coffee and juices. There is also a microwave for use should you need it. They do have a drinks vending machine though which is more than fairly priced compared to other places. Parking is free and we did managed to get parked although there are only around 12 spaces and it's a tight fit, but we had no issues. We were told that if parking at the hotel does happen to be full then the hotel will direct you to another parking lot which they refund the charge to you. Overall this is perfect for a short stay sightseeing in LA, although it's not really cheap the hotel price is good compared to most others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TonyBfZ
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the staff very very helpful! I would fully recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated for the places we wished to visit.”
Reviews.Author: 1honeydog1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was within walking distance of several places we wanted to visit. We were able to get to Univeral Studios by the underground train - station very near by. We found the staff at the hotel exceptionally helpful. The inclusive breakfast was good and adequate. The only minus comment - no lift.
