The rooms are nothing special but they are large and clean. The staff was very helpful. The parking lot is small but its free.. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect more than a bed to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Rodukas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located near the hotest part of Hollywood, and that's its key selling point. Otherwise, it's a classic hotel with no special interest. Rooms are rather clean, but the bathroom is a bit scary. What really pissed me off is when I woke very early to leave LA before the traffic jam and found that my car was parked at the very end of the parking lot, with 4 cars blocking mine. It took more than an hour for the hotel to get the keys of the other cars and let me get out. Of course, I then got stuck in the middle of the traffic...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Love4travels
Reviews.Content: Wow! Hotel was clean, room spacious with fridge and microwaves oven, free guest parking, wifi, continental breakfast included..not a recently renewed hotel, but it's very clean and his location was fantastic: walking 5min out of the hotel there is a big open air shopping centre, where you can have dinner...and if you walk through it you'll be directly on the Walk of Fame! And.. the hotel is a 15min by car from Universal Studios, 30min from LAX Airport, 15min from Beverly Hills and 30min from Santa Monica.... I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Tired yet spacious in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: miss_emc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic and needs a bit of an uplift, but is very roomy and has some decent facilities. The staff are very helpful and pleasent and the location is awesome - right behind the Kodak theatre and only a 5 minute walk from the Hollywood and Highland centre. It's fairly good value, and nice enough for a couple of nights but definately nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Faith01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Staff were fantastic. Great location. Walking distance to Hollywood's Walk of Fame. Also close to Metro station. Shuttle to Hollywood Bowl just around the corner. Restaurants and shops nearby. Free internet was provided and light breakfast. Quite large room which was clean with fridge.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mizzychizzy
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Los Angeles and we booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We arrived late evening after a 10 hour flight so we just wanted our bed. The staff on arrival were very friendly and immediately took our 3 large suitcases to our room. The room was a good size with lovely bedding. Everything was clean (which is the most important thing to us). The only thing that seemed a little tired was the toilet, which could benefit from being updated. Next morning we took a walk through the hotel and found it to be very charming. We loved the deco look. The breakfast was fresh and sufficient to let us have an early start. Yet again, the staff couldn't have been more helpful. On asking how to get to Hollywood Boulevard we were shown a building across the street and told to walk through the corridor to the end. We couldn't believe it we were in the centre of the Hollywood and Vine shopping mall. We looked up to our left and there was the Hollywood Sign up in the hills and to our right was Hollywood Boulevard. The hotel staff also told us the best tour company to use and where to find them. When we visit Los Angeles again, we will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in desperate need of an update.”
Reviews.Author: dcmaggie
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Celebrity Hotel is in a fantastic location: just a short walk from Hollywood Blvd. and all the famous attractions of Los Angeles. But it's in desperate need of an update. The hotel furniture, bed linens, and kitchen were all outdated. Our room faced the street and had a loud air conditioner; needless to say, it was pretty noisy. Parking was free, but the lot is very small, and if it's full, they have to send you somewhere else. The continental breakfast was bare: just muffins and juice. I suppose for the price it's a good deal, but this hotel is not for couples looking for a romantic weekend or business travelers looking for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - basic hotel with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Snowmanrk
Reviews.Content: We checked the reviews before staying here and the common message was that the staff were amazing - and they were! Really friendly, helpful and knowledgable about the local area. The guys helped us plan the next legs of our journey, giving us loads of their own ideas. The location is great and the hotel has a cozy, safe feel about it. Yea, rooms are a bit basic and have maybe seen their best, but in terms of value for money - out of this world. The included breakfast is also a nice personal touch. We loved it and would defo stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PMaloney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and would definitely recommend it. We looked at a number of 4/5 star hotels but they were at least double the price of this one. I would rate it as a decent 3 three star hotel. Reception: Friendly and very informative Room: Spotless but a little dated. There was a kitchette in the room if you require one. Location: Perfect to see hollywood and surrounding sites. We took one of the bus tours which departed 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. Secure Parking was free which was a plus as parking in other hotels that we looked at was approx 30 dollars per day. Breakfast was a bonus also and there was always a good selection of bread/coffee/cereals. There was free internet access in the room and there is also an internet PC beside the reception desk. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. From a value for money perspective it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location, staff, and cleanliness!”
Reviews.Author: WIllgtvert
Reviews.Content: We viewed all of the sights around Hollywood and LA and thoroughly enjoyed our trip. There is a back entrance from the end of Orchid Ave that leads to the mall area, so it is a quick walk to Hollywood Blvd. Yes, the hotel is a little outdated and doesn't have an elevator, but the rooms are very clean and the staff is always there to help. We had a little street noise from Franklin Dr, but we slept through it easily. The free wifi only reaches to the lobby and patio area, so don't expect it in your room. The staff knows the area, metro routes, and anything else you need really well and are always willing to please. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again if I were to ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location!”
Reviews.Author: bellsy1
Reviews.Content: Can't complain at all about this hotel. Large room, cheap price, friendly service, free internet in room and lobby, free (but basic) breakfast, free parking, and close to a lot of sights and the Metro. Has a small fridge in the room as well which we always find handy. Seems to be an American thing, but it would be great to have some basic cereals for the breakfast rather than bagels & sweet things. Would stay there again and recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: truenorth27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easily accessible from the airport metro if you don't have a car. Close to Hollywood Highland shopping centre, the walk of fame, Kodak Theatre, El Capitan theatre. Universal Studios is only one metro stop away. The reception staff are so helpful. When you stay at this hotel you are able to book a dinner at the Magic Castle which is about a 5 min walk away. Request a ground floor room (I don't think there are lifts?). The vending machine has water at such a cheap price - 75c!! There is complimentary breakfast in the lobby (7 or 8am til 10am)- we took it back to our room to eat (there is no seating area). There were bagels, cream cheese, chocolate and blueberry muffins, croissants, oj, other juices and tea and coffee. Tea and coffee was also available all day. The room itself was nice, with a little sitting area (table and chairs, fridge).

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Celebrity is a good deal”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: I just stayed a couple of nights at the Hollywood Celebrity--it's a fine basic hotel. It's located literally behind the Hollywood/Highland shopping center, from Hollywood Boulevard you walk through a corridor of the shopping center to reach the hotel (this seems cool to me--maybe the "hidden gem" thing). It's on the same block with the Hollywood Orchid and other hotels. There's nothing fancy, but the room was big, clean, had a good bed, enough light, good darkness at night (the curtains closed all the way, which often isn't the case, though the window was a bit small). The shower was good, but the bathtub didn't look very comfortable to me--a bath taker. There was a kitchen area with a decent sized refrigerator, no minibar (hooray) and a table. There is no microwave, but I'm guessing you could use the one downstairs in the breakfast area. Had my wife been there, she would have bemoaned the lack of a desk--there was the kitchen table and a "living room" table. The location is excellent. I was traveling car-free--the Hollywood/Highland subway station is right at the front of the shopping center, a number of bus routes (perhaps most notably the Fairfax Avenue line) stop there too. I was able to walk back from Theatre Row around Santa Monica & Vine to the hotel. I'm not really into the Hollywood Boulevard stuff--except for an excellent late meal at Loteria Grill--but if you are the location is ideal. I wanted to hit some good breakfast places, so I didn't try the hotels. I very much appreciated the public access computer, used it several times. The hotel was quite happy to hold my suitcase in lieu of a late checkout. Quibbles--It gets hot in the 2nd floor hallway, the air conditioning doesn't seem to reach there (it's fine in the room), the Franklin Ave. side of the hotel where my room was gets traffic noise (I wound up running the fan, bad for energy, but drowns out the noise), the TV only accesses a few channels, which is probably on balance a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Titiangold
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find!! Ideally situated 5 minutes from Hollywood Boulevard, Hollywood & Highland Centre (including the best views of the Hollywood sign) and a lot of the sights on my itinery. Room was large and while the furniture was a little old fashioned, it had everything we needed during our stay. The free breakfast had a good selection of breads/pastries etc along with juice & coffee. The gym, while small, had enough equipment for a quick work out in the morning and didn't seem to be overcrowded. There was also free wifi and free to use pc in the lobby. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful & friendly and I would definately stay here again and recommend to all my friends :-)

Reviews.Title: “Beware Of Room 114: Noise is Horrible”
Reviews.Author: memesq
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location next to everything Hollywood and is clean but with one caution: Just stayed in room 114 on May 16. Room 114 is located on bottom floor by staircase, by employee only door/room next to it, and with parking lot of hotel outside of window. A ridiculous amont on noise from the parking lot, upstairs above us, the staircase and the employee room kept my wife and I up most of the night. Thumping, yelling, car noise, cell phone usage---ridulous. Most noisy hotel room I have every had; and my wife and I travel alot. Also, you might want to know that the hotel staff stuffs more cars than stalls in the small hotel parking lot so if you park in the lot you may have a car(s) blocking your path out unless the hotel staff moves the cars. I won't dis the entire hotel because on the good location, the cleaniness of the room, and the front desk person promptly moving cars out of my car's way before I completely blew a fuse (I was already pissed after being kept up all night as described above). But do yourself a favor, if you do decide to stay at this hotel, avoid room 114 like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LouLouLouey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and loved this hotel. We had a huge room (with 2 king size beds) and a kitchenette. Everything in our room and in the foyer etc was very clean. The staff were very friendly, polite and helpful when answering our questions. The continental breakfast that was available was a nice touch. The location is unbeatable if you want to see the Hollywood sights - within walking distance of the Kodak theatre, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, the Hollywood sign, the Walk of Fame etc etc. There are also lots of shops and restaurants in the area, and it is only a few minutes from the Metro (only one stop to Universal Studios). The cost of our room represented great value for money. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: MyNameIsWhat
Reviews.Content: I was in town playing with a band for a couple of nights. We booked this hotel based on recommendations read here. The hotel is right off Hollywood Blvd. There was secure, monitored parking with no additional fee. We didn't worry about our gear at all. The hotel was quiet, & there were bagels, etc. for breakfast. Good coffee around the clock. Rooms were very clean and staff was friendly. Lots of international guests. Good place for families, but no pool. Many great things to see within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value , Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: flameleafmom
Reviews.Content: We ended our Spring Break Vacation in Hollywood and stayed at the Celebrity due to the recommendations on TA. We weren't steered wrong. We reserved early and got a AAA rate for 2 brm suite that was great. The staff was helpful and there is internet access. The only donwgrade is that the bathrooms need to be upgraded. Our sink was cracked as well as tiles.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: elzini
Reviews.Content: Really well located for sightseeing in LA. Universal Studios is very close (a short bus ride) as are the Chinese and Kodak Theatres. The hotel is clean and spacious and has free internet in the lobby. Breakfast is a self service buffet of muffins, crossiants, coffee, tea, juice and did us well. There was a table in our rooms so we could take breakfast back ot our room and eat there. Parking is in a nearby car park and given LA is a nightmare to park in is very handy (just get your ticket from reception first). The staff were very helpful to us while we were there. Reception also can book any LA trips for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for your money, location of 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lana094
Reviews.Content: What a great choice we made with this hotel! Location is unbelievable: close to main attractions, yet on a very quiet street. Free parking, very helpfull and friendly staff. Rooms are outdated. but clean. If you are not looking for luxury, but for clean and convinient place to rest at night, it's the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “3 out of 5, great location, but could do with an update”
Reviews.Author: SimAndBek
Reviews.Content: pros. - excellent location, behind kodak theatre / graumans chinese theatre - very friendly staff, helpful. - free continental breakfast, buffet style, standard but nice, also fresh -high speed internet worked excellent, ( not wifi ) (cabled but long cable) -large rooms with walk in robe area for the ladies -free parking for our hire car cons. -hotel seemed old, but not run down or dirty, just old. -linens are in need of replacing - (caretakers)??? children running around lobby for what seemed like hours, nightly

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly place in good location”
Reviews.Author: Yanivek
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hollywoos celebrity hotel for 3 nice nights. The location is perfect in hollywood and for Universal and the stuff is very nice and helpful. Room was OK and clean enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay in Hollywood then this is a convienient, cheap & friendly place.”
Reviews.Author: Kelly-Jayne
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in Hollywood, thankfully only a quick overnight stop this time! My Hubby, Mum & Dad found the Celebrity Hollywood Hotel to be in an extremley convienient location, minutes walk to Mann's Chinese Theatre and all the tourist spots but in a quiet side road behind the Hollywood/Highland Centre with limited noise and friendly/helpful staff. The art deco interior is a nice touch, the rooms however are in need of modernisation. Although they are massive (to say the least) the bathrooms are shabby with poor shower facilities, old tired towels and the beds are not the most comfortable. Have said all this you have to remember this is Hollywood and you don't get much for your $ dollar so the fact that a reasonable continental breakfast was included, there was free internet access at a stand alone PC in the lobby and they made an effort with availability of gym/leisure equipment you can't really fault the place! Also there is a lovely patio with chairs/tables out front of the hotel which we found to be a great suntrap in the morning. The staff at the Celebrity Hollywood Hotel really make the place what it is, they are very friendly and always willing to assist. They even stored our luggage for us all day even after we had checked out as we had a late evening flight..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: poohisgreat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and so cute!! The hotel personnel were super nice and helpful! The room was much larger than I expected. It had an outcove for a kitchen (micro, fridge, table). Two large queen beds with extra room on both sides. The location is super great. Within a stones throw to a nice outside mall and Hollywood blvd. For the price you really can't get much better. I used my AAA card and got the room for $99.00. It included a light breakfast! I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the sites”
Reviews.Author: mainenewengland
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the internet. True to form it was very close to all the attractions in Hollywood and within walking distance. The front desk people could not have been nicer and more helpful. The rooms were old and not in the best condition. At night there were alot of people running around in the halls which was uncomfortable.Taxi fares were outrageous though . It wasn't too bad walking around at night in that area. If you don't care about the rooms this is the place,reasonable and close by.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: thewilleffect
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel to stay at with my girlfriend after picking it from the Lonely planet guidebook and reading other reviews on this site. When I arrived I was very impressed by the desk/check-in staff ( Alvin in particular) whom were very friendly, informative, accomodating and professional. When we got to our room, it was huge! Was very clean and had alot of amenities; fridge, cable tv, internet, closet, bathroom and a huge bed.There is also free guest parking subject to space. A continental breakfast is available that while limited is still delicious and filling. By some standars it may be viewed as basic but it was more than enough for us. The location of the hotel is excellent too, being right behind the Kodak theatre and literally less than five minutes walk from the mall at hollywood and highland and the Kodak theatre. We were so impressed with the hotel that we went back to stay there for a few days when we were getting ready to depart LA. We have been travelling for over ten months and this hotel stands out as one of the best experiences we have had while staying at accomodation. I would definitley return and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: SeatheMagic
Reviews.Content: My 8-year-old daughter and I stayed at The Hollywood Celebrity Hotel for one night in February, while in Hollywood to attend a red carpet movie premiere (my daughter won the red carpet tickets from Disney). We arrived around 10 am on a Tues. Parking was no problem and our room was already ready. The staff made sure we saw the breakfast and invited us to join in. We got settled and immediately headed out to Hollywood Blvd for a LONG day of waiting to meet the Disney Channel stars at the El Capitan Theater. The location of the hotel is awesome for going to the El Capitan or other famous Hollywood Blvd Theaters. We left the car parked and walked there in just a few minutes. At 8:30pm at night the streets were very crowded with people (particularly familes with children since the streets had been lined with people waiting to see the Disney stars) and so we felt safe to just walk back to the hotel. The room is what you would expect for a 2-3 star hotel. Well appointed, and clean. Not fancy, but everything you would need. As a mom on her own with her daughter we felt safe and comfortable. The service at the hotel was fantastic from check-in to check out. The value of the hotel for the location and level of service (including continental breakfast and free parking) was outstanding. If we found ourselves headed to Hollywood in the future, we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Hollywood Celebrity was a gem.”
Reviews.Author: MizzVCanada66
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night here a Friday and was quite happy with the hotel, service and location. The Hollywood Celebrity is an older hotel that is being revamped, it is what would be considered a basic hotel with not a lot of flash but it is clean, very well priced and the staff are friendly and glad to have your business. The 24 hour coffee/tea service was enjoyable and the location just off of Hollywood boulevard is exceptional. We would definitely stay here again. Keep up the great hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, service and location!”
Reviews.Author: ZuluGoose
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Hollywood Celebrity after reading mixed reviews on trip advisor. However this place was great for the price and anyone who rates this place badly is obviously hard to please! The room: Big spacious rooms, great air conditioning, seperate bathroom area with shower over bath, wardrobe and dressing area, kitchen area with table, microwave, fridge/freezer and kettle. The service: Computer with unlimited free internet access provided in the lobby, staff very helpful about locations around LA, free parking area (although admittedly this was small, however we always managed to find a space and when the car park is full the staff will show you to somewhere else nearby you may also park for free. The breakfast: Great selection of muffins, bagels, croissants, juices etc. Although only two chairs downstairs so we took plates etc up to the room and had breakfast at our table. Location: Right behind the Hollywood and Highland mall on Orchid Avenue. You can walk through the mall to be straight on Hollywood Blvd. Great hotel for the price, a tad grubby on the outside but more than made up for on the inside! Has a nice patio area, also has a small fitness centre ad spa (however we never used these). There was no pool, but this wasnt a problem as we were later going to Santa Monica!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ausgal81
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting L.A. The most friendly staff we encountered on our travels. Such a great location, one block to hollywood boulevard-but far away enough not to be overwhelmed by all the tourists! Rooms were large and accomadating with all ameneties. Great continental breakfast everyday from 8-10am, so if you want to sleep in a little you can still make breakfast. Gym, steam room all available! Truly a great hotel! 5 star rating for service and location!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: makingmymark
Reviews.Content: The location for our stay in Hollywood couldn't have been better. It was a very short walk to the Shopping Centre and Hollywood Blvd. The Metro and Buses were easy to get around on and the gentleman on the front desk at the hotel couldn't have been more helpful with maps and lots of info. You get what you pay for with the room. Considering the price we paid it was good value. I would recommend this hotel to families wanting good value, great location, helpful staff, but don't expect the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: mdcrim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity for 3 nights over Thanksgiving. What a charming place. Pros: The staff are WONDERFUL and very friendly. The rooms are gigantic. The location is great-right behind the Highland shopping center and all that Hollywood has to offer. The rooms have Queen/ King beds instead of the Full/ Queen beds that are more typical of LA rooms. Free parking! Free continental breakfast. Free internet in the rooms and use of hotel computer in front lobby. Cons: The hotel is old. It is very, very clean for its age and was probably updated pretty recently, but the windows allow lots of street noise into the rooms. You can mitigate this by turning on the fan (window unit). That is the only con I can think of. Honestly, if they replaced the windows and did a full renovation (granite/ tile, etc) they would probably be able to command 3 times what they charge. I'll take the old and clean for the price and will most definitely stay here on my future trips to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, convenient Hollywood location”
Reviews.Author: Ollie06
Reviews.Content: We only had a brief stay at the Celebrity Hotel as our stay in LA was brief but we selected it on the basis of other travellers’ reviews on this website. The hotel is a LONG way away from the airport and an expensive taxi ride away, but it is in an extremely good location in Hollywood and that is one of the main reasons to stay there. It is literally a few steps away from a comprehensive shopping centre and the Hollywood Walk of Stars. It is also very close to an underground Metro station and 1 stop away from Universal Studios by Metro. The rooms are quite large and certainly comfortable, but a little on the tired side and could do with a bit of a refresh. Each room does have air conditioning. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel also offered breakfast in the price, and the bagels with condiments were a great start to the day shared in the downstairs lobby or outside on the terrace. The hotel has free internet service also located in the lobby. The staff at the hotel are exceptionally helpful and friendly. We planned and organised all our activities with them directly and they even had a taxi waiting for us for our transfer to the airport when we had quite a tight schedule. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel and the tired rooms are not that big of a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Staff very friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: AlanandValerie
Reviews.Content: We had two stays at this hotel during our time in California. What a location! It is in a quiet 1930's Art Deco street yet on the other side of the same block there is bustling Hollywood Boulevard. It is literally 5 minutes walk from The Chinese Theatre, The Kodak Theatre and The Magic Castle. The staff are fantastic and are always ready to provide help and advice if needed. Free internet was welcome as was the buffet breakfast (croissants, bagels,muffins,coffee and juice). The rooms are a comfortable size and are very good value when you consider the location. We would certainly stay there again when we are next in Hollywood. Alan & Valerie - Surrey, UK.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Celebrity stay”
Reviews.Author: linda76CA_Fullerton
Reviews.Content: We look thru all reviews regarding Hollywood Celebrity hotel before we booked one night stay at there. When we reached the hotel, there was no convenient passageway to drag our medium size luggage up to the reception and room(2nd level) but the hotel staff did offer to help. Hotel location to Chinese and Kodak threatre is great, 5 mins to reach but car parking is a problem. They have a small parking area behind the hotel and it's really too narrow and troublesome, car jam when you try to drive out early in the morning. Room and bathroom are acceptable if you don't mind old and not too much privacy you can have. Breakfast;a little small area- placing all the bread and coffee/tea maker.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: thesubtleknife
Reviews.Content: A good, well priced option. The rooms were nothing sophisticated but were comfortable and a decent size. The location was good, just a couple of minutes walk away from Hollywood Boulevard and the Chinese Theatre. We joked that cutting through the passageway that joined the Highland shopping centre to the road the hotel was on was like walking through a portal to another world, as the hustle and bustle gave way to peace and quiet. Ok, so it’s slightly dated. So what? It was clean enough and it’s not a boutique hotel. I’m sure one day it will be refurbished and the prices will shoot up. I’d rather have the décor as it is, and the price stay as is too. There was a nice patio area at the front of the hotel where you can have you breakfast, and we also used it to sit and chat in the evening a couple of times. The car park is tiny but is free, the staff were helpful, internet access was free. Breakfast was good, quite simple (bagels, cereal, juice) but plentiful and tasty. I’d definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK - Hotel”
Reviews.Author: magician84
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Celebrity Hotel for 4 nights in October 2008. I have stayed there before in 2007, so I kind of knew what to expect. Had my room on the 1st floor to the right. The rate was 144 USD per night, including free internet connection, parking and "basic breakfast". The hotel is located within walking distance to Hollywood's main attractions and almost opposite of the Magic Castle which is the main reason why I stay at the Celebrity hotel. Please note that the parking space of the hotel is limited, but they will refund you if you can not park in the gated parking area of the hotel. When I walked back to the hotel one evening I noticed that other hotel guests blocked my car with their cars - so pay attention.. .In my case it was no problem since I went to bed directly. The room was a little bit outdated but clean and "ok". I liked the bathroom, certainly not very new but quite practical and clean - except one (1) hair found in the tub. The complimentary breakfast is nothing special but a nice thing to start the day. After my stay at the Celebrity I always have an "ok" feeling - meaning that I was treated well and I have received a good service in return of my money. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: kelwez
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of September. Check-in was fast and we were given a room on the second floor which we requested in the booking - room 212. The room is huge and clean, yes it could do with a little updating but it is perfect for what you need. The bed is comfortable and there is a huge fridge in the room. The staff were second to none with helping us with directions, they also remembered my boyfriend who had stayed there before. (They even called us one morning to check we had got back OK from Anaheim and offered us a later check out!) The complimentary breakfast is great with croissants, bagels, muffins, tea, coffee, juice etc, we took it to our room each morning. There is also free internet access in the reception area. The location is fantastic - it takes 2 minutes to get to the walk of fame, Kodak theatre, bus stop, train station, tour companies etc. If we go back to LA we would definitely stay here again, you could not ask for better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “not for handicapped visitors~! No handicapped parking”
Reviews.Author: amberSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just stayed in this hotel last night. We had chosen this hotel because of the free parking but were disappointed to find that there was only one parking space per room. We had come from different parts of the state so we had two cars. I have handicapped access due to MS and I was forced to park in a lot in a huge parking structure and I had to pay $10.00, which they would not reimburse or shuttle me to or from. I had to walk back and forth in the heat of the day. I was exhausted. They also put us on the second floor, and they have no elevator. Not all of us who need handicapped access look like we do. I asked to speak to a manager but the male front desk clerk said that would do me no good on a Saturday because a manager was not there until Monday. Very disappointing considering the reviews I read before I stayed there. I love to stay in small places because the service is usually better, but maybe that doesn't apply to this place on the weekends~! Beware fellow handicappers!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money, friendly staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rogermauricemartin
Reviews.Content: We staid 6 days in this hotel. the hotel is very close to Hollywood Bld on a small street. It is a quiet as could be US hotels without double glass windows. Is was renovated and it is perfectly clean. We had a queen suite with kitchennet. One TV in each room. The table set is not cleaned by the staff. Breakfast is dim but complementary and enough to start the day. Parking is included. I red many review about this parking : I do not understand ! Of course it is small, but we had no problem to park our car. The last day, as our plane was late in the evening, they agrreed we left our car in there parking until our departure. Nice ! If you are not an 'early bird', avoid the rooms that are close to the place where breakfast is served ! Most of all, the staff is very friendly and alway give information and maps with a smile !! Free internet computer.

Reviews.Title: “great location- cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Perthchik
Reviews.Content: Booked this place for only 3 days, you wouldn't want to spend too much time here, but really what are you doing in the hotel in LA! For the price and the location it's really cheap! but the bathroom and bedroom need some serious updating. It wasn't dirty as such, just dated and old. Sheets were clean, but the shower was a bit mouldy and the bathroom window did look straight into next doors pool. Overall I would give is a 5 out of 10. It's really not the best place to stay, and by all means look around for something this cheap in the same location. but with a 1 minute walk and your on the hollywood walk of fame! but behind the kodak theatre so you don't get any hassles or loudness at night, ya can't really complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ncmc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Hotel Hollywood Celebrity for three nights in August. We paid $139 per night for the room. I will break this review in to the different areas of the hotel. Location: The location of this hotel is second to none. It is on a small cul-de-sac, literally two minutes walk from Hollywood Boulevard, so within two minutes you can be at the Kodak Theatre, Walk of Fame, Mann’s Chinese Theatre, Hollywood and Highland shopping centre, the Metro stop and the start of the sight-seeing tour route. I can’t imagine a better location for the price if Hollywood is where you want to stay. Checking in: Our first impression of the hotel was good. There is 15min limit on parking in front of the hotel, so there was ample space to pull up the car and unload our luggage. The lobby is nice, very bright, clean and airy. The man who checked us in was very pleasant and check in took less than 5 minutes, we were given a pass to place in the front of the car that entitled us to free parking in the hotel car park (more about this later). The room: We were in room 207, which was right beside the stairs, the hotel was quiet though and we were never disturbed by people coming and going. The room itself was huge, with a king size bed, which was extremely comfortable. The room is a little dated and lacks a bit of style, but it was clean and functional. The curtains had blackout lining, so no morning sun peaking through. The room had an air-conditioning unit, which was noisy, but kept the room at a lovely cool temperature. There was a small eating area with a table, chairs and fridge. I believe some rooms are equipped with a microwave and other kitchen equipment, but we did not need any more than the fridge, as we were only there 3 nights. There was a great wardrobe/dressing area with a huge, well-lit mirror, table, chair, iron, ironing board and hairdryer. Having this separate area was great as the bathroom was on the small side and it meant I could do my hair and makeup without crowding the hubby! The bathroom let the room down a little, it was very spartan and the fixtures and fittings were a little grotty and scratched. We were only left with two bath towels and then two hand towels that were too small to wrap around my hair (and I have quite short hair). It wouldn’t be a big deal for them to leave more towels and save people having to ring down looking for them. The main problem we had with the room was the shower. No matter what we did, we could not get the water to a comfortable temperature, the minute you got it right, it would start running cold and then boiling hot. In all the showers we had, neither of us had one were we weren’t scalded or frozen! Over all the room was fine, but could do with a little updating, very little expenditure could make the room beautiful. Breakfast: The room rate includes breakfast that consists of bagels, cream cheese, muffins, croissants, juice, tea and coffee. It is laid out in the lobby and you simply bring what you want to your room. It was very tasty and fresh and although simple, we found it got us up and running for the day and meant we could start sightseeing first thing. Parking: The hotel has free parking in a small parking lot just around the corner from the hotel itself. There isn’t usually a problem getting a space during the day, but beware if you are taking your car out at night. We returned at about 11pm and the car park was full, as was the area in front of the hotel. We had to park in the Hollywood and Highland car park around the corner. The hotel did reimburse us for the price of the parking, but it was a bit of a nuisance. Still, free parking when they could very easily charge for it is a major bonus and they had no qualms about reimbursing us the price of the parking. Overall, this is a great hotel for the money. The staff are friendly and accommodating, the rooms are big and clean and the free parking and breakfast is a great perk. My only slight gripe is that the rooms and bathroom are dated and could do with a revamp, but then they would probably bump up the price to match! I would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to anyone going to LA looking for a budget friendly option in an amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “what a find!”
Reviews.Author: rhpmsfo
Reviews.Content: I confirm all the excellent remarks already made about this hotel. Fantastic location, good rates, outstandingly helpful staff, comfortable spacious accommodation with breakfast thrown in, free internet excess! We were only staying one night and had a late flight out the next day. We managed to squeeze in universal studios on the first day thanks to the reception's suggestion and help in booking and the next day, when we had a late flight out, the reception not only looked after our luggage while we went out for the day after check out but also allowed us to freshen up in the gym showers! Definitely the place for us if we're in LA again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hollywood Celebrity and would stay again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: basique
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of this hotel before reading reviews about it on this website. I had initially booked another hotel in Beverley Hills and changed it to Hollywood Celebrity after seeing the rave reviews. We stayed here as part of our Honeymoon trip and loved it!!! The location is excellent, the facilities were great for such a great value for money hotel and the staff were super friendly. The free breakfast of bagels and crossaints and juice was great as we could just grab something and get going...The bathroom is a bit outdatted but really it does the job!! I wil definitley come back and stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pje39
Reviews.Content: The location was superb - the parking was interesting - the rooms very large but the bathrooms could do with updating. the staff were really helpful and the Hotel Manager was really friendly. The free breakfast was good as was the tea and coffee. the veranda was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: snoopy200
Reviews.Content: Celebrity Hotel is a nice-looking hotel. Staff is very helpful. But, we woke up with BEDBUGS crawling on us. The were under the mattress and on the sheets. And there was blood spots on the sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money & Location”
Reviews.Author: carebear42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel for three nights late in May this year. The staff was fantastic and even charged our Ipods on their personal computer for us. The free breakfast was a great bonus. The rooms were big and roomy with the rooms regularly cleaned. For the price that you pay for this hotel it was a great deal. The location is great, just near the walk of fame & the Chinese theater. We caught the subway to Universal Studios which was only two stops away. There is a huge range of shopping and food outlets near this hotel so there is plenty to do. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a cheap but quality place to stay. Believe me the staff will take great care of you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kflashu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel for 4 nights and enjoyed our stay. We had 2 large connecting rooms with a kitchen. The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable and the breakfast was very nice. The staff were very helpful. The hotel was very close to the Chinese theatre and the walk of fame. Also it was close to the Hop on Hop off bus service and the Metro. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: CountrygirlAustralia
Reviews.Content: Another great find in our US trip. I liked this place and the rooms were just wonderful. A full kitchen and plenty of space plus comfortable beds with nice crisp sheets. Good price, we were very happy. This hotel is location, location… and because it is tucked down a side street, it is away from the traffic. There is a building next door that was noisy one night and could be a bit noisy over a weekend I would think, but it didn't bother us at all and certainly didn't spoil our stay. You walk out of the front door and through the building at the end of the street right onto Hollywood Boulevard. It was hustle and bustle there all the time and we were in the right spot to book tours etc. Will Smith had his premiere of his latest movie and we had a ring side view. The decor in the hotel is good, the feel of the place is friendly and homely. Breakfast was not fantastic but there is coffee available 24 hrs a day and of course you can make your own if you choose in your kitchen. We were on the ground floor, there are only two levels but it could be hard taking your cases upstairs if you were older or disabled. Just a word of warning – they have guest carparking at no charge which was a great bonus. However, it is only a small parking lot and as we were checking out (at 5 am) my partner went to get the car so that we could drive to the airport. 3 other cars were parked in front of ours and the guy at the desk only had two sets of keys! Eventually (after waking someone up) he got the 3rd set but… he didn’t have a drivers licence so my partner had to move the 3 other cars, get ours out, then put them back!! Fortunately we weren’t late and the hotel staff member was so apologetic we eventually all had a laugh about it. Just make sure you allow enough time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: JROB1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2007 for 4 nights. It's location is perfect for Hollywood and it's just a 3 minute walk around the corner. Also excellent as a base if you have a car and want to go off exploring LA. The staff were great. Welcoming, cheerful and always happy to help. One reason we chose this hotel was for the free parking. Although this is only a small hotel, the car park was always busy. On one occasion we returned after midnight and found it full. We parked outside the main entrance to the hotel in a red zone. The chap behind reception (who I think was the manager) offered to pay for us to park in the multi-story or leave the car where it was and if we got a ticket, he'd pay for it! The room was spacious and included the biggest bed I have ever slept in. I found out from a friend who lives in LA that it was called a California King. It was huge and extremely comfortable. It included en suite bathroom with shower, dressing table with big bulbs all around it like something you would find in a filmstar's dressing room. The overall hotel cleanliness was excellent. Our room was cleaned once a day including fresh towels. Only one thing I did notice was the carpet leading from the stairs on the 1st floor was a little stained. It just needed a quick shampoo. Don't let that put you off though. Overall this hotel is excellent and I have already recommended it to a work collegue who is staying there this coming August.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: OzGirl_1974
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel. Stayed for 3 nights with my husband in June 2008. Once again we weren't disappointed. Our room was on the second floor, with a king sized bed, small sitting area, bathroom with a tub, separate vanity mirror area for getting ready, and large hanging space for your clothes. Breakfast is included free of charge consisting of muffins, croissants, bagels, tea, coffee, juice. They also have coffee available all day. Computer with free internet access available in the foyer. Also a small gym. The hotel is in the best location, directly behind the Hollywood Highland Centre and Hollywood Boulevarde. Hotel staff very accommodating, holding our luggage from checkout at midday until our transfer to LAX at 6pm. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: SamandAneta12tree
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at the Celebrity Hotel beginning of May. This is not a 4 or 5 star hotel...its a no frills, budget accommodation that is clean and friendly. We were very happy staying here. The location is excellent. Its on a quiet side/back street just seconds walk away from the Highland Complex (great restaurants, shops, night clubs) and a minute more to Hollywood Boulevard. On the Boulevard on any given day or night there is plenty of action going on with crazy buskers, pubs, clubs, shopping and all things Hollywood hip. The usuals like the Kodak theatre, Graumans Chinese Theatre, Walk of fame all stones throw away. The Boulevard a few years back was supposed to be very seedy but we saw none of this and felt very safe at all times. The staff at hotel were very friendly, helpful and professional and didn't mind a casual chat with us when ever we were in reception. This kind of relaxed attitude and atmosphere was welcomed after a long day exploring L.A. Our room was huge with cable TV, free internet (if you have a lap top), good size but clean bathroom, a small vanity area, small but adequate kitchenette and a table and chairs. Fresh delicious bagels and muffins are put out just near the reception area for breakfast. You can take these bagels, along with fruit juices and coffee back to your room. As mentioned before this is not a flashy hotel, but a clean, good value place that should suit this frame of mind when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Not a WOW! hotel- but 5* for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: siuling
Reviews.Content: Basically the hotel was fab for what we spent. The hotel: -clean -the front desk people were friendly -had no room service -not bad bagels and croissants for breakfast (which were free) -free in-room internet -free computer with internet downstairs to use (however there was no printer/printing service) -fantastic central location (right behind-literally, the Kodak theatre and Hollywood Highlands mall on Hollywood Blvd) -small 'gym' and steam room (which looked like it was never used before) -free coffee/tea/hot water downstairs in the foyer -microwave and toaster to use downstairs -without elevators- i believe the hotel is only two levels, so lugging luggage was only a bit of a pain -with a decent number of TV channels- i'm not sure what the non-cable tv channels are in the US, but we were happy with the HBO channels -traffic going TO the hotel may at times be heavy depending on whether or not special events around the area were taking place, for example, there was an event at the Hollywood Bowl (very close by) and so traffic was a little heavier going back to our hotel -the whole 'Celebrity' thing wasn't all that impressive, even though its called the 'Hollywood Celebrity Hotel', but whatever, the hotel is a little run down and could do with a bit of a makeover, but this really wasn't a big deal. Parking: -okay for us, we managed to get a spot every time (we stayed for 7 days) although sometimes we had to leave our keys at the front desk in case our car had to be moved, but this really isn't much of a big deal- we thought. The room: -a decent size -had a makeup table and dressing area -our so called 'kitchen' consisted of a a small round table, two chairs and a decent sized fridge. I've seen some photos on tripadvisor with some rooms doing a little better than us with a small microwave as well as a fridge, and other rooms having a full kitchen. Check in advance what type of room you're getting, especially if you plan on 'cheaping it out' some nights by 'cooking' (which is what we intended, but we still managed by using the microwave downstairs.) -the couch we had was actually a sofa-bed which was cool (even though this didn't matter to us, as we were a couple, but definitely an advantage for families) -the bed was quite comfortable, although the pillows were rather small. We got 3 small pillows for 2 people, and thought it was a bit strange, but nonetheless, not too much of a problem. -our room landline didn't seem to work, in that calling the reception was okay, but dialing a local number didn't work (tried many times and either 'the number had been disconnected' or 'try again', even though the number would work 2 seconds later on a different phone) On the whole- hotel was great for what we paid. It met all of our expectations. Much better than paying an arm and a leg for a place we only showered and slept at.

Reviews.Title: “terrific little spot”
Reviews.Author: BeenAroundFolks
Reviews.Content: Who said you couldn't have a good time at a 2 star hotel? Tripadvisor to the rescue again, the recommendations to stay here are spot on the money. The convenience of this location is not to be believed. Sick of LA traffic? Stay here. We had the 'suite' on the second floor at the front. King bed a bit humpy, but then it's all a matter of value and expectations. Wonderful for singles and couples but don't know if this is the best spot for young families. Our tour guide said only a few blocks away is downright dangerous with crackheads, etc. This location was fine, never felt threatened or ill at ease. Walked to the Kodak theatre, Hollywood Blvd. action, 20 min from Warner Brothers, could even walk to Hollywood Bowl. Parking included too. Terrific value but not fancy. It was very clean too. Nice if you're into hollywood for only a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money”
Reviews.Author: sbmach
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Celebrity hotel for 4 days in May 2008. My wife and i have stayed here before in September 2006 . This time we had our 7 year old son with us and the hotel was just the same . The rooms were large and spacious. The beds were comfortable. The best part about this hotel are their friendly staff . This is the best hotel to stay in Hollywood as its located just behind the H&H . It takes you just 5 mins to walk to the Hollywood Blvd through the H&H . The LA Metro is located outside the H&H, so its pretty convienient. The location of this hotel cant be beat. I only wish they had an elevator as dragging the bags up the staircase is a pain and they also offer a good breakfast ( even if we have to pay ). We will certainly stay here everytime we visit LA. If you are a tourist , dont waste your money anywhere else...just stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We Obviously Stayed at a Different Hotel !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nvnight
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the other reviewers regarding this hotel! #8 out of 255 in all of LA? Every hotel I have stayed in LA has been better than this place (definitely more than 7 others). It is like I stayed at a different hotel from these other reviewers. My wife was shocked when I told her this hotel was ranked this high. Two stars is generous for this hotel. I use TripAdvisor all of the time for my travel and have used it for hotel recommendations all over the world. This is the first time I have found the ratings to be so far from the reality I experienced. We paid $149/night and stayed in room 111 on the left side of the hallway as you enter the hotel. The rooms on this side face the pool area of an apartment complex next door. The rooms on the right side face a walkway to the remote parking area, then the wall of another building (this may be the preferred side). The first night (Tuesday), twentysomethings were partying outside our window at the apartment complex pool area until 5:00am and I could not get to sleep (should have used earplugs like my wife). I figured it was a "special occasion" celebration, but it started again the next morning around 1:30am. I called the front desk this time and it stopped around 2:30am. The place is very noisy. Marble floors down the long center hallway look great, but don't sound too great when baggage is rolling and high heels are walking on it. Although it "appears" clean, it doesn't "feel" clean. Dark carpeting and dark bedding can hide things. The room was in need of major renovation, including a new coat of paint. I have never had a room with no drinking glasses, so I had to take the sleeping pills required to get some sleep due to the ongoing noise outside with a handful of bathroom tap water. The towels were thin, gray and dingy, something we would use to dry off our car. The mirror in the dressing area was so low I had to bend over to use it (I'm only 5'11"). The vanity was permanently stained and desperately needed painting. We felt uncomfortable setting our things on it. The "celebrity" wall hangings were spackled and looked horrible. We needed some bottled water and tried the vending machine in the hall. Tried twice for water and got 2 Cokes each time instead. Not the best thing to drink with sleeping pills. The parking area is as bad as previous reviewers have described. You will be required to leave your keys with the front desk so they can squeeze your car into a very small lot, blocking other cars. Do not take your personal car here or a very large rental. Our daughter just moved to the area, so we were trying a new hotel in this area. We have stayed in several hotels in the downtown area, much nicer and less expensive. Overall, the front desk people were very pleasant, however we were not asked anything about our stay when we checked out. We will absolutely never stay here again! Will try the Magic Castle and Renaissance Hollywood on our next visits. Spend a little more and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: steph_mlt
Reviews.Content: After a short stay in Hawaii me & my sister were looking for a centrally hotel located in Hollywood to do some sightseeing for a few days. I actually found this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor and booked right away through the hotel website. As for price, I think it was quite reasonable. The location is amazing! I think we couldn't have found a better hotel than this one actually! It was quite clean, the receptionists were REALLY helpful... the only set back was that they don't have an elevator. but the receptionist was kind enough to help us with our 4 huge & heavy luggages. She actually helped us carry them up to the first floor - which we totally didn't expect. The rooms are REALLY clean & spacious! more than I expected even. We had two huge double beds and they were really comfy! Breakfast was nothing special. but who cares after all. our overall experience at the hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location if without car”
Reviews.Author: NomadX
Reviews.Content: A lot of the reviews below will tell how great this hotel is so i'll touch upon the big bonuses. * extremely affordable * Literally minutes walk away from Hollywood Boulevard.. and the Metro which allows you travel outwards (including LAX). Not too far from Sunset Strip. * Staff are fantastic... very friendly and helpful. * Free internet facilities / tea and coffee * great sized room * free croissants / muffins etc during breakfast hours. well worth stocking up on if your about to go on a day trip.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: hikerpilot
Reviews.Content: I recently visited my niece who lives in Hollywood about 6 blocks from this hotel. It's very conveniently located just off Hollywood Blvd. behind the Kodak Theatre at the Hollywood-Highland Center. There's a metro stop within a couple of minutes. The room was large with lots of room for your luggage. My room had a small kitchenette with a table and 2 chairs, microwave and refrigerator, a large tv, 2 queen beds and a large bathroom and dressing area. The price was also right at only $129/night with my AAA discount. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room and lobby areas were clean and well appointed. There was a nice computer in the lobby for everyone to use as well as internet access in the room. I also checked out 3 other hotels in the area, the Liberty Hotel, the Highland Gardens Hotel and the Orchid Suites and the Hollywood Celebrity far exceeded those other 3 in appearance. The hotel was not noisy. I did not have a vehicle but parking looked adequate. I was completely happy with the hotel and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice gem :)”
Reviews.Author: bunny_on_journey
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot in Hollywood, just 2min from Chinese Theatre, Kodak and walk of fame. Awesome rooms, huge with walk in wardrobe, big bathroom. Very good first impression. Well located with nice front terrace where are tables and sun umbrellas. One minus, limited parking, staff do what they can do to arrange cars in convenient order, didn’t had any problems, car was parked, but not an easy drive in and out. Still worth money. I think everybody will be satisfied as its very central location. Definitely will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Casual, Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBCATraveler
Reviews.Content: We were going to a wedding in the West Hollywood area and the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel was on the list of hotels near the wedding reception. After reading the reviews about this hotel on trip advisor and going on the the hotel's website, we book a one night reservation. The hotel is an older hotel with an art deco and Hollywood theme. The rooms were apartments at one time because we reserved the executive king room and it had a large room with a king size bed, a little room with a table & chairs, mircrowave and refrigerator. The closet area and bathroom were a good size too. The rooms are casual and comfortable. The hotel was conveniently close to the wedding, restaurants, shopping, bars and clubs. The hotel also has free parking behind their building. The hotel serves a continental breakfast, which is not the best part of the this hotel. Next time we need to stay in West Hollywood we would definitely choose the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, quirky and clea but noisy”
Reviews.Author: 50countries
Reviews.Content: My wife and I liked this hotel. It was clean, spacious and is a great location for exploring West Hollywood. We loved the decor as well as the position in a quiet side street. The front desk staff were friendly and very helpful with any requests we had. Like previous reviewers we had a problem with parking - I really do not like double parking and leaving the keys with reception - especially as your rental car insurance will most certainly not cover other drivers. Our one big problem was noise - they had a large group of young teenage students staying there - some form of performing arts group? They were running up and down the corridors (no carpets), in and out of each others rooms (heavy doors which close with a bang) very late. They seemed to have little supervision and the night staff didn't do anything until I complained pointedly. So my advice - if you want to stay here - ask a few questions about visiting groups before you book.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dbasha
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at this hotel recently. For the price, the location is superb! The hotel is within easy walking distance of most of the main sights in Hollywood, as well as the buses and underground trains. The room was large and clean, the breakfast was simple but sufficient, and the front desk staff were uniformly pleasant and helpful. Visit the Magic Castle (the hotel has a membership) around the corner, and you will have a memorable trip! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lengthy review; compared with the Orchid Suites”
Reviews.Author: i_dr
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Los Angeles, I knew that the Hollywood and Highland area was the place that I wanted to be in. But where should I stay? Should I stay at the Celebrity Hotel or the Orchid Suites? Both have good reviews, were just meters apart and were both in my price range. A difficult choice. My solution? Divide my stay between the two hotels. Since my actual stay in L.A. would be divided into two by a short trip to San Diego and Anaheim in between, I decided to spend the first couple of nights at the Orchid Suites and the second bunch at the Celebrity. So having stayed at the Orchid Suites earlier, I was a bit disappointed at the Celebrity upon arrival. And the culprit is the parking area. Aside from it being full with cars (a number double parked), the gate is constantly open. And since my family with small kids arrived close to midnight, this did not offer much in terms of security. I also had to park the car in such a way that a small part of it's tail is exposed out the sidewalk. In effect, I had to repeatedly look out the sidewalk to see if there was anyone around as I opened the trunk. After the parking lot experience, I entered our hotel room not helping to notice that it was less appointed than that of the Orchid's. The kitchen in particular paled as it didn't have the same number of amenities. An in-room safe was sorely missed, too. While wi-fi signal in the room was poor, a wire for broadband access was present in the room. Neat. Aesthetically though, the room at the Celebrity looked better and newer. The same could be said of the hotel as a whole in comparison to the Orchid, which still looked like an apartment which was just converted into a hotel. The front desk personnel were helpful when I needed some info during our stay. Not as cheerful in my opinion, but still to the task. The biggest difference that the other hotel didn't have was the breakfast that came with the Celebrity's room rate. Though some may complain that it didn't offer much, to me the bagels, muffins and croissants together with juice and coffee were enough to start my day. I was also pleasantly surprised to find that the amount I payed for our stay here was actually cheaper than that of the Orchid's by $10/night. Surprised because the quotes here in T.A. are cheaper for the Orchid Suites. Lastly, I might be mistaken but I didn't see any elevators. So if your room is in the upper floors and have heavy luggages with you... So which to me was a better hotel? Let me sum it up this way: if you have a car, the Orchid Suites might be a better option. But if you don't have one, then let the free breakfast and cheaper rates sway you to the Celebrity instead. To expound on the parking situation, firstly, the number of parking slots in the Celebrity is not enough for all their guests. One night, I heard a European man giving his car keys to the person manning the front desk insisting that he park his car. I can tell that he was exasperated from finding a parking slot himself. The front-desk person did not take it reasoning that though parking was available, it is limited. Second, parking at the Celebrity is actually to the side of the hotel accessed via Franklin Ave. So if you are coming from the direction of Highland (as I always do) in heavy traffic, turning left to the garage entrance is impossible, not to mention illegal in the first place. Turn to Google Earth for a better picture. In comparison, the entrance to the Orchid's garage is along Orchid Ave., turning left to which from Franklin is aided by a traffic light. No problem. A solution to the Celebrity's parking woes would be to return late at night when traffic at Franklin is light (drivers at your back will honk at you for stopping to turn left into the garage). But since the garage gates are always open, and chances are yours will be the last car in, one can't help but feel unsafe with nobody around late at night in Hollywood. Third, if you park farthest from the gate the night before and leave the earliest the next morning, be prepared to wait a while since backing up all the cars blocking your way will take some time. But despite all this, I would have honestly considered coming back to this hotel. Afterall it is hard to disregard the free breakfast and the slightly cheaper rates. The parking- you get used to it. I however have a beef with the front desk person who promised to e-mail me the breakdown of my expenses since their printer was malfunctioning when I checked out. I've e-mailed them a reminder as I got back and still no answer to my request. I just have this impression that they are nice when they need your business but don't care when your business with them is done. So it's Orchid Suites for me by a whisker. Remember, this is my pinion and I just hope that with this I help you formulate your own.

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: HELRAM
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of the hotel on Tripadvisor, we decided to make this the base for our 5 day exploration of northwestern LA and its surroundings. The location was spectacular. At the end of the street was the back entrance to the Kodak Theater shopping area. The outdoor patio was a delightful place to begin and end our days. We enjoyed our modest but more than satisfactory complimentary breakfasts and free parking. The staff were helpful and eager to be of assistance. The guests were from all over.. We met great folks from England, Australia, and Canada. The rooms offered small fridges, microwaves and a kitchenette area so we could bring food back from restaurants or keep snacks available when in the room. We were able to easily motor to Melrose St, Sunset Strip, a Dodgers game, Santa Monica, Sony Studios and a drive through Bel Air, Brentwood and Beverly Hills. We were close to Mulholland Dr. and went up to see the Hollywood sign. The location afforded us easy access to all these. Overall, this was a great value and a great location. We recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my 12-year old for 3 days in April. Other reviewers have said it all - it'sa great location and good value - but don't get excited about the breakfast. Also - don't be put off by their attitude to public transport. We used the metro to get to Universal Studios, and also to LAX (it required 3 changes, but was absolutely fine and saved a fortune in cabs). You can catch a bus on Hollywood Boulevard (5 min walk) to Farmers' Market and the Grove very easily (I think you catch the 217 going to Fairfax) and very cheaply. The guy at the desk suggested we would be better off getting a cab - he was wrong. It really is very simple.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: swrxp47
Reviews.Content: We were only staying in LA for 2 nights and wanted somewhere not too expensive as we planned to be sight-seeing most of the time and just wanted somewhere to get our heads down. I was very aprehensive at what we were going to find as the hotel seemed very reasonably priced for the location. On arrival all our worries disappeared. The Celebrity used to be "art decor" style apartments and have been renovated into a small hotel. OK so there is no pool and there is no lift (its only 2 floors anyway) but it is clean, comfortable, very friendly and only a 2minute stroll to the action yet in a quiet cul-de-sac location. The hotel staff were VERY helpful and there is FREE internet access. The continental breakfast is basic but is a good start to the day. If you a not looking to be pampered with 5* luxury then I cannot recommend this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: s.g.LosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel, and we were quite impressed! We thought it was very good value for the money--our room was large, with 2 Queen beds (that's all they had available) and a full kitchen, and good sized bathroom and vanity area. The staff were all very helpful, from beginning to end. The continental breakfast was decent--nothing fancy (bagels/cream cheese and muffins and croissants with juice and tea/ coffee). The location is excellent--2 minute walk (if that) to the Hollywood/Highland shopping complex, and also the hotel is on a cute little hidden street, so it feels very safe. The only drawback with our room is that it was literally right off the lobby (room 104), and while it wasn't nearly as loud as we thought it would be with all of the lobby traffic, every time the front desk clerk used the clunky old printer, we could hear it quite loudly from our room. So, I would suggest requesting a room a bit further from the lobby! Overall, a good choice, and we will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Okay...you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: khali1920
Reviews.Content: My friend booked us into this hotel. Looking back, we really had no reason to stay in this location as we weren't that interested in doing the Hollywood tourist thing. When we arrived, I parked our rental car in the super-tight parking lot and a frustrated looking man asked me for my keys and told me he was the parking manager. When I refused because I didn't know if he was an employee of the hotel and I told him I would give them in at the front desk, he rolled his eyes at me. Needless to say, the next day when we came out to our car, the hubcap was dented up as if it had hit the curb. Nice. The room was ok...not really the greatest. The outdated rooms could use some freshening up. When my friend went to toast her bagel in the morning, she found she couldn't get the toaster to work and checked underneath the tablecloth to see if it was plugged in. There were rat traps under the table. She was freaked out the rest of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TheScubaDuo
Reviews.Content: Let hotel is perfectly situated just a couple of minutes walk from Hollywood Blvd., and right behind the Kodak theatre. Finding the hotel was easy, and the car parking seemed ample, but the car park was fill when we left the next morning. Check-in was completed very quickly and easily, but there are no lifts to the upper levels which with the amount luggage we had proved a bit of a strain and being a small hotel there are no bell boys to help. The room was massive, and very clean with all of the amenities that someone would need for a short stay. The only very slight problem we had was having a room at the back it was close to the road. This being Hollywood the traffic never stopped and the windows are not double glazed. Breakfast is a bit of a bun fight. One small table with everything laid out and about 20 people trying to get to the coffee, bread and toaster all at the same time. There is also no where to sit so we took out breakfast back to our room. Checking out was simple and quick. Overall, the location, the price and the rooms are all great, just find a Diner for your breakfast and don't bring too much luggage if you are upstairs!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great locatin.”
Reviews.Author: Kamema
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about staying here as Hollywood doesn't have such a great name but it was exactly what we wanted. Large spacious ,clean room, fantastic location, free internet, helpful desk. The decor is art deco and the bathroom somewhat dated but we had absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Missionlady03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel for two nights Feb 23 & 24th, 08. At the time we booked our flight we were not aware that was "Oscar" weekend in Hollywood. I found this hotel on trip advisor and most of the reviews were positive. We wanted to be within walking distance of the sites we wanted to visit and we were NOT disappointed. This hotel is located directly behind the Hollywood and Highland Mall and Hollywood Blvd. We could not have asked for a better location. The hotel itself was immaculately clean. Our bed was comfortable (we had an Executive King room ) and could not have asked for anything more. The continental breakfast was fine, bagels, cream cheese, crossants, muffins, coffee, juice, hot chocolate. We ate a good breakfast and then did not eat again until evening. The staff was very helpful and made recommendations for places we could visit on foot. The only drawback to our room was some noise outside our window (it was beside the alley that lead to the parking lot for the hotel) and ssome noise from the hall as people were coming in and out. It wasn't enough to disturb our sleep however so no big deal. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone. It had alot of character. You can visit them at www.hotelcelebrity.com.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth Stay”
Reviews.Author: Diggle
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Celebrity Hotel on a "girl's weekend out" and found it more than adequate. The staff was very friendly and accomodating to our early arrival and late departure. The room was large and very clean. The decor is dated but well kept. The continental breakfast was handy. There was some noise from the outside a couple nights but not enough to disturb us too long. I would recommend the Celebrity Hotel for an economical stay in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “The celebrity is a must.”
Reviews.Author: clive165
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 2006 and planning to go back next year.This hotel is an absolute diamond.The location cant be beaten,literally 2 mins behind the Kodak theatre in a quiet road.The hotel is a little dated but this adds to its charm.The rooms are large and very clean.Very nice lobby area where bfast is taken and there is always free coffee and chocolate on the go.Bfast inc cereals,bagels and possibly the best muffins ive ever tasted.We used to take our bfast outside and have at one of the 3 tables.There is an exercise and steam room which we never got round to using.Two tips firstly the hotel or apartments behind the celebrity were very noisy on the sat(our first night) so might be an idea to take ear plugs but the rest of the time was very quiet.Secondly i really advise any one to take a trip round the kodak theatre and see where the oscars take place.This wasnt something we had planned but turned out to be one of the highlights of our holiday.When we arrived for the tour one person had just seen Jack Nicholson! If you are looking for a good Hollywood hotel in a great location then i dont think you will find any better!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and $ value.”
Reviews.Author: 1Reese
Reviews.Content: Myself and eight friends stayed in the hotel and all of found the service and staff great and the owner very welcoming and helpful. The beds were comfortable, the rooms big and cozy. The location for everything in Hollywood was perfect, close to everything. The continental breakfast was a perfect start to the morning and they always made sure it was well stocked. This is the hotel I will always return to when staying in Hollywood and I always refer the hotel to anyone thinking of a vacation in the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: am-ls
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel in Hollywood in October 2007. Neighborhood The hotel is on the 'back side' of the block that houses the Hollywood&Highland Center and the Kodak Theater (where the Oscars are held). In the same street (more like an alley) there are two other cheap hotels, "Hollywood Orchid Suites" and "Liberty Hotel". This is the nice part of Hollywood, with a lot of tourists and a lot of people even late at night, so you won't feel unsafe here. The expensive Renaissance Hollywood Hotel is around the corner (literally 150 yards). There are places in Hollywood where we'd feel unsafe at night, but this is quite ok. The hotel is close to Franklin Avenue which has some traffic, but the noise didn't bother us at all. Parking may be tricky in the hotel's small lot. We found a spot every time, but in the peak season, you may have to look for a spot further away. Room The room was large, with a big bed, a sofa and a table. The furniture isn't exactly new, but the bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. The decor is a bit dated, but since we didn't go to Hollywood to stay in our room, that didn't bother us. There was a fridge and a microwave in the room as well. Bathroom The bathroom was nice, with black and white tiles, a tub, a toilet and a sink. Clean and practical. The shower cabinet was a bit hard to close, otherwise ok. Service The breakfast included consists of juice, bagels and muffins. Not a full buffet, but a quick bite before you start your day. It was nice to sit out on the patio and sip juice in the shadow of the Kodak Theater. There is a computer in the lobby where you can surf the interenet for free. Summary This is a clean hotel with a nice decor. It's comfortable, clean and reasonably priced for LA.
