We can recommend this hotel for people who plan to spend most of their day out sightseeing or whatever and not hanging out in their room.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: salmonator
Reviews.Content: dont believe the bad reviews about this hotel - its absolutely fine! location is great (only one street away from EVERYTHING like kodak theatre, walk of fame etc) room was huge, very clean, internet access was great, service was fabulous, breakfast was more of a snack and the room walls are a but thin but apart from that we couldnt recommend it more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...great location”
Reviews.Author: kaur_parm
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed for 3 days at the beginning of this year. The hotel is in a great location, very near kodak theatre, shopping mall, walk of fame, sunset blvd, Chinese Theatre, metro station. This hotel was definately value for money, although the hotel itself was very basic. The reception area was impressive (free internet access), checking in was not great. The receptionist was trying to serve me, then starting serving someone else whilst answering the phones!! But the other reception staff were very helpful (the early morning reception guy - LA Clippers fan was really helpful & enthusiastic). The breakfast was ok, the room itself was very basic but clean. Our view was the carpark!! There is free parking, which is great. Overall i would stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Great location...average hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeanSD
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we were seeing a show at the Kodak Theater. The hotel could not have been in a better location for that or doing the "Hollywood"thing. The lobby and patio outside are nice, as are interior hallways. The rooms were clean, and NO signs of bed bugs (I checked throughly). The room was average. Not the nicest room we have stayed at by far, but a fine place to crash and clean. This hotel could be great if they did two things...intsall dual paned windows to reduce street/outside noise and carpet the interior hallways which were a bit loud throughout the night. You can hear everyone walking by your room. We did not have the free breakfast so can't comment on it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not coming back”
Reviews.Author: Chilen0
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a couple of nights, the room looked ok, clean and "ok" furnitures. However, im not staying there again. Pros: - Cheap - Free breakfast (not the best, but still free) - Good location - Free Parking (very, very small, but free) *** Cons - Bed bugs, they ate my legs (literally) - Noisy, people running/laughing/screaming outside the rooms. Also, since there's no carpet outside the rooms, when someone is using high heels it could get really noisy - *** The parking is free, but it's really really small, so if you are late in the night, you wont be able to park inside and if you are too early you wont be able to leave late cause it's going to be full . Bottom of the line, the cheapness is not worthy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and price”
Reviews.Author: Averbuch
Reviews.Content: Impossible a better location for those who want to see the Kodak Theatre and the surrounding area. Easy access from the airport (not close, but easy), very friendly staff. Free parking (but sometimes not enough for all guests). Complimentary breakfast could be better. The rooms are clean. There's no elevator what can be a problem if you are carrying lots of luggage. After all, the price is very good if you remember that's is L.A. I recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value - shame about Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: delectable
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on side street at the back of central hollywood - it feels perfectly safe and you can literally walk through a neighbouring hotels underground car park and you're in the middle of hollywood - right outside Mann's Chinese Theatre. I sort of expected it but Hollywood is a bit of a dump - something you have to see but can be dodgy at night if you wander too far - but if you want a central location this is also right by a massive shopping centre with restaurants and bars which is actually quite nice, and you can get the bus tours around LA, stars homes etc. On that note - if you have a car we bought a map and did it ourselves - you can only see gates a lot of the time but at least its ones you're interested in - but don't loiter of bother getting out of the car, there's CCTV everywhere. A bus top tour of LA was good fun though and you can get on and off where you like, but expect to spend a bit of time hanging round at bus stops. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable with not bad sized rooms - much better inside than it looks outside. Internet access in reception, helpful staff and a pleasant complimentary continental breakfast. If you want luxury in a fancy location this probably isn't the place - but it is good value if you just want a base to explore from.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: BreVar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love to take road trips for our vacations so we have stayed in many hotels across the country. This hotel was decent. Not great, but certainly comfortable. It was clean and the bed was comfortable, which is really the most important thing in a hotel for me. The location is great if you are staying in hollywood and want to see the typical sites. Just a block away from hollywood Blvd. The parking lot is tight and can be difficult to park and leave. And the tv is tiny. They could use a little updating, but it was still a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: nic1367
Reviews.Content: At around $100/night for a good quality, spacious room with ensuite, right in the heart of Hollywood, this hotel can't be beaten for value for money. The hotel has a great feel to it - a bit art deco, clean and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The access to free internet is popular, and there were a few times when I had to wait but not a major problem. The location is great for many tourist attractions like Graumans, Hollywood Boulevarde and Kodak theatre and the proximity to the metro really convenient. I was there on my own and I felt safe walking around the area at night - the hotel itself is a block back from the Walk of Fame and is like a residential enclave with houses and other boutique hotels nearby. A few reviewers have complained about the complementary continental breakfast, and it's true that it is basic but what are people expecting for nothing? It was useful to have there as a back up for when I couldn't be bothered going out for breakfast (this happened more than once). I will definitely return here next time I'm in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the money but be forewarned......”
Reviews.Author: theWimp
Reviews.Content: I suspect a lot of people are drawn to this hotel for the same reason I was, the low cost and the location. If thats your goal, then its a deal. For me, though, the negatives, as expressed by other reviewers, outweigh the positives. I too had a left-side room on a Friday night, and the partying at the apartment house next door was in full swing. The parking is a challenge as the lot is tiny and when it fills up, you trudge down to the Chevron station a block away, leaving your car out in the open in a tough area. On the positive side, the place was clean and the beds comfortable. Keep in mind this hotel is like a lot of LA properties that are over 50 years old, so the bathrooms are dated, but you get used to that if you stay around this area enough. In fact, one of th appealing things is the art-deco architecture of this place and others in LA. The rooms have both wired and wireless web access, and, like the parking, is free. Both of these can add up to a lot of money at the chain properties in this town. Front desk is accurate but robotic and not speedy. I still can't find the appeal of Hollywood itself as a reason to stay nearby. The crowd on this Friday night was young and tough and not for kids. While I didn't feel unsafe, its still adult oriented. It dawned on my that most of the other guests were European and didn't know of the option to stay elsewhere and drive to Hollywood and visit, but not stay overnight. The Boulevard may have been glamorous a long time ago but its not now even after being "reinvented" by urban renewal. The Hollwyood-Highland rail station is here too with all that brings to the neighborhood:) The breakfast is coffee, juice and small selection of pastries and not enough to rely on other than get you out the door. Orchid is officially a dead-end street off of busy Franklin, but you can sneak through the alleyway behing the Kodak theater and get out. A better option the next trip will be the Orchid Suites , which has secured basement parking and appears to be more modern, and is 2 doors down. It has the same price point as this place. In summary, OK place to stay if you are determined to be in downtown Hollywood but be prepared for the negatives and ask for a right-side room.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted and more than we expected.”
Reviews.Author: StatesTourer
Reviews.Content: My wife myself and two sons (aged 23 and 17) stayed here for 3 nights while paying our first ever visit ,(albeit fleeting) , to Los Angeles. We were aprehensive as what to expect in Hollywood for this money, but were pleasantly surprised. We found a well presented small hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is immaculately clean with good sized rooms. Facilities were better than expected and the location could have hardly been better . One day when we are able to return to Los Angeles (and we will), we will without question be staying at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: garythestokefan
Reviews.Content: Booked up this hotel after viewing reviews on trip advisor and have to say it was spot on. stayed 1st week of november we had a king room with kitchen/dinner/bathroom/bedroom it had a small walk in wardrobe and a small area set in a alcove with a mirror with lights around it, the wife said she felt like a movie star when she got ready. breakfast well some have complained about this but we found it quite good. cakes(very nice) crossiants/bagels/soft cheese / 4 different juices to drink tea and coffee all put out fresh at 8 every morning and topped up as and when up to 10 in the morning so for us this was enough to get us through to dinner. now the area it is in, again spot on just 50/60 yards behind the kodac theater so close you can see the glass walk way where the winning oscar winner goes for there interview . as others have said there is a small walk through you can take which takes you into the hollywood and highland centre. the street it is in is nice and quite no through traffic. although you can at times here the traffic on the main road. the staff are very friendly and reception staff very help full with maps or direction or details of bus times or locations if you ask would i stay here gain? without question.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marissa_lee
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! This was our first stop on our honeymoon trip, staying for four nights. We loved every second! The room was great, no probs with checking in early! Location is just the best, you are a 5 min walk from all the action and transport options at Hollywood & Highland. Weather was beautiful and we did the whole Universal/Disneyland thing, which was great as the hotel got us cheap tickets to Universal and also organised the Disneyland transport for us from the hotel. All in all, couldn't fault anything! Staff were great and helpful and all times, it was awesome to have a free computer in the lobby to keep in touch with the family back home, and breakfast each day was great! I'm hooked on bagels and cream cheese now! We will definitely stay again any time we return to LA! :)

Reviews.Title: “The Manager said it all.”
Reviews.Author: Judy T
Reviews.Content: Following flight delays, we arrived at 11PM with a confirmed reservation. The manager was standing at the top of the stairs, and as we disembarked from our shuttle van he asked, "Are you checking in?" When we answered, "Yes." he turned aside and said, "S**t!!!" And that pretty well sums it up. Our confirmed booking had been given away and the hotel was fully booked. Perhaps due to the late hour they thought that we weren't coming, but the night was guaranteed by credit card. Of course, if we hadn't shown up they could have billed our card and resold the room - not that we're suggesting that they would have. The front desk staff were good enough to phone around and find us another room, and the manager drove us there himself, but we ended up paying $50 more to be about a mile away from where we wanted to be. So if you make a booking, we'd suggest you reconfirm on the day you are scheduled to arrive just to be sure.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: DD12
Reviews.Content: We are not budget travellers,we enjoy staying in 5 star resorts & had just returned from the Hilton Waikoloa village in Kona Hawaii. However we do subscribe to the theory that when visiting a city as tourists we would rather spend our money on something other than an expensive hotel room which is ultimately just a place to rest our heads etc. So we look for an economy, comfortable, clean room, with private bathroom in a central location. The Celebrity Hotel met & exceeded our expectations! The staff are very friendly & helpful! The location is absolutely brilliant, so central to everything & a great area to walk around in & shop & dine till late in the evening. The room is large but very basic & decor very dated. We did notice they are busy with a renovation while we were staying, however this did not inconvenience us at all! Bathrooms clean & adequate. We dis- agree with a previous post, the breakfast was great, a muffin or croissant with cream cheese, coffee or juice - more than enough to start the day & a really nice touch especially that it was free. The internet free as well .....another value add in a town where things can be really expensive. We would highly recommend this hotel & would definetly stay here again! It is also worth mentioning that we booked this hotel directly as a result of the positive feedback on this site & once again tripadvisor has served us well.... Thank you trip advisor for a great site!!

Reviews.Title: “great great great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: bozzman5
Reviews.Content: I was searching for a cheapish hotel to stay in. Only there two days and had no car, so location was everything! The location was great, just behind hollywood bl, all the amenities was about a 5 minute walk away. The rooms was massive, basic but very clean. Hotel reception staff was very friendly and very keen to help. The only negative about the hotel is the breakfast, they shouldnt even bother doing it! a few bagels and some juices. We just went to a local cafe nearby. Everything else was great, definately stay here again without a doubt and great for budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: r.butterworth
Reviews.Content: booked originally thinking we would not have car, location is excellent being only a few minutes from "walk of fame" and Mann's Chinese Theatre. Hotel room very good size, decor a little dated but spotlessly clean and all front desk staff very helpful. Hotel has small car park which can get very congested. Easy drive to Universal studios and short walk to tour buses. Highly recommended hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: buckeyewin
Reviews.Content: Very Clean; staff friendly; easy access to everything Hollywood. Loved the free parking, and short walk to Hollywood and Highland. Free internet for checking e-mails; airline check-in, etc; continental breakfast; (had my coffee and muffin out on the patio). Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: CSRE
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing place to stay! the location is great, rooms are big and clean, staff was very helpful and it is a pretty cheap option to stay in the middle of Hollywood (two steps away from the Kodak theater). It also has parking. There was nothing bad in the hotel, if i had to point a minus it would be breakfast, cause it really isn't so, it was a little table with croissants and bagels with nothing but Philadelphia chesse to spread on, and plain coffee (no milk or cream). I believe there was also orange juice but we never got to taste it cause there never was any left when we went down. But it is ok to start the day so you go out with empty stomach. Also there is no elevator, we didn’t care but we saw some older couples and solo travelers with bunch of luggage having a bad time (no bellboy of course) I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean Place”
Reviews.Author: Impashable
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends. Had a wonderful time! This hotel is clean, safe and sooooo cute! The free continental breakfast is quite handy! Take your food out on the front patio and enjoy the beautiful weather. Everyone was very friendly and helped out above and beyond! Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Home-from-home”
Reviews.Author: Grockles
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading recommendations here in Tripadvisor, and I want to say a big thank you to everyone for letting us know. All the positive comments are right. The location is so handy for Hollywood Boulevard. You can get in the rear entrance to Hollywood and Highland shopping centre at the bottom of Orchid Avenue, a 30-second stroll. The visitor information desk in there will guide you on how to get anywhere. We had no car, and spent 8 days using the Metro train and bus system to get all over LA. Our hotel room was clean, with two double beds for just us two. It's great to have a kitchen area to rustle up a cup of tea/snack whenever we felt like one. Free internet connection in the room completed the home-from-home amenities for us. All the staff - receptionists, maids and handyman - were very friendly and helpful. We would love the chance to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Honest review”
Reviews.Author: bluebells22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights, and have to say it was a good hotel overall. The actual bedroom, was just fair, a bit dingy. Bed and bedding was fine, air con loud but effecient. Free internet. The bonus for the price you pay for this hotel is Location, when using the passage through to Highland Center you are right on hollywood blvd. Reception were very kind and printed my boarding passes and were very friendly and knowledgable. Yes if i had the money I would stay at better hotel, but for price I would stay again. Ps there is a Langs store 3 blocks up the blvd, great for supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: laughchicaXx
Reviews.Content: The location was great. And the bed and pillows were really comfertable. They had a comouter, and a outside sitting area. Parking wasn`t great, but overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going in the L.A area!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: hawaii0202
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Aug 17-20 and really enjoyed our stay. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotel is very clean and quiet. The location is great, only a 3 minute walk to the Kodak Theatre, Hollywood Blvd, restaurants and shopping. The hotel also serves a small, but very poplular continental breakfast each morning. We would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tadeh1104
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at this hotel on August 10 & 11 and absolutely loved it. We had a king suite which was HUGE...more like a one-bedroom apartment than a hotel room. It had a living room with couch, chair, tables, armoire and television, a full kitchen with microwave, minifridge, and oven/stove, a dining/eat-in area with table and chairs, a bedroom with a king bed and another television, and a nice size bathroom. It was far more comfortable than the more modern, much smaller hotels we stayed at in other cities during this vacation. It's also on a quiet side street and sitting out front on the balcony was one of our favorite things to do. It's in a great location for sightseeing, right in the heart of Hollywood and a few steps from the Hollywood & Highland complex. There were lots of families with kids staying there when we were and they all seemed to enjoy it. Would definitely recommend to anyone who's visiting L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Kate_BB
Reviews.Content: I've just return from LA and this hotel. I have to say that the hotel is in a superb location, near the shops of Hollywoond anf Highland, the metro station, walk of fame and the Grauman's Chinese Theatre. The rooms are very large and quite comfortable, but don't expect luxary. We stayed on the first floor and altough we had many heavy bags a member of staff helped us carry our luggage upstairs (there's no lift). As mentionned in other reviews the hotel has a small parking but we had no problem getting a place. I think if you're in a search of a budget hotel in LA I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not family oriented; nice location; loud parties at apartments next door”
Reviews.Author: FAM88
Reviews.Content: Located on a side street behind the Kodak Theatre. I would suggest this place for couples, but NOT for families. It's a small two story hotel. We were up all night due to dogs barking and people partying next door at the apartment building (if you are looking at the hotel, we stayed on first floor left side). We went to dinner and came back with no parking in the lot. They will reimburse you if you park a block and half away at a gas station. My husband feared his life on the way back because of all the weirdos outside at night. The rooms were just okay. The bathrooms were very outdated. If you are a couple or a few friends who don't mind non-luxury and need a good location, this is for you. However, for families, this is NOT the place...it didn't feel secure enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: prettypink21
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre etc. Very helpful and friendly staff. Small hotel, smallish size room, clean and quiet. Overall, great budget hotel and hard to beat at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit Again”
Reviews.Author: thepengy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9th to 13th July. Second stay at this hotel, again nothing but happy with stay. Rooms are very large and clean, breakfast is good enough unless you are very picky, staff more than helpful. Only thing to be aware of here is its only Ground floor and first floor but there is no lift, this time I requested a ground floor room to save dragging my heavy cases up the stairs, the downside of this is you can hear the people above you, my first night Mr & Mrs Elephant and family were staying above me, after that heard nothing though. What everyone else says about location and convenience to public transport (which we used all times of day and night without any problems) are true. I cannot imagine staying anywhere else if I ever return to Hollywood

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adrianatj
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about this hotel, since it is #7 on TripAdvisor. We arrived after a long day of airline cancellations ready to drop off our bags and explore Hollywood. The person behind the desk was very slow and confused. I wanted to use a different credit card than the one that I had reserved the room with and he had no idea what to do and just kept looking at the card, then looking at the paper, then finally called someone and asked them. When we got our key the room was on the second floor, so we lugged our heavy luggage up the stairs (no elevator), as we opened the door there was already someone elses luggage in this room. There were three of us, so one went down to get another room and the other two of us stayed with the luggage, hoping not to have to lug it back down the stairs. The new room was on the first floor, of course. As we walk in the room we realize that it only has a king size bed and we had reserved a room with 2 beds, plus there is trash in both the trash cans in the kitchen and in the bathroom, then there must of been like a bachelorette party or something because there was confetti in the shape of a male body part all over the room, which actually was the first thing that had made us laugh in quite awhile and ended up being the joke of the whole trip. We went out to complain and were pretty much told that it was the last room and if we didn't like it we could go somewhere else - on a Friday night at 8:00 p.m. We asked them if they could at least change the trash and they came in and did that. There was a pull-out sofa, which neither the bed or the sofa was comfortable at all, we all woke up with back aches. Tired and hungry we went and explored Hollywood a little bit and ate dinner at a really cute little italian place, which ended up the highlight of the whole day. The next morning when we woke up, I wasn't sure if I wanted to take a shower in this place, there wasn't very good water pressure for the sink so I wasn't very hopeful for the shower, but my friend decided that she would try it. She turned on the shower and water started pouring out, she yells out to us "There's no show head", - say what? we go in there and there is just a metal pipe with no shower head on it. Huh? You've got to be kidding me. So, we call and are told that maintenance doesn't come in until 7:30 a.m. and it is 7:15 a.m., so there is nothing that they can do. So we get ready and go out and get a muffin at 8:00 a.m. when the breakfast opens up, which is just a mob of people with no order. Then as we are sitting and eating at about 8:15 a.m. they finally call and ask about fixing the shower, by that time we had given up on it and just gotten ready for the day. We ask about a discount for everything that we have been through and are told that she will call the manager and let us know at check out. We leave and go do a Double Decker Tour bus, which was fun. When we go back to check in she tells us that the manager says not to charge us for tax, so we end up with about a $20 discount. I just don't understand all the great reviews for this place, I was so excited to experience that and be able to write one of those good reviews. This is the first time I have ever written a bad review for a hotel and there was no way that I could let this go without letting everyone know our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: C_K_2007
Reviews.Content: If you're only staying in LA for a few days and want to see the walk of fame and universal studios, you will find it difficult to find a better hotel for the same price. We really enjoyed our stay here. The location is fantastic - 5 minute drive to Universal Studios and 5 minute walk to the walk of fame. Great breakfast included with muffins and bagels, coffee etc. Staff were friendly and helpful and the gated parking at the rear of the hotel was good, although it might be a bit difficult to get a space if you arrive late in the day. Overall a great value hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot reccommend this place enough”
Reviews.Author: helenearth
Reviews.Content: I was only booked in here for about four nights. I'm going back to LA this year and I'll be staying here for the duration of my holiday. It's very reasonably priced, perfect location. It's just behind the Kodak Theatre, Mann's Chinese theatre, the Metro Rail Station, Hollywood walk of fame. Not far from West Hollywood, Sunset Strip and Beverly Hills. If like me you don't drive you don't have to worry at this location as the public transport was very convenient. It has free internet access in all rooms. The rooms are clean and spacious, staff very friendly, Gym and free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Disneyswan
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter and I just stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity for 5 nights and could not have been more pleased. Like others have said - the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are large and clean. We especially liked having the computer access in the lobby to keep up with our emails. The free breakfast was sufficient for our needs - muffins, bagels, croissants, juice - which saved us $$$ on a large breakfast. It was enough to hold us over until lunch. The location is the best and the secret passage to the Hollywood & Highland Complex is terrific. It saves you from going through the craziness in front of the Chinese Theatre. We always felt save in the area - although we did not go out after dark. Only one night did we need to park in the "middle" of the parking lot, blocking people in, but when we got up the next day, our car was 're-positioned' in a parking space by an employee. We did not feel hesitant about leaving our keys with the front desk. I am glad we had a small car though as the spaces are compact. The only thing that would make this property better for me personally would have been a pool, otherwise I am very pleased and would definately stay here again. Don't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “High consumer ranking of this hotel is well deserved!”
Reviews.Author: product-of-canada
Reviews.Content: I think the high ranking of this hotel in Trip Advisor’s ranked list of LA hotels is well deserved. The following represents positive aspects of the hotel: 1. Location: For anyone visiting LA who wishes to see the tourist sites, the location is pretty superb. There are a number of tourist sites in the vicinity, including Hollywood Blvd., Chinese Theater with celebrity handprints, Kodak Theater, Hollywood and Highland shopping complex, Jimmy Kimmel show, Hollywood Bowl, Mulholland Drive, and Universal Studios. And it’s somewhat central for other tourist attractions that are further away, including downtown LA, Burbank (for studio shows and tours), Paramount studio, Sunset Strip, and Beverly Hills. Also, there is a subway stop right at Hollywood and Highland, close to the hotel. 2. Condition & Environment of Hotel & Room: The front lobby is quaint and welcoming. The hotel has a nice Hollywood retro 50’s theme going on. There is a nice outdoor patio with tables and chairs. The rooms seem large (we were in room 203) and spacious, and included a sofa seating area with a glass coffee table, and a small dining area with table, chairs and bar fridge. There was also plenty of open space to open up large luggage. The room and washroom condition was better than expected. I did not see any problems with the room condition. It is nothing fancy, but more than adequate. 3. Hotel Breakfasts: Free hotel breakfasts are a major perk. I’m a little confused about the reviews here that are critical of the breakfasts – what do you expect from a budget hotel that is not obligated to provide any breakfast? If you want bacon and eggs, or health-conscious options, how could you book with a budget hotel expecting these kind of options for free? Anyways, the week we were there they had croissants, bagels with cream cheese, muffins, coffee, tea, about 4 juice options, and a toaster for the bagels. 4. Internet/Computer Access: It was great having access to our e-mail accounts through this free internet service in the lobby. There is only one computer, but we rarely had to wait for anyone to finish. The internet connection was very fast. Because we had this internet access, I was able to get us last minute tickets to a taping of David Spade’s Showbiz Show, and look up LA events for that week. 5. Price: Given the above-mentioned factors, the price is right. We paid, on average, $104 US/night including taxes, and we were there for 7 nights. This was a government rate. Negative attributes of this hotel: 1. Payment process: I really only had one disappointing experience at this hotel. Since we had a very early morning flight to catch on the Saturday, I wanted to pay the night before in order to save time and have less worries on Saturday morning. But for some reason the desk worker would not let me pay on Friday night (March 16, 2007), and insisted that the payment process would be a quick and simple process in the morning. So the following morning at about 6:30 am, I tried to pay the front desk worker (there was a different person working at this time, “Arthur”) who was having difficulty getting the credit card machine to work. He fumbled with it for some time, and in the mean time our cab showed up and we were getting behind schedule. Because of the machine problems, I had to sign a billing statement that totaled more than what we actually owed. It all worked out, and I was not over-charged in the end – but this was an irritating experience. I would have given a perfect rating had it not been for this incident. 2. The Gym/Workout Room: I saw in a posted picture that this hotel had a weight machine, and I was looking forward to using it. But it was broken and useless. Tips/Suggestions: * Breakfast is served at 8:00 am. Stack your paper plate and take it to the outdoor patio out front – pleasurable experience! * As already mentioned on this site, there is a shortcut to the Hollywood & Highland shopping centre. At the end of this hotel’s street (Orchid Ave.), it looks like a dead end. But if you turn left to the area that looks like a loading dock, you’ll find a large, open entrance on the right that goes directly into the shopping centre. * If you plan on going to some tourist sites, take the tourist brochures from the hotel lobby. Some of them have discounts on the brochure (such as the Paramount studio tour). Other Tips/Comments Not Relating to the Hotel: ·Studio Tours: Seeing some studio tours was a priority for me. We saw 3 of them – Universal, Warner Brothers, and Paramount. In my opinion, Paramount was the best. It is a small, intimate walking tour of about a half dozen people, and everything you see is authentic - not staged. The Universal studio tour was very disappointing. It is more of a ‘thrill-ride’ than it is a studio tour. You are on an enormous golf cart with a couple of hundred other people, and you encounter staged situations that have nothing to do with the studios. For anyone that has been to Universal Orlando, the Jaws, Earthquake, and King Kong thrill rides are all a part of the Universal Hollywood studio tour. Universal Orlando is better than Universal Hollywood – if you’ve been to the former, don’t bother going to the latter. ·Show Tapings: This was also a priority on our trip. If it is a priority for you too, start booking shows on the internet 1 to 2 months before your trip. Some shows fill up the same day they become available on the internet, so you need to monitor their websites daily. Also, you should book more shows than you intend to attend. You will find that for one reason or another, you will not be able to attend all the shows you booked, so it’s nice to have back-up options (for instance, one show did not get back to us about tickets; Jeopardy cancelled all tapings for our vacation week two days before our trip; for Ellen’s show, we did not get in line soon enough to secure a spot). Be prepared to wait in line for hours, even though you got your ticket in advance on-line. The earlier you show up, the better your chances of getting into the show. The shows we got into included Dr. Phil, Tonight Show with Jay Leno, Jimmy Kimmel, and the Showbiz Show with David Spade. ·Getting Around: There is a lot to see and do in L.A., but it is all spread out everywhere. We decided to stick with walking and public transportation, but this was tough. Overall the transportation system was good, especially the subway. But the worst part was the bus transit system in Burbank. They don’t seem to know what a schedule is. ·Touristy Activity Suggestions: Studio tours, like Paramount; TV show tapings; Ride the ferris wheel at the Santa Monica Pier & eat on the patio at the Mexican restaurant at the end of the Pier; Check out the shops, street performers, and crazy people along Venice Beach; the Tar Pits; Hollywood Forever Cemetery (many celebrity resting here); Watch a movie at the Chinese Theatre; Check out the costumed movie characters and performers along the Walk of Fame where the hand-prints are located; Walk along Sunset Strip and see where the celebrities shop, party, and sleep/trash hotel rooms; Hike the trail that gets you close to the Hollywood sign (which is one thing we didn’t get to do). ·Shopping: Maybe our timing was bad for sales, but shopping was very disappointing in LA. We normally purchase quite a bit when travelling to the USA, but not this time. Perhaps you need to travel away from the touristy areas to get the deals. I was looking forward to the vintage clothing shops in LA, such as along Melrose, but everything was really over-priced. Ironically, I’m able to get better deals and selection on vintage clothing through a well-know on-line auction site – and a lot of it comes from LA!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: rk67fr
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great ! We were there in june twice with my family in two separate rooms. Facilities: Large and clean rooms, free internet (in room and in lobby), good breakfast, fitness room,steam room and great rates: all what you need ! Decoration: hotel with character, kind of art deco, beautiful film posters everywhere. Location: 5 minutes walk to "Walk of fame" and all its attractions. Staff: the best and more friendly I have never meet ! Don't hesitate one second to book this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Celebrity close to all things Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: roderules
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay in the Hollywood Celebrity and I was pretty impressed. Although the building is old and obviously was a studio apartment building at one time, the rooms were exceptionally clean and well kept. The small kitchen was spotless and the appliances, including microwave, 4 burner stove and fridge appeared new. The rooms furnishings are pretty modest motel stuff and rather worn at that. The beds were comfortable, the airconditioning crispy and the room offered free ethernet internet access. They need to work on a few things though. there are stairs everywhere, short little flights that you have to haul your luggage up and over. The parking is free but badly undersized. People double park you in and you have to get the front desk to page the person blocking you. Also, it fills up fast and when it's full they send you to the parking garage at the Hollywood and Highland Center around the corner. It costs $10, but they reimburse you, but a drag late at night The location is very convenient, behind the Chinese Theatre and the Kodak Theatre. Lots to see and do within a few short walking blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: sunshinebabe25
Reviews.Content: I would even give it 6 * if possible. The hotel and its stuff are a-m-a-z-i-n-g. I have never seen people as friendly before. They would not even let us give them some tip. The hotel is located in a very good area, only 5 minutes walk to "Walk of fame" and all its attractions. It's worth every penny! Large rooms, two king size beds, nice and spotless bath and believe me - you really feel like a celebrity! You have free internet, wonderful breakfast. Everything is so clean and nice and most of all - again - I have to tell you that the stuff cares so much! They even organized a dentist for me, due to my heavy tooth ache! I would definitely come here again. You even have a parking for free and I am so sorry that it will take some time till I can go there again. Book this hotel! You will never ever regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JoHouston
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here from May 22nd thru May 26th. This hotel was perfect for what we needed...a bed and shower. The staff could not have been more helpful in helping us find our way to different locations. We did not rent a car and were able to hop on a bus or subway and get to every location we wanted to be. The location was a great place to be, just a short walk and you are in the middle of everything. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: asiadoll
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night during the Memorial Day weekend. The hotel is located on Orchid and is right behind the Kodak Theater and next to the Renaissance Hotel. There is a little passage way that connects you to the Hollywood and Highland shops. (No more that a 2 minute walk) It's funny w/ all the hustle and bustle of Hollywood Blvd., you can slip away into a quiet little quaint neighborhood. Very cute! The hotel has 2 floors (no elevators) w/ 20 rooms per floor. Our room (#210) had 2 queen beds , a seperate dining area w/ a table, 2 chairs, a microwave oven and a refrigerator. Lots of closet space and the bathroom is long and narrow w/ a sliding window. Very clean,bright. Bring own shampoo, conditioner and soap if you don't like the basic/generic stuff. The bedroom also has a window but both windows overlook the neighboring building windows. The room overall was very spacious. The hotel has an art-deco theme and the rooms are painted a soft yellow. The bed is soft and comfy but pillows are a bit flat and the comforter needs to be updated. There is continental breakfast served - muffin, bagel,crossaint along w/ 4 different kinds of juice, and coffee. The hotel has a steam room and an exercising room which has 3 machines. Parking lot area is small and it is first come first serve (entrance at Franklin). At night, the front door is locked and you must be buzzed in. Internet service is free (and fast) but just obey the 15 minute rule. What impressed me is the staff's (front desk) service. I called last minute and asked for a room but none was available due to the holiday weekend. I was surprised Alvin called back at the time he promised to call if another guest did not take the room. Also, we arrived back from clubbin late (after 2:45a.m.) No parking in the parking lot and no street parking. We asked the front desk to suggest any parking area but he just simply told us to park in front of the loading and unloading zone and he will move the car for us if a space is open at the lot. This hotel is run as if it was a bed and breakfast /mom and pop hotel. They take care of your needs and are very hospitable. And not to mention, the great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean and Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights May 2007, selecting Hollywood Celebrity Hotel based on reviews on TA, TA Experts on the Forum and after extensive searching. We wanted location, value, clean and well managed, ease of access. We drove up from San Diego using Google Maps to enter our last lotel location in San Diego to the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel & printed the instructions and maps. This worked GREAT and as a result cut our driving time and we drove right up into the parking lot. We booked on line at their website and got a great rate. We received the room we ordered, which was clean, very large, appointed with 60-70's era furnishings. The room was a low end 3*** in our view - but very acceptable. Toiletries were of a better than everaghe quality. The continental breakfast was basic: muffins, bagels, juice, coffe. No jam etc. There is free parking in the back, but it is as available, and our car was blocked until someone from the hotel came to move it which happened right a way - so no problems. the location of the hotel is incredible - and is the best reason to stay here. The metro is 150 feet through the mall - one stop to Univeral and no hassles to use. Front Desk provided tourist information as requested, but were generally invisable if you were not at the desk. If we were to stay in Hollywood, we would stay here again, it has location, value and is well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: M4pres
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from Tuesday 1st May to Monday 7th May, and i loved it. The hotel is situated behind the Hollywood and highland center next to the kodak theatre and graumans Chinese theatre. The area is a little unnerving but i felt safe, to get to the center walk down the street and go through a small corridor to the center. The hotel is in a great position most of the tours start off from outside the highland center, the hotel is a distance from the beaches though but most things are reachable. The staff are great and helpful, the cleaners do a good job too. The breakfast was standard, either bagels, muffins or croisants. There is juice in the morning as well as tea and coffee but these are on all day as well. so couldnt complain. Saved some money, so couldnt complain. The hotels decor is ok this is the only thing i think that lets it down, some things could do with repainting or touch ups. The only other thing was that the Air conditioning was a bit noisy but it didnt wake me up at all. u only noticed it when u were up. I would recommend this to anyone. My first visit and hopefully not my last.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peegee1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights Mid April 2007 with my 2 adult daughters. Found are room very Spacious, Clean and quite. Location is perfect, Walk of fame, Kodak Theatre, Hollywood & Highland Centre within 1 min walk. Subway & Buses within 2 min walk. Staff very Freindly and Helpful, free internet most useful. Free Breakfast nothing great but ok to start the day. Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Outstand Experience and Value”
Reviews.Author: Tupelo2
Reviews.Content: Overall, a fantastic experience. I stayed eight nights, with no major problems at all. The hotel staff is friendly and knowledgeable, the location is incredibly convenient, and the accomodations are clean and comfortable. This is a superb value for the money. I stayed in a room with a kitchen, and it was stocked with the various cooking necessities, so it was incredibly convenient to cook a few of own meals. Housekeeping staff was great. For example, not once did they wake me up even though I slept in late. They just took note of when I left, then tidied up the room. The lobby has a computer with Internet access, but I brought my own laptop, and each room has free internet access via an Ethernet cable. The cable had to stretch across the floor to the table, but this was a small inconveniece to pay for broadband access. The continental breakfast each morning was spartan but nice, with four different juices, coffee (regular and decaf), fresh muffins and croissants, with condiments. The hotel is located on a quiet side street nestled in the hills behind Graumann's Chinese Theater, the Kodak Theater, and the Hollywood & Highland (H&H) Mall. There is a Metro train entrance there as well. The Walk of Fame is right there. Hollywood High School is a block over. I loved the daily parade of characters in front of the Chinese Theater. Within walking distance to many shops and restaurants, tour companies, etc. The hotel has a nice patio to sit and enjoy as well. The rooms were actually fairly spacious and quiet (tip: run the A/C fan to drown out the slight traffic noice in the morning). Hotel was usually very quiet, even early morning. Try and stay on the first level towards the rear (no elevator and it is quieter). Some more tips: there is a shortcut through the mall...find it. If you have a car, there is a hidden shortcut to Orange Street as well. Even though the hotel has a fitness room (with a steam room) I needed a larger gym and there is a huge LA Fitness one block over that was only $40 for the whole week...nice club and definitely a bargain. Another tip: prearrange transportation online from LAX via a shuttle (Super Shuttle or PrimeTime Express)...will save you tons of money over a cab ride. $31 for two people. I know someone who also stayed there and paid $80 for a cab ride from LAX. The parking lot is very small, so a smaller rental car might be better. Be careful backing out onto Franklin, and park closer to the street so you don't get blocked in (there were a few mornings where there were more cars than spots).. More tips if you have time: see the Getty Center, Rodeo Drive (run into Heidi Klum there), Santa Monica Pier, Venice Beach, Malibu/PCH (someone I was with saw Sting and his wife there), drive Mullholland between the 101 and the 405...stop at the overlooks. Breathtaking homes and views..slip into a canyon road (watch out! locals drive fast in their beautiful exotic cars). Take a studio tour (Warner Bros is the best). Also try and see a show taping (Jimmy Kimmel is across the street). Also, there is usually someone handing out free tickets in front of Grauman's daily. Or check www.tvtickets.com or tvtix.com to see what's taping. Buy a stars map. See what shows are playing...esp. in West Hollywood. have a drink at an 'old' Hollywood club like the Formosa. Or, hit a hot club like the Cabana Club on a Thurs. if you can get on the guest list (search and ask for stuff like this). Take an hour to drive down Sunset Blvd. past Beverly Hills and Bel Air and UCLA to the ocean. During rush hours, avoid the freeways at all costs. Main side roads are usually quicker. Again, this was an AMAZING value ($109 with AAA discount) for a two queen room with a full kitchen in the heart of Hollywood!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected, from reading all the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: raindrops27
Reviews.Content: Ok, now all the reviews for this hotel. Is what made me stay here. But, to be honest. I thought the hotel was more than a little lackluster. Yes, it is an old hotel, yes, it shows a bit of wear and tear, yes when i was in the shower, i thought i would fall through, the bottom. Yes, the staff members, are very nice. Yes it does have nice bed covers, and a wonderful painting over the bed. But, in my opinion that is it. Oh, and the continental breakfast, please skip it. It is nothing but stale old bagels, and such. THe highlight of this motel, is the location. It is basically right around the corner from the walk of fame, and the chinese theatre. My opinion is just that, an opinion, but if i had a choice. I would never stay at this place again. If you just want a place to sleep at night, and shower in the morning, alright. But, if you want a little more. Look elsewhere. I would give this motel a 2, but because of the location, it got a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: tmoyni
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like staying in a 57' Chevy and I mean that in a good way. Like any classic it might show a bit of wear but the hotel is in great shape and should be designated a historic land mark. The beds are comfy and the room was spotless. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. There is a fridge in the room and although the lot is small there is free parking. The price we paid make this hotel a bargin. Walk towards the new hotel at the end of the street and you will be able to cut through to the Kodak theater. All that being said I didn't care much for the area around the theater. I wouldn't venture more than a block in either direction and the walk of fame isn't worth th trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: abbylavie
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on trip advisor, and booked a room for 4 people + a small kitchen for 5 night. It cost us around $140 a night for the room ($35 each!) We got there after a horrible flight and sighed with relief - the hotel was beautiful, roomie and clean. There's always hot water and coffee in the lounge, a computer with free internet, a small breakfast every morning till 10AM and vending machines. The people who work there we re really really nice and helped us alot with where to go and how to get around on busses. The room was large with two queen beds, tv, a closet to hang our coats and a bath. The kitchen was fully stocked with dishes, a microwave, fridge, everything you need. Oh and the location!! its right on Hollywood and Highland, behind the Highland mall, the chinese theater, the walk of fame and much more!

Reviews.Title: “Loved loved loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: jinxedink
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay in the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel...we were there Friday the 13th and Saturday the 14th of April. Couldn't have been better. We booked by phone after reading reviews here, and have not one complaint. Yes, the parking can be tight (they let us over-park the lot, and took our keys in order to move our car for us when someone else needed to get out. This was great, as the lot is monitored by camera, and very secure.) We stayed in the Suite with two very comfy queen beds, a kitchenette, large bathroom, big closet...everything you could need on hand. The staff are very friendly, the place is very clean, yet not sterile and institutional feeling. The breakfast was great to wake up to. And Ijaz, who checked us in, is a beautiful and friendly soul. Very kind, very accomodating. It was great to have computer/internet access in the lobby (we don't have a laptop, oh horrors!). The Celebrity is a great haven in the midst of intense/insane Hollywood. We will definitely stay there again. The price is fantastic. The patio out front very nice. Everything was really perfect. I recommend it to any and everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jellybean006
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel behind the main street of Hollywood. Excellent value and service at the front desk was fantastic. Due to its central location, the lack of amenities within the hotel (e.g. bar and restaurant) went unnoticed as there are a number of restaurants / shopping arcades nearby. Overall we had an excellent stay during our honeymoon, and were also given a quiet room / suite at the back of the hotel - definitely highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jinapsan
Reviews.Content: Me and two friends stayed at this hotel for 5 days. I chose this hotel after reading the reviews on this website. While I tend to stay in 4 or 5 star properties, I decided to stay at this hotel because my friends were on a tight budget being from Colombia. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. we were upgraded to a suite with 1 queen bed and a foldaway sofa bed in a separate living room area. Our room was rather large with its own kitchenette and came with free internet connections. The staff of the hotel was very very friendly and really tried to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. The free breakfast was simple but adequate. Parking can be difficult but if necessary, one can park at the nearby gas station. The hotel will pay for the parking at the gas station. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely consider returning to this hotel for future visits to the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended! For rooms you look forward to returning to at the end of a long day”
Reviews.Author: podspace
Reviews.Content: This hotel does all the basics really well, and more. It's supposed to be budget but certainly doesn't feel so - it's definitely better and classier than the standard and anonymous budget chains. Stayed 3 nights over the Good Friday till Easter Sunday weekend. 4 of us stayed in the deluxe 2-king. Pros: - Lovely deco, with cool posters and motifs - Clean rooms, made up every day, with fresh towels - Free internet access (unlimited in the rooms if you have a laptop, and for 15 min in the lobby) - Vanity room with hair dryer, closet with iron - Hot water with steady temperature and pretty good pressure (important during the freak cold spell) - Lots of fluffy pillows - The suite comes with microwave and kichenette, even though we didn't use it - Great location (just behind Kodak Theatre, 5 min walk away) - Free parking Cons: - The parking lot for the hotel is really small and overcrowded. You end up having to park behind other cars, all the way almost to the street, and hand off the key to reception in case they have to move it (so they won't have to wake you up early in the morning to do it). Or, you might want to go out for a late night / set off early morning and find yourself parked in. - The breakfast is free but really crappy. Bagels were rock hard, not really edible. - For the deluxe 2-king, they are in 2 rooms (kind of like living room to bedroom connection) but separated only by a curtain. So may not get the privacy you want if you go as 2 couples. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's the kind of room you look forward to returning to at the end of a full day visiting / touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, comfortable and central!”
Reviews.Author: elcin
Reviews.Content: I cannot place one fault at this hotel. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable and the service excellent! The staff at the front counter were extremely helpful, especially when I came across an urgent situation... they were so helpful in fact, that they made several calls on my behalf and even let me use the internet computer in their office as the guest one was occupied! The hotel is so centrally located, everything you need is only a short walk away. Breakfast is basic, but for me that was not a problem as long as the coffee is good... and you can have that as often and whenever you like! If you are not looking for anything fancy but clean, comfortable and well located accommodation whilst in LA, then this place is definately the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable staff and a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lstraveller
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I have stayed in and the service was completely faultless, the best I have experienced and I've stayed in places all over the world! Albon, the staff member at the front desk, was so friendly and helpful and most accomodating to us; I couldnt leave without giving him a koala as a thankyou gesture. We loved it. I called the day before we arrived originally requesting a room for 1 night, and we ended up staying five. It was in an ideal location, 5 minutes from the Walk of Fame, the Chinese Theatre and other Hollywood attractions. Their breakfasts were great, and the muffins were the best I have ever tasted, so beware if you're watching your waistline as they are delicious! The only problem we had was with the extremely loud people staying in the room next door; not much you can do about noisy neighbours. This was a small price to pay though for our lovely stay. The whole experience made our time in Hollywood so enjoyable, and I would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Hollywood who wants to be in the action, and stay in a wonderfully welcoming hotel. Thanks Albon and staff, your service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous all-around”
Reviews.Author: swacer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely the best value for the price that I have ever found. The location is absolutely perfect (especially if you find the little walkway that connects the street it is on with the Hollywood/Highland complex...a little hidden, but once found, makes an extremely short walk even shorter). The staff is excellent and always ready to help (and call someone to find an answer if they don't know it personally). The breakfast, while small as some other reviews have stated, is delicious and enough to keep you going (with all the great restaurants in LA, why would you want to stuff yourself on a huge continental breakfast anyways?) Parking can be a bit of a struggle, but at least it is free instead of $20/night like at other nearby hotels (Tip: if coming in in the middle of the day when the lot is a little less crowded, turn around and back in, makes getting out next time MUCH easier). The decor in the rooms is very cute. I can't find a single thing to complain about. Wonderful, would recommend to almost anyone (though I'm not sure about handicap access, didn't see any ramps or level entrances anywhere). Definitely will stay here again the next time I'm lucky enough to return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely looooooovvvvved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: claylily
Reviews.Content: I echo tiggy's review. This hotel could not have been more comfortable, convenient, and customer-service oriented. Alvin at the front desk went above and beyond the call of duty to assist us with anything we wanted or needed; i.e., boarding passes, shuttles, directions, etc. Would definitely stop here again the next time Clay Aiken is in town and I am fortunate enough to get tickets to see him. Thanks Alvin and Hollywood Celebrity for making our trip that much more enjoyable!!! Lillian

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: tiggy52winkle
Reviews.Content: Three of us spent 2 nights here mid-Februrary. We loved the hotel! Our room toward the back on the first floor was very quiet. Alvin at the front desk couldn't have been more helpful. The internet connection was great and the breakfast was fine. If you want more, Mel's diner is close by. The room was very large and we even got a free upgrade to a room with a full kitchen! Comfy beds, very clean and the bathroom was in good repair and also very clean. The location is amazing; walk just a little bit down the street and you're at the back of Hollywood & Highland Mall. We cut right through to go stand in line for the Jimmy Kimmel show at El Capitan. (Clay Aiken was the guest, hence our cross country trip!!!) We got a AAA rate that was phenomenal considering the location of this property. Don't know about the negative reviews of others. We were delighted with this property and would highly reccomend it to others (especially other Claymates coming to the Kimmel show when Clay's on!) Some Baltimore Claymates

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaSunny
Reviews.Content: The Celebrity Hotel is a great little hotel with a big parking problem. Other than that, I have nothing negative to say about it. The staff was great, our deluxe suite was roomy and quiet, and even the parking problem wasn't THAT bad (because if you find you have to double park you can leave your keys at the front desk and the staff will move your car the minute a space becomes available). We stayed at the Celebrity January 25 (the night of the Academy Awards) and January 26. The Oscars brought out the Goodyear Blimp and every media helicopter in the west, which made for a noisy afternoon (the hotel is almost backed up directly to the Kodak Theater), but everything quieted down once the festivities started. This place is neat. Sure it's not the Regency Beverly Wilshire or The Beverly Hills Hotel, but then you're not paying their prices, either. Stay at the Celebrity and enjoy it. We'd stay again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: SanCarlosGuy
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Celebrity Hotel is well located for seeing the usual Hollywood sights. The rooms with the even numbers face a busy street and the odd numbered rooms face an apartment building's pool. The hotel is very clean with a friendly staff. My room had a nice kitchen and the desk person offered a coffee maker but no coffee. Not really a problem since there's free coffee 24/7 in the lobby. The A/C worked well and I used it to block the noise from the late night party at the adjacent apartment building. I encourage visitors to use the excellent, though limited subway system. It sure beats driving in LA traffic. The Hollywood and Highland, Kodak Theatre complex is lots of fun and just a block from the hotel. Overall, a decent place, at a good price. .. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hmvik
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights. We were two adults sharing a double room with two twin sized beds. The room was clean, and in the morning the breakfast was quite limited, but good. There is free Internet access in all the rooms, which we really appreciated. The staff was friendly, and let me borrow the phone in the reception and also helped us with directions. The location is great, and we were really happy about our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and convenient”
Reviews.Author: PeterC55
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, if your looking for a good quality hotel, then this is not it, but if you want a cheap and clean hotel smack in the middle of Hollywood, then it is. It is a two minute walk from the walk of fame etc. and is generally o.k. for the very cheap price, it did the job. I went with my Girlfriend and two friends, and we found that LA is as large as London, to the west is the beach (Santa Monica pier, Venice Beach, Long Beach, Malibu etc.), and to the east is downtown, with Hollywood in the middle, so it is not a bad place to base yourselves for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a dive”
Reviews.Author: sirdaav
Reviews.Content: I paid standard rate on Priceline for this hotel, about 102 USD per night. I got 10 bucks off for each roach I found, which was a total of 4. I read other reviews, people said they liked this hotel, but it is very worn out. Great location, other hotels nearby, the Liberty Hotel or Orchid Suites maybe be cleaner/better shape. Overall, I would not stay here again, even though it is in a safe area, right by the metro and the H&H mall, Hollywood Blvd has been elevated in status these last few years, it is quite safe. The hotel manager is not so friendly, other staff are. He does not know LA very well...so beware his directions, he would not call me a cab saying FedEx was 3 minutes walk away. It was 45 minutes walk. That pissed me off more than the roaches. Oh, the other thing in this hotel is noise. You can hear everyone around you as clear as day, the stomping on the ceiling, their going to the toilet and the room next door's TV. It makes you feel as though you're in some run down doss house with it's worn out 1920's decor - which with the roaches and stuff I am thinking you possibly are. Great location, needs a lot of work.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: disy
Reviews.Content: We booked this after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. It is very reasonably priced and it is right next to the Highland Hollwood shopping centre. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was simple but adequate. There are a couple of tables out the front where you can sit and eat. We enjoyed having our breakfast there each morning. This was one of our favourite hotels during a six week stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Locorico
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a 4-star hotel, this isn't it. However, in a land of overpriced properties, the Celebrity is a great find in the middle of Hollywood! At $79/nite, you can't beat it. Make sure you get a room on the opposite side of Franklin St. to avoid the traffic noise. Only complaints were a strong smell of cleaning solution/fresh paint and a bit grungy shower. Otherwise, the water was hot, the bed was clean & comfy and the free breakfast, Internet and parking offer a great deal in pricey L.A. You can walk to the Kodak shopping area and be sure to get tix for a taping of Jimmy Kimmel Live.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - disgusting bug bites all over my body!!!”
Reviews.Author: silverana
Reviews.Content: I was personally recommended this hotel by my bestie who stayed there about a year ago with her friends. I made bookings over the internet after liasing with a staff member (whom I have now come to believe is the manager/owner’s wife). My friends and I booked for 5 nights in total but with a gap after the first night as we were going to visit Vegas. The staff member offered us a AAA members discount (I think it was about $5-$10) despite the knowledge that we did not hold such membership. Upon our arrival, we were greeted by its friendly staff and were presented with keys to our room which was clean, spacious, cozy and had a full kitchen. The location was excellent, within walking distance to the subway station, the Kodak Theater and the Chinese Mann Theater, in the heart of Hollywood. We checked out the next morning as we were heading to Vegas for 5 days. When we came back to the hotel after our Vegas trip, we were confronted by the hotel manager who insisted at the counter that the rates we were quoted shall be increased for the remaining 4 nights as we were not AAA member. I was prepared to show him the email with the quote but he didn’t seem too interested. After some argy-bargy, he finally said that he would let it go. The room he gave us was on their top level right down the other end of the corridor. Noone must’ve stayed in that room for months – it smelt horrible and the bed-clock was set 5 hours late. When we tried opening the windows to let some fresh air in the traffic noise was so loud, we had to close them. The bathroom door would not close properly either. In addition, the room did not have a full kitchen, just a microwave and a small fridge. So even though he did not increase our rate, we got a crappier room than what we paid for. Over the next few nights, I received dozens of bites all over my body from bugs most likely from the bed sheets. They were so itchy they kept me up all night, and the worst thing was they spread and can be passed on by skin contact. I will upload some pictures later. We were duly transferred to another room when I showed the bite marks to a staff member on our last night. It was still not the same standard as the one we stayed in on our first night but by then we’ve half given up on the place. The owner came and offered me $30 cash. That was not even enough to cover the ointment and tablets from the pharmacy (they were that bad, I had to take 2 packets of tablets). Having said the above, the location was really good, the staff members (other than the manager) were super-lovely and helpful, and the cost of accommodation included a generous breakfast. I wish the other 4 nights were like the 1st, because I would have highly recommended the place. But the fiasco with the owner/manager really pissed me off and the bug bites were so disgusting I ended up chucking out some of my clothes. I mean who wants to take tablets when they are on holiday, I felt like a sick patient and I had to be so careful around my friends as to avoid passing them on. All this because the owner wanted to charge us $40 ($10/night) more than what we were legitimately quoted. If the owner/manager is reading this – if you feel like you outsmarted us by giving us that crappy room, maybe you have, but at the end of the day, you got yourself 3 very unhappy customers.

Reviews.Title: “in one word: great!”
Reviews.Author: sandhop
Reviews.Content: I went to LA for one week and stayed at this hotel. The location was great, the staff was awesome. I really try to remember a negative experience in the Celebrity Hotel, but: NOPE! :) Breakfast was great, they even gave me a doubleroom when I refused to stay in a smoking room when I checked in, of course for the same price. I have to mention once again that the staff there is very welcoming, warm and friendly. So if you are travelling on low-budget, looking for a clean room and great location: this is your place to stay in LA!

Reviews.Title: “A real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: GranZorro
Reviews.Content: After reading on this website what a little gem this hotel was , we came with great expectations. The location is good; there is a parking lot but one always hard to manoeuver for parking and if there was no place, then one had to go to the gas station . The entrance and lobby are modern and inviting. The rooms are large but very shabby. The bathroom was a catastrophy and there was never any hot water after 9:00 a. m. in the morning. The cleanliness was also not optimal and neither was the housekeeping service. The peoole at the reception were friendly and obliging and apologetic for all the shortcomings. I would never go back there nor recommend this hotel . It has charming potential, but all gone to waste.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, but shabby bathroom a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ohmirose
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write this review for too long, and now I have forgotten most of the details, but I thought it was important to alert readers of 2 things: There is no elevator, so if you don't feel like lugging you stuff up stairs yourself, request a room on the first floor. Secondly, although our first floor room was a nice size, it really needed some updating. The bathroom had cracked walls and tiles. Old pedestal sink with no room for stuff. I always felt icky using it. Otherwise, its great location and reasonable price make it a place we will probably stay in again. Maybe by now they've upgraded the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PWCMontreal
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel located on a surprisingly quiet street behind the Kodak Theater. Clean room, good service, excellent value for money. The breakfast is basic - coffee, juice, muffins, and croissants - but that is a minor complaint as there are many restaurants just minutes away should you want something more substantial. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: dixiechick-TA
Reviews.Content: Great value! Location is excellent, parking is free. Although you won't always need the car. Universal studios is only one subway stop away. Hollywood Blvd is 1 minute walk with access to many tourist attractions and many tour companies. We rented a car from Budget across the street on Hollywood Blvd for only $30 per day. It was a lot cheaper than from the airport or online. However you will pay approx $60 for a cab to/from the airport each way. Staff are helpful and friendly. Breakfast is okay, it's free. We supplemented by picking up some fruit and yogourt from a local grocery store and keeping it in the fridge that is provided in each room. Jam and peanut butter would have been good, but they only have butter and cream cheese. You can't beat the price and the location. Don't get a room that overlooks the parking lot, you hear the noise from Franklin street. Every morning the garbage truck woke us up at 5:30 am. There is only 2 stories so the stairs are not a real issue. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “well worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: usawannabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights early December purely based on this site's great reviews and were not in any way disappointed. Complimentary internet access was such a blessing - not just for wireless, the keyboard was included!! :-) Location was excellent, absolutely 10/10 and the staff were friendly, accommodating, helpful and knowledgable, again 10/10. The rooms look old and not very flash but they appeared clean, there was a small sitting/kitchen area, and they were essentially comfortable enough. Complimentary breakfast was okay - possibly not great but more than good enough. We recommend paying to tour the Kodac Theatre (home of the Oscars) - we found it exciting to stand on THE stage AND sit in the front row etc!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: i_love_to_Travel85
Reviews.Content: Like everyone says this hotel is in an excellent location. It got even better when we realised we could cut through the loading/back area of the large hotel and then exit onto the mall on hollywood boulevard next to the chinese / kodak theatre. Free parking was a definite bonus. You have to be careful though. We had a very early flight and at night people block other people's cars because of lack of parking space. The free breakfast was fine if a bit limited. The room was nice, large and spacious. It was nice to have a kitchenette area and the bathroom was fine. Although the shower had a tendency to get very hot and have very sharp needle spray but it might have just been me being inadequate and not knowing how to adjust it. Having a large dressing area was nice to get changed and put makeup on. The best thing about this hotel is definitely the location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller3333
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel after seeing its good reports from trip advisor. This is a hotel located only 3 minutes walking distance from Kodak Theatre, in a very safe location/street in Hollywood. Everything was very accessible via trains/buses/tour groups. Hotel itself was very clean, with good complimentary breakfast. Staff was friendly and supportive. Only downside is that the sound insulation of the rooms was a little poor, and it was possible to hear steps/noises from other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK Room, Nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: acrdon
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just around the corner from Hollywood Boulevard. Don't expect much from the rooms, and the parking is pretty poor. We ended up having to park at a nearby petrol station, the car was ok in the morning but it didn't feel safe. Having said that, the staff were very helpful and frienldy.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Clean-wonderful personnel-near Everything that is Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: kaluda
Reviews.Content: We stayed in December 2006. we were very pleased with the hotel for a small hotel. it is sort of like a European hotel experience in that it is small but VERY clean and the personnel were very nice and helpful. It is within walking distance of many Hollywood sites, Graumans, Kodak Theatre, Starbucks! etc. The neighborhood is not elite but the security is fine. We will do it again if the occasion should arise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Fivefoot4
Reviews.Content: The Staff are friendly and the rooms are clean and large. I would have liked to have had some toast and spread included in the breakfast as I dont like bagels or muffins. This is the only adverse remark I can make about this hotel and overall enjoyed the experience. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay near Hollywood Boulevarde. I also found the area around the hotel safe for walking around at night. The metro rail and buses are located nearby on Hollywood Boulevarde and it costs only $3 for a day pass. Universal Studios is only one stop on the rail away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: ukvish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel in November '06 for 2 nights and had a great time. Its well located, practically in the Highlands complex (where the Kodak theatre is located) and right next to the Metro line train station. The rooms were large and clean and the staff were very friendly. Check in was efficient and parking is free for all residents. I would recommend this Hotel to both first timers and people returning to LA, I know i will be going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ukads
Reviews.Content: Like many others on here ,I booked this hotel as it was recommended on this website by other users. This hotel is located right behind the Kodak Theatre and in between the radisson hotel and a huge shopping mall. Staff where very nice on arrival, didnt have the need to speak to them after this. The rooms are "No fuss" and clean. Furniture is warn and its a little rough around the edges so dont expect top quality but it is CLEAN. If you want decor stay somewhere else.
