Free internet worked fine within the room, breakfast was fine and perfectly adequate for our needs. Car park is FREE and very welcome in this area as it didnt appear there was anywhere to park without paying. It is on the small side but we managed to get a space. We booked two rooms that were ground floor and adjacent to each other. Unfortunalty the cellings are extremely thin and could hear the rooms upstairs and people walking around at 6am each morning. If your a light sleeper this will wake you up so try and get a room on the first floor if possible. I would certainly recommend this hotel to my famly and freinds.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: soulwax
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Celebrity Hotel Date 9th and 10th of November 2006 Trip Advisor member Ireland Myself and my two sisters stayed here for two nights last week. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, quiet and very clean with all your needs catered for. I loved the 24 hour tea/coffee and buffet breakfast table in the lobby with free 24 hour internet access. You can walk to many places from this hotel. Even though I loved this hotel and have no complaints about it whatsoever, you are very much in the smoggy, city centre of LA. I think next time I'll try a place out on the coast as the beaches looked beautiful and the air tasted a little cleaner. Must do's Universal Grand LA city tour Santa Monica

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: happymeghappy
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was really good value for money. The location of this hotel is brilliant, withing walking distance of all the main attactions including the Hollywood Bowl. The hotel was decorated to a high standard and the celebrity themes in the rooms were fun. We were upgraded when we arrived to a suite with 2 large rooms and a great kitchenette, probably the best room we stayed in during our 11 hotel west coast tour. We would definutly revisit this hotel as it was a great base to explore Hollywood. Also there was free parking included.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like A Celebrity (without the cost)”
Reviews.Author: Jackiy in Oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel from Sept 28th 2006 for 4 nights at the start of our California roadtrip and it was one of the most enjoyable places we stayed. We are self-confessed clean freaks,so to say that I was worried about this property before we got there was an understatement. But being away for such a long time, we had to be mindful of cost, and judging from the reviews here on TA, we took the chance. The location was perfect - a quiet street behind the Highland Centre, and so close to Mann's Chinese Theatre and all the bustle of Hollywood Boulevarde. The rooms were extremely clean and a decent size, and whilst the decor was a bit outdated, including the bathrooms, it was comfortable. The room we stayed in had a kitchenette, which was stocked with essentials. Breakfast was supplied, consisting of bagels, muffins and juices plus tea and coffee was set up for the whole day. Whilst not gourmet, it was adequate, and when there are 8 mouths to feed (we traveled with another family of 4), it saved us a lot of money! But best of all was the SERVICE! You will not find more helpful staff in Los Angeles! We are trouble with our rental car company, and they promptly helped us (thanks to Bechir at Basic Car Rentals who opened up the office on a Sunday to help us out). Alben booked dinner reservations for us, taxis, gave us so many helpful hints about shopping, transport and dining, and always with a smile! Oh and FREE internet access in the lobby too! If you are looking for a small, quaint hotel with that friendly & welcome feeling that I imagine celebrities are accustomed to - then stay here. It may not be a 5 star property, but it definitely has a 5 star service...and that is worth even more! We will be back there for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbeeson
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel! I stayed here, with my girlfriend, for one night in the beginning of October and was very impressed with the location, service, and cleanliness of the hotel. It is small, charming, and has character. WiFi, parking, and a limited continental breakfast (juice, coffee, tea, and breakfast breads) are included in the room rate. I will definitely be back to this hotel in the future and am recommending it to all my friends, acquaintances, and co-workers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!!”
Reviews.Author: maurice1123
Reviews.Content: This a small clean hotel. Location is superb! if you want to experience Hollywood - walking disance to major attractions (Kodak theatre, walk of fame, restaurants, etc. and 5 minute car ride to Universal Studio. This is a small hotel, staff is pleasant and polite, rooms are cleaned. One note - no elevator but staff is helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PriyaSatish
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay In LA, the rooms are very clean and the one we stayed in was big with a dryer, iron, refridgerator and toileteries. Small hotel, but a great location, half a minute walk to kodak theatre, Walk of fame, Chinese theatre. Good dining options are also close by. They also have 24hr coffee at the lobby and breakfast in the morning. Very courteous staff and front desk. Free internet for 10 min too. We stayed there for 4 nights and really liked it. The metro station is just a two minute walk away. Would definetely stay there when we visit next. Priya and Satish. India

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value - Irish couple”
Reviews.Author: jgoldenoldie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here @ start of 3 week tour of California/Nevada & New York following reviews on Tripadvisor. Great location, free parking available, though we didn't pick up our rental car til leaving LA. Good clean accommodation, complimentary breakfast but basis, bagels/muffins/crossants, need to bring back to your room (table & chairs provided & fridge) as no room to sit in lobby. Room a bit on dark side. Next door to Kodak Theatre, walk of fame etc.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: boxer_aussie
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. In a quiet street just behind the Kodak theatre, Hollywood/Highland Mall and the metro station. Our room was an executive Queen and had plenty of room. The room was equiped with a fridge (not stocked) and microwave. Coffee was available at any time in the lobby. I would recommend this hotel for those wanting to be very close to the Hollywood sights and to train/bus if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: pol006
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel in perfect location. Staff very polite, friendly, helpfull.We had everything we needed; hairdryer, iron, toiletries, breakfast and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Close And Clean”
Reviews.Author: ROOMVITHAVIEW1
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay to visit LA by day and grab some dinner close by without having to drive at night. We stayed fo 4 nights and were very pleased. For the cost the level of service and the cleanliness was better than many 3-4 star chain hotels. The breakfast does the trick but if you want anything fancy/hot/ a change after a couple of days you'll be best to head out. Desk staff were lovely. Free safety dep box at reception was useful.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Experience Gone Bad.”
Reviews.Author: losbarbour
Reviews.Content: I'd like to say that first impressions are important, and sadly the first impression at this Hotel was not as we might have hopped for. Upon arriving, at 10pm PST, my wife and I were informed that our room would be located directly adjacent to the entrance of the hotel. But we were assured that the sleeping quarters were near the back of the room and that the noise of people entering and exiting would hardly be heard if we noticed at all. I could not help but notice that the door to our room was slightly blocked by the service door to an employee basement (service area). The clerk was very friendly, this did help. We entered the room; it was spacious, clean and sadly reeked of natural gas. I am not a paranoid person, being a former employee of a restaurant that used natural gas I immediately knew the odor. My wife and I asked if we could have a new room. The clerk, who was very friendly, sadly informed us they were sold out for the night. After I informed him of our problem, he first attempted to turn the oven, off himself instead of calling someone in. I had to inform him hours later that his plan did not work. The clerk said at that point that he would have maintenance look at in the morning. We shared an awkward moment of silence, then I asked if they had a sister hotel were we could stay instead. I was told there was, I was refunded for the night at this hotel and charged for the night at the sister motel which was located at the end of the same block. The entire exchange took until 1am. Both clerks at both Hotels were friendly but neither offered more than verbal compensation for my displacement or troubles. I was happy they were both sorry for my trouble, but I would rather have been sleeping rather then trying to work out how to solve their gas leak issues at 1am, and then trying to find a place for my wife and I to sleep for the night. We were actually quite lucky I knew of the problem, the dumfound clerk had no such experience with natural gas and had asked that we just sleep in the room anyway. Granted he suggested we leave a window open, and even that we put a fan near the window. But if we had done so we may have gotten deathly ill or worse. What I do know of natural gas is from Avista. Avista (a power company in Washington state) has told its customers that if you smell natural gas, GET OUT! And stay out until their technicians can look at the problem. Not go inside your house and sleep on it until maintenance can look at it in the morning, oh and put a fan in the window. I repeat, he was a really nice guy and meant well. End of Day 1 We stayed for another 6 days, instead of giving you a play by play of each day, as I had above. Let me sum up. Positive comments: All employees and managers were very kind and also acted as quickly as possible to serve us as they could. Negative comments: • Unfortunately, our room was not serviced until we called at 7pm on one day. • The toilet didn't work on 3 different occasions, and the service toilet they have for just such an occasion was also out of order. • Bed sheets shorted every night • Not enough electrical outlets. I own a CPAP machine which requires an outlet near the bed, no outlets located near the beds. Only behind them which required my wife and I to move the bed before I could use my medical device. • No working clothes iron in the room. They did have one, but it didn’t work. And after the week we’d had so far I was sure they’d give me another one, but I didn’t want to risk what it might do to whatever I would try to iron. • No elevator to the 2nd floor (which normally wouldn't be an issue, but I didn't pack expecting to be lifting that kind of wait up a flight of stairs) • Poor cable TV reception, I'm not even sure how you get back Cable reception. It's cable, how do you get bad cable reception? I don't know but somehow we didn't get all the channels that were listed in their hotel guide book as "local" • Moldy sponge in which to clean the dishes provided by the hotel • Had to run the taps for a while to get hot water, then couldn't get cold water, even though they ran out of two different faucets. • The toilet seat would tip as you sat on it, so if you didn't try to balance while you were using it you might tip it over. More Positive comments: But don't let all these negative comments fool you. If you don't rent a car, and you want a location that is close to the metro (rail and buses) as well as a place that is within walking distance to many attractions,** and a friendly staff. This hotel will have what you want. The staff is very friendly, and so is the management. Summation: In summation we were within 10 minutes of so many excellent LA attractions it almost made the hotel room worth it, almost. Our trip was schedule for a total of 9 days 8 nights, you might have noticed above we only stayed 7 nights. We decided it would be more cost effective to pay $100 to fly home than pay $129 to stay another night at the Hollywood Celebrity. Footnote **Man’s Chinese theater is awesome! Make sure to stop there on a weekend evening or a Friday night. The street performers are something else. And sign up to see the Jimmy Kimmel live show, its right across the street! Within 5 min of the hotel a live TV show!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect find!”
Reviews.Author: amy999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location for a vacation in Los Angeles, being within walking distance from many great attractions. The staff are very hospitable and welcoming and the rooms are very clean. The hotel has a nice decor and the rooms are very spacious. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for great value.

Reviews.Title: “All you could need in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4MR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HCH for 3 nights in August. The location is brilliant and having free parking is a bonus. However bear in mind that the parking lot isn't big enough to fit all the guests cars in so you have to double park and leave your keys at reception a lot of the time. Rooms were huge and had a fridge, dining table, tv etc and were very clean. The bathroom was a bit tired looking but very clean and big. My only criticism would be that the shower was really weak and so it took ages to wash your hair but for the price and location it can't be beaten. I disagree with the reviewer who said it seemed spooky, the road was absolutely fine and we never felt unsafe at any point including comeing back very late at night (we are two girls on our own).

Reviews.AuthorLocation: too far from the wild west!
Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rocker_rep
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay for exploring Hollywood, Universal Studios and everywhere else with easy access to all of LA. Stayed once before recently with family but this time I was traveling alone, to visit friends, and felt VERY safe staying here. This is a VERY clean, tidy, 'boutique-ish' style hotel in layout and decor. WONDERFUL staff, friendly and helpful! Internet in lobby fast and reliable. The breakfast muffins are yummy! The fitness center was also a nice touch. All in all, staying at this hotel is pain -free, no advil needed here (wink ;) ! Truly, this is a great value and am looking forward to another stay soon! Thank you Celebrity Hotel, your attention to quality is sincerely appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLucy
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay! This hotels location is fantastic, the staff are delightful and the rooms are superb. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Such a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: anne2606
Reviews.Content: Our two bedrooms suite with kitchenette was big and welcoming . The bathroom looked very worn but it was perfectly clean so we didn't really mind . The man at front desk was really nice and helpful every time that we asked for information . Breakfast was really bad : food consisted of three trays of unfrozen but still cold croissants, bagels and muffins . And be aware that breakfast is only served from 8a.m. onwards . At least theoretically, because on two out of the tree days that we spent here there was a note on the breakfast table in the morning to warn clients that breakfast would be at 8:10 . So if you plan to leave early or if you are awake with jetlag, forget about the hotel breakfast . But as most other reviews stated, this hotel is all about great location at a reasonable price, so bad breakfast is not such a big deal .

Reviews.Title: “Great price, close to stuff but a little spooky.”
Reviews.Author: Talofa
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel 8/4/06-8/6/06. Just like the others reviewers mentioned, the place was good because of the price ($109 a night) and the location/proximity to entertainment and Metro (5 minute walk to Metro, Universal Studio's one stop away $3.00 for day pass), but.... I was a bit scared because the street the hotel is on seems a litte dirty with old cars parked on the side of the road, shopping carts all over the sidwalks. The bedding had a strong Clorox bleach smell and had holes in it. The shower was a little bit worn. I liken it to staying at an Army Guest House. Just the basics.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: travkay
Reviews.Content: What a gem this is. I spent hours on the internet at home in England trying to find a reasonably priced room in LA with good reviews and, as a result of this site, I chose the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel. What a wonderful location - so close to the major sites and right next door to the Highland shopping centre with all its eating places. The hotel receptionist was the friendliest and most smiling receptionist we met during our 3 week tour of Vegas, Zion, Bryce, Grand Canyon, Sequoia NP, the Big Sur and LA. We felt valued customers. The room was very spacious with a separate eating alcove with fridge and microwave, and even a dressing area. It was very clean and on the top floor. Due to the hotel's situation on Orchid Street, views were not to be had. The AC was welcome in the heat of LA and we heard not a sound at night, despite being within 5 minutes of Hollywood Boulevard and all the major attractions along that road. We had free internet use on a computer in the foyer. The only slightly negative comment was the very basic breakfast which consisted only of bagels and cake with tea, coffee and orange juice. I would have thought that bread for toast could have been on the menu with a little fruit. Also we had to take the meal back to our room as there were no tables at which to eat. Nevertheless, this is an excellent hotel and I would wholeheartedly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “top spot”
Reviews.Author: Drdavid
Reviews.Content: All the other reviews cover the story. Its the great location, friendly staff and comfortable, clean unpretentious rooms. If you want a marble lobby walk two minutes up the road to the Renaissance and pay four time the price!! I cant think of a better place to stay for exploring Hollywood. I booked a car on the fourth day to start our California road trip and you can arrange this through Hertz in The Renaissance and just walk 25 yards to pick up your car!! free cabled internet was the best and least hassle out of the ten hotels we stayed in during our three week trip. You cant go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, not the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: kaseygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my son & his girlfriend, needed a suite, and this worked. Location convenient for Hollywood destinations. Downfalls were the older furniture, no restaurant, uncomfortable beds. Not sure if I'd stay here again but it was priced right and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: jcmh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at begiining of our holiday and loved it so much that we stayed again at end of holiday. Room was good, beds very comfy. Staff were very helpful. You cannot beat it for the convenient situation, only 5 minutes from major attractions. We did not hear any noise at night maybe because after doing so much we were exhausted and slept like babies. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really close to the chinese theatre and hollywood sights. It is also really close to a shopping centre which has loads of restaurants and cinemas. It was quite noisy at night and the walls are very thin. There is no lift at the hotel so we had to stay on the bottom floor so this is why we had alot of noise at night. Room was nice and clean and nice bed. Staff are freindly and quite helpful. If you go def go to disneyland but get a 2 day pass because there are 2 parks there which we wern't told and they are both worth going too. It is a nightmare getting there without a car though so if you can get a car. Star tours is the only company that does trips and they are so useless and really expensive but we had to use them because we had no other choice. You can go to Universal studios on the metro and its 1 stop away, its really good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: server
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and booked based on previous reviews. It was in a Perfect location and for the price ( approx $80 a night per room ) best value that we could find. 2 mins walk from Kodak Theatre and Holly wood boulevard. Room was very large, 2 Queen Beds, small kitchenette, bathroom and dressing area. Room was clean didn't have the most modern furniture but hey you can live with that. Constant hot water with powerful shower. Free wireless internet available or u can use the PC downstairs for free. Breakfast was muffins, bagels,juice, tea coffee - included in price. Staff very helpful, stored our bags for the day while we went to Universal Studios, eventhough we had checked out. Definitley recommend this hotel to others, when you combine the price with location it gets top marks from me. If ever staying in Hollywood again we would stay here without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Hollwood, Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well I have to admit - I was very nervous after I booked this hotel. I decided to travel to LA not knowing it was the week before Memorial Day and most hotels had put their prices up. My old reliable, The Ramada in West Hollwood were asking for room rates over 100% more than what I had paid previously. I decided to give Hollywood Celebrity Hotel a go and I was pleasently surprised. Amazing value for money. Its not The W or the Four Seasons but if you are after a very reasonably priced, very clean and conveniently located hotel in Los Angeles this one is for you. Located right next to the Kodak Theatre, Hollywood and Highland Shopping Complex, Chinese Theatre, Walk of Fame and only a short drive to Universal Studios this hotel is PERFECT. The rooms are huge and ideal for pre party drinks with some friends before heading out. Like other reviewers have said - parking is extremely tight but Hollywood and HIghland shopping complex has a huge, secure car park and it is only $10 per day. Very safe to walk from there to hotel late at night as well. Will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Some one is joking”
Reviews.Author: raven40
Reviews.Content: If you like the bottom of the Days Inn barrel or are satisified with uncomfortable beds and floors that look to grimey to walk on barefooted and showers with shower heads so clogged that the water trickles and very well worn 50's furniture and desk clerks with unintelligble accents than this is a place for you. Seedy is a kind word. Yes you are only feet from Hollywood Blvd and Kodak Center and The Star walk and Mann Chinese Theater and all the souvenier shops in LA but the street the hotel is on has numerous run down hotels that make you feel you want to be securely inside your room at sundown. Stay away. I have no idea what criteria the people that wrote 5 star reviews of this place use to judge hotels but they surely blew it on this one. I know I must surely have stayed in worse but I can't remember a place as worn out as this one andI am pretty sure they were less than single star bad dreams in scary parts of Europe. The room I had was a king for $99 .. a fair price would have been $39. don.brown@brownchild.com

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Graciecc
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel close to all of the major Hollywood attractions. It is dated, but has a certain charm to it that you'll never find at chain hotels. Our room was average in size, with 2 queen (or maybe double) beds, a small dining area with a mini-fridge and microwave, full bath and dressing area. It was cleaner than a Radisson I stayed at just before this visit. However, my boyfriend saw a bug in the shower our last day there. He swears it was a cockroach, but I'm not sure. Our room overlooked the courtyard of a neighboring apartment building. We had no street noise and hardly any noise from the neighbors. As mentioned, parking is free - a HUGE plus - but can be challenging. The staff had me double-park in the lot when we checked in around 9 p.m., but also had me give them the keys so others could get in and out. By morning, our car was in a regular space. The continental breakfast was enough to get us started each day. Free internet access was a nice touch. The staff was very friendly. For $89/night I can't recommend the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A small and unassuming hotel just off the main highway. Rooms were quite large and well appointed. The old holywood style art definitely added some character aswell. Staff very friendly and didn't seem bothered when I asked questions or needed to book a shuttle bus etc. In the foyer they have an internet terminal which is great for sending emails, but unfortunately you can't hook up your digital camera to upload photos (they forbid it). I would definitely stay here again if in LA. The location is great and the price is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on business. Good location in quite Cul de Sac and just a short walk to restaurants. The room I had was large (looked like it used to be a bed-sit) with a comfy bed, bathroom a bit dated but hey, at the price...no complaints! Free carpark is a bonus, although it's best to park closer to the entrance, you can get blocked in which can delay an early morning start. Free use of the internet was also welcome. For the $s, I'd say it's pretty hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 10am and although car parkwas full, reception let us double park and leave our keys, the car had been moved to a proper space by our return. Check in was quick and freindly. The location is perfect, directly behind the Holywood and Highland, but on a quiet street. It was a 2 minute walk to the Kodak theatre. The rooms were a good size and had everything we needed. Coffee and free internet via a PC in reception area were avaiable 24hrs. Breakfast was Danish and Muffins with coffee and juice whih was taken back to your room. Would stay again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - Awesome loaction - Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Naren1309
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife on a west coast vacation and LA was the last stop. I think this hotel was by far the best value we received on the trip. Excellent (incredible) loaction, just walking distance from all major Hollywood attractions. Parking was a little issue, but we had someone checking out when we got there - so got lucky with that. The staff is great, very helpful. They provided discount tickets to Universal Studios and also local sight-seeing tips were helpful. Our checkin time was 3:00 PM and we reached there at about 9:00 in the morning for our Universal Studios tour. They let us park in the hotel and also offered a room for my wife to freshen up and change before we headed out - not something you would be offered anywhere else. I think overall it is an excellent value for money. I don't know what else guys expect ar under under $100 a night, in a loaction like that. Breakfast was decent (muffins and bagels from Costco) and there was ample space to sit outside to eat. The room was spacious and overall, we had a great time and no complains whatsoever. Tip: Book well in advance, because they sell out pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: “fun Old Hollywood building - great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a kitchy remodeled hotel that has preserved an old Los Angeles feel to it, architecturally. The staff are amiable and knowledgeable about the area's attractions. There is only one major drawback: the parking situation. Other reviewers speak of "great free parking". The reality is that the lot can accommodate about 20 cars, several of which end up blocked in by other cars. One evening, I got back at about 7pm and found the parking lot full. I drove around to the lobby and was told that my only recourse was to park at the gas station a block away for $5. At the time, I had a new car and felt uneasy about doing this. Another evening, I went to get my car, found it blocked in, and was unable to leave. Guests keep their car keys, and there is no valet service. If you want to have guests visit - forget it. There is a 2-hour guest parking promise, but due to the limitations I described above, no way. Street parking is nonexistant, due to strict city restrictions. Lastly, the traffic in this area is insane. If you are not from a city and are not used to driving in strenuous conditions, stay in a less populated area. I live in San Francisco, and this is SF times ten. Aside from what I have mentioned, you will be close to many tourist attractions, and are in an historic district.

Reviews.Title: “Give & Take”
Reviews.Author: keversole
Reviews.Content: Rooms have an excellent location, free parking, and a free (if basic) continental breakfast. Cons are that the rooms are extremely dated & dark. Everything screams budget. Very similar to what you'd find at a budget European hotel. Not even as nice as a typical Super 8. Just depends on what is important to you I guess. Staff was nice, we got a slightly cheaper rate just by calling direct vs. booking on-line.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location with FREE parking!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel from 18 - 21 March and loved it! The location was superb directly behind Kodak theatre and they offered FREE parking! The carpark was a bit small and there's usually cars double parked. But if you ask the reception for assistance when you want to go out, they are more than glad to help shift the cars away. Our Charlie Chaplin room was spacious and had a lovely dressing area. Breakfast was a simple fare of muffins and bagels and there was no where to sit and eat, but we were fine with that. Another big plus is that they have free internet access at their computer terminal in the lobby. Only minus point was that our room was on the 2nd floor and they have no elevators. So if you have heavy luggage, do request for a room on the ground level. Albert, from the hotel reception, was extremely helpful with directions and sightseeing tips and very very friendly. Do look for him for great tips on where to go to catch a great pic of the Hollywood sign. Overall, we were very satisfied with our stay there. We would definitely recommend it to anyone on a budget and looking for great value!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Find!! Great spot!”
Reviews.Author: adzyboi
Reviews.Content: Free Parking, right behind gruman and kodak theartres. Clean, comfortable, the staff were friendly, everything is at your door. Great Price as well!!!

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our honeymoon in the US. If you are looking for a great location this is the place, situated right behind Kodak Theatre where out the back you will see the Hollywood sign on the hill, this location is just great. A walk around the corner brings you to Hollywood Walk of Fame. Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the subway. The public transport is also great to get to the farmer's markets (a must see) and Santa Monica Blvd and Venice Beach. It has free internet access for a 15 minute period which is great as most hotels do not have access or you have to pay. Reception are happy to answer questions and this hotel comes with a continental breakfast (to be more specific orange and poppyseed muffins, all day coffee, bagels). There are also shops close to get drinks or food. Its an older hotel that has been renovated in the last 12 months but its clean and our room had a small kitchen with fridge and microwave. The water is hot for a great shower also. All in all a must to say - I'd do it again!

Reviews.Title: “superb location... free parking....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: superb location... free parking.... nice staff... Everything was smooth, I`ll sure stay there again!!! Don`t throw away money on other hotels in this area.. It`s cheap and clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: filogirl
Reviews.Content: After agonising months of searching for a hotel in LA, I finally came across this hotel online. I was a little apprehensive at first (the reviews and just the stories I've heard of LA/Hollywood) but after meeting the excellent staff I felt right at home. This hotel is in an excellent location just behind Hollywood and Highland and close to other destinations (if you have a car) the front desk can orgaise tours for you. There's also FREE internet acess at the front lobby but usage is only for 15 mins per guest. Continental breakfast is served daily (but be quick!) and there's coffee and tea all day. Keep in mind that this place is cheap so there's basic ammenities. We only needed this hotel for a place to sleep and there were no complaints from my mum or sister. I do plan on returning to LA this June and will defiently stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: OZI-GAL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel in January and I would have to say you couldn't beat the location! It is just a very short stroll to the centre of tourist Hollywood - walk of fame, theatres, etc. The Hotel itself is an old Art Deco 2 storey, a bit worn but clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and our suite was very spacious with 2 rooms and a kitchen and plenty of room for baggage and a single folda-bed. The beds were comfortable and there were 2 TV's. It's not flash, but was very reasonably priced, and there was secure parking. It was great being able to walk to everything - restaurants, shops, attractions and not worry about taxis or parking. The best thing we did was hire a stretch limo for a tour of the stars homes- the kids thought this was the highlight and it worked out the same as the bus for 5 people.

Reviews.Title: “Great little bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this little hotel to anyone on a budget visiting the Hollywood area. It was very clean, the decor is as advertised, original and interesting, and above all, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. It was a stone's throw away from the Hollywood-Highland complex (pricey mall), and Hollywood Boulevard and the Walk of Fame. Even the Continental breakfast, usually a disappointing collection of doughnuts, was above average with varied bagels, croissants and juices. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel , good location and price”
Reviews.Author: juddy43
Reviews.Content: This hotel had been recommended to us from friends who had visited Hollywood before. We had looked at a few other but found this one too look and sound the nicest from photos and descriptions. We are glad we stayed there, we had a wonderful time in Hollywood with this Hotel only being a 2 minute walk to Hollywood BLVD. All the staff were helpful and polite, we will definately stay here again when we come back and will recommend it to all of our friends wishing to visit Hollywood. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Great Tourist Location”
Reviews.Author: safarijones
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel for 1 night while travelling via LA to Mexico. We decided to stay there as we wanted to see a few tourist attractions but had limited time and knew we would be jet-lagged - this hotel was perfect for that. The rooms were very large. The decore was dated but everything was clean. The bed was comfortable and the shower pressure good. It is about a 3 minute walk through to Hollwood Boulevard with the walk of fame, chinese theatre and a number of shops and restuarants. Reception were very friendly. Only 2 complaints: 1) We were told by reception that a cab to the airport would only be around $40 so we booked that rather than the shuttle at $30. The cab was $80 - take the shuttle. 2) We were in a room on the right side of the corridor. Next to the hotel on this side is an apartment complex with a pool and the doors to the apartments lead off an outdoor walkway which is opposite the hotel room windows. A large group of friends decided to congregate on the walkway outside their apartment from abour 9-11pm and the windows are not double glazed. Luckily they left at 11 but be warned - if someone was having a party in those apartments you would hear it! Overall, great for our purposes and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive: simply superb!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this brilliant hotel at the beginning of January on the last stop of a 6 months round-the-world trip. Having stayed in hostels and hotels throughout Asia, Europe, UK and USA, I found this hotel to be an absolute gem. The hotel is right behind the Chinese Theatre and Hollywood Boulevard (walk of fame); fabulous for seeing the touristy hollywood sights. My king executive was enormous for the price: king bed, bathroom, dressing room, coffee table and lounge, huge TV unit, kitchen table, microwave and fridge. I found no problem with noise whatsoever. A generous buffet breakfast of bagels, muffins and croissants is included. Complimentary tea, coffee and hot chocolate is available all day long. Free internet in the lobby. I cannot rate the staff highly enough - they were welcoming, warm and helpful with great pride in their hotel. For the budget to mid-range traveller I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: RallyB
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were attending a conference at a nearby hotel and I couldn't have been more pleased with this little hotel. The staff was very friendly, helpful and extremely accomodating. We arrived very early (9AM) and they were happy to check us in. They don't have an elevator, so this was a bit of a pain, but the desk person even helped us with this! They helped us with shuttle services and every other need. Our room was quiet (upper floor), clean and simple. If you're looking for the Ritz, this isn't it--but if you want convenience at a great price---you will love this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two children (15 and 11) in December as one of our stops on a round the world trip. We were looking for something inexpensive, central and comfortable, and this hotel met all of these criteria. Close to the metro, shops, Hollywood attractions, Universal Studios, and bus routes down Santa Monica Boulevard. The rooms were quite large (we had a suite with 2 large/queen size beds in separate rooms), with a kitchenette. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Footsteps from the footprints”
Reviews.Author: denjules
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the begining of January. We stayed in an executive king which is their basic room and it was more than adequate. The rooms are large with a goodside sofa, large bed, small dining table and fridge. There is plenty of hanging space and a nice touch was the vanity/dressing area which really helps as the bathromm isn't that large and I don't think two people could get ready at the same time in such a small space. The furnishings are a bit tired but the rooms are clean and considering the price and the fact you get a breakfast and and a parking space in such a convient location I think you're getting a real great deal.Infact the location is probably the one of it's best feature in just a few steps your inside the hollywood and highland centre which houses various restaurants and shops and from the 2nd level you can see the hollywood sign. Step outside the highland centre and you on the walk of fame and outside the chinese theatre. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone who is budget conscious but still want the location and room to matter

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy but fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: spiaggia_girl
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week's stay at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel over Christmas and New Year's. The hotel is an old 2-story building that has been well maintained and has a GREAT location right behind Hollywood Boulevard where Grauman's, the footprints, the stars on the sidewalk, El Capitan, the subway station, Kodak Theatre and the Hollywood/Highland Mall. The location can't be beat. It's less than 100 steps from the hotel, down the street to the walkway that goes into the Hollywood/Highland Mall. It's that simple. The street is a cul-de-sac (not a through street) so the traffic is just local and the area is well lit and feels very safe. No seedy characters or anything like that. The Renaissance Hotel adjoins the mall so there is some hotel traffic down there with the service trucks and workers but it can't be heard from the hotel. The Hollywood Orchid Suites, the other one that everyone also raves about is at the end of the block, close to the walkway so they might hear the service trucks and mall activity. The hotel lobby and hallways are very nicely decorated and bright. The decor is whimsical and quite cute in the lobby area. The hallways have large framed movie star posters. There is "free" internet access in the lobby and a seating area with magazines on the coffee table. Along one wall is a table set up with a toaster, microwave and coffee dispensers for the free breakfast in the morning between 8 a.m. and 10 a.m. The toaster and microwave stays there all day so you could easily heat your own things up. Breakfast is a large supply of bagels, croissants and muffins along with little packets of cream cheese and margarine. Beverages are also provided. Every single day the breakfast items are identical so it might get boring if you stay too long. For a week's stay, it was fine and a good cost savings if you take advantage of the breakfast offerings, however boring. Yeah, they could add a bit more variety but hey, it's free. Being an old building has its advantages. The room itself was exceptionally large. We had a king-sized bed that seemed tiny in comparison to the huge room. Two comfy sitting chairs with a coffee table is at one end near the window and a little cut-in room with a small dining table, 2 chairs and a decent sized mini fridge. The tv is housed in a large wooden cabinet in front of the bed with storage drawers and cupboard. There is a cheesy painted Hollywood mural at the head of the bed. It's very fitting to the old-time Hollywood "celebrity" image that the hotel is doing. The washroom was adequate with great water pressure. It wasn't hot enough to require air-conditioning so we didn't test that out but the windows all have screens and window bars so that gave us fresh outside air as well as a great sense of security especially since our room was on the ground floor. We really enjoyed our stay and thought the room was exceptionally well-maintained and very clean. It wasn't seedy or anything like that. It looked quite nice and we felt comfy in it. It's not a Hilton or anything modern or fancy. It's basic but very nice. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. That said, here's what we didn't like but it was okay enough to tolerate for a week's stay. The hotel is "old" and wooden so that means that there will be lots of noise! Everyone upstairs when they walked sounded like herds of elephants stampeding. Do elephants stampede? Heehee. It really was quite loud but we were in vacation spirits and didn't let it bother us. The other noise that woke us the first night at 2 a.m. was this repetitive thumping sound. At first we thought it was someone playing bongle drums outside. After investigating because it was such a strange noise, we discovered it was water coming down the gutter drain pipe outside our window. The funny thing is that it wasn't raining at all so we don't know where the water was coming from but it was gushing down the drain pipe, making loud ticking noises. There are drain pipes outside every other suite! I don't know if any of them were making noises but you might want to watch out for room 110. Occasionally the people upstairs turned their air-conditioner/heater on and water dripped from their air-conditioner/heater onto ours, making ticking noises on the metal housing. If you're the type that gets very agitated by a lot of noise, you might want to try to get an upstairs suite. It should be quieter. We did request an upstairs non-smoking room when we booked but a non-smoking one wasn't available when we arrived. The entire first floor is all non-smoking and the top floor is mixed so we chose non-smoking. It was noisy but we expected to have a fair amount of noise being the hotel is in a central location in Hollywood. The outside street noise was actually quite low because the hotel is in the back of the mall complex which blocks out the traffic noise. It was just the inside noise that was most noticeable but tolerable enough for us because we chose to let it be that way but if you're the type that doesn't like noise, you've been warned but don't let that be the decision that steers you away from the hotel. It really is a nice hotel. You'll enjoy your stay. You can always bring ear plugs just in case but I don't think you'll need them. It is a great hotel for the price and we would stay there again. Oh yes, parking is provided "free" which is a great bonus for such a central location. It is a small lot so it fills up quickly and sometimes there are cars double-parked so that you can't get out in the morning but the hotel staff will quickly send someone to move the cars so that you can get out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Limerick1ady
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, just behind the Kodak theatre and a subway station. I took a chance booking this hotel as a reviewer mentioned feeling unsafe walking to the hotel at night. We felt safe at all times and met no unsavoury characters. The staff were very friendly and gave us clear directions to Santa Monica (a bit of a trek by bus) and Warner Brothers studios. The breakfast could be improved upon.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK #2...”
Reviews.Author: poussemoussu
Reviews.Content: The rates are great for the location but the hotel has nothing special to write about. The rooms are rooms, the beds are beds, it's clean but there is nothing to catch your attention, neither concerning the decoration of the room nor concerning the amenities. The corridors were no heated and the breakfast was terrible! The steam room was right in the middle of a tiny fitness room: I doubt anyone feels like using it! I did not! To sum up, it's a good place to sleep but that's it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Celebrity Hollywood Hotel for 2 nights. While the hotel website photos looked really nice, we found the upgrades were only done at the front foyer. The rooms were old. Check out the pictures taken by a reviewer posted on Nov. 12, 2005. They are quite representative of what we saw. On the bright side, the location is excellent; five minutes walking distance to Hollywood Blvd, Kodak Theatre and Mann's Chinese Theatre. Parking was included which was great. Although there's parking for $2.00 an hour for the first 4 hours at the Hollywood and Highland Shopping Centre (next to the Renaissance Hotel). The hotel staff was very helpful, especially Alvin at the front desk. The breakfast was adequate although the coffee was terrible. The room was also average and it had a moldy smell to it. The only thing that really needed improvement was the shower head, we had water trickling the whole time. Overall, we chose this hotel for its location and free parking. The points of interest in LA are pretty spread out so having a car was definitely helpful. We only stayed at this hotel for 2 nights but would probably picked something more comfortable if we planned to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “The Celebrity Hotel is a gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reviewing Hollywood hotels on trip adviser, my wife and I chose the Celebrity for a two night stay. If you want clean, comfortable and quiet at a budget price, you should like this. See other reviews for general info. We discovered that the Metro subway is a short walk from the Hotel. For the senior rate of 45 cents, each, we rode it one stop away to the bottom of the hill leading to Universal Studios, which provides a free shuttle bus right to the main entrance. The alternative is to drive through crowded traffic to park in Universal's lot for $10.00 or $17.00 to park closer, but not as close as the free shuttle bus will take you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price/Good Location”
Reviews.Author: turkeyroll
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Celebrity from Nov 17-20. We booked the room directly from the hotel and got it for $79/night. The room was clean, very spacious and included a kitchen area. Our room was on the first floor (there are only 2 floors). The room was a bit noisy as you can hear everything in the room above you, including people walking around, so request a room on the 2nd floor. The hotel offers a good continental breakfast with a variety of juices, muffins, croissants & bagels. They offer free use of a computer with internet access in the lobby which is really a nice touch. The parking lot is free, but very small. The hotel is within a 5 minute walk to hollywood blvd, and all the attractions. Overall, like most hotels there are a few kinks, but our stay was a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “A nasty bait and switch, with no apologies or refunds.”
Reviews.Author: ekalee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reserved a room on Expedia for one night at the Hollywood Celebrity based on the glowing reviews on Tripadvisor. When we arrived, the hotel told us that they had a "plumbing problem" and offered us a room at their sister property the Hollywood Liberty Hotel across the street. They told us we could have a room at the Celebrity if we wanted to wait until 10 pm for it. This was not acceptable for us, as we had just driven for seven hours and needed to get ready to go to a party. I took the room they offered at the Liberty out of sheer exhaustion, I wish I had inspected it more closely before I agreed to spend a night in this dump. The halls and rooms smelled like cigarettes- despite the signs indicating that the hotel was non-smoking. What can I say about the room- my attached photos tell most of the story. The heat was a space heater! The shower didn't have hot water until the manager came in and said, "You have to find it..." and then calibrated it just so until a lukewarm trickle came out. The bathroom looked like it had been outfitted on a trip to the Dollar Depot, with a cheap plastic pink tension rod to hold up the shower curtain (actually it was just a liner). The bathmat was a hand towel. The coverlet on the bed was obviously stained and yellowed when we turned it down. The bed had no fitted sheet on it, so within five minutes of lying in it, the sheet was off and we were lying on the mattress. The most disgusting feature of this room was the walls. The walls were heavily stained with and looked as if they were last painted in the Nixon administration. There were cigarette ashes pooled in the windowsill of the bathroom. The biggest affront was that this room was supposedly comparable to the Celebrity. This room made the Super 8 seem like a four star resort by comparison. I never saw any of the rooms at the Celebrity but I can guarantee there was no steam room at the Liberty! I can't believe the owners have the gall to charge more than $40 per night for this place. The most outrageous thing is that Hollywood Celebrity offered no apology, no discount off the room or a free night at a later date, which would have been totally appropriate. They basically told us we could still come over for the continental breakfast at the Celebrity. No effort was made to refund any of my money, even though I had pre-paid a higher rate for the Celebrity. I hate to say it, but the way in which management treated us, I had the sinking feeling that they didn’t really have a plumbing problem, but that they had overbooked and given our room to someone else. Buyers beware! If they offer you a room at the Liberty, politely decline and take your business elsewhere…

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place To Stay In Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in October. It was a fabulous place to stay. The room was massive with a king sized bed, dining room with a fridge, dressing room, walk in wardrobe and lovely bathroom. The hotel was lovely - the reception area, hallways adorned with pictures of old Hollywood stars and films. There was free internet access and a continental breakfast was included. The location was fantastic - just minutes walk from the Hollywood sign, Walk of Fame, Mann's Chinese Theatre and Kodak theatre where the Oscars are held. My stay cost £200.00 with the current exhnage rate which is fantastic compared to what you'd get in the UK for that price and bear in mind I was there alone but the price would have been the same for two sharing. I don't think I could have found a better hotel - it had a gym and sauna too, which I never got around to using. I would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: malison
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Celebrity for 5 nights in October 2005. We got the room for $79 US per night. The room had a king size bed. The size of the room was comparable to many 5 star hotels that I have stayed at. Very clean room, sheets & bathroom. There was a separate 'nook' with a fridge and microwave. There was also a great hairdryer, and iron & ironing board. You also can't beat the location in Hollywood - about a 1 minute walk from the Hollywood & Highland Complex (enter through the back entrance). Very convenient location if you don't have your own transportation. Breakfast was great - variety of bread & muffins, juices, tea and coffee. Brilliant staff too - all 4 staff members we encountered were polite, friendly and helpful. A very nice change! The hotel had a great vibe, this is also important to the feel of a place. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Any questions, feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Foxpd
Reviews.Content: A very nice Hotel. Behind the Kodak teather in a very quiet area. When we arrive the little parking area of the Hotel was full so we had to park in a gasoline station near here. The Hotel paid the park for us. The room was large and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't want better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: By this stage we had stayed in over 5 motels across the US and this one by far would have to be the best. Great location (right behing the Kodak Theatre), breakfast in the morning (quality food), the staff were helpful and friendly and the rooms were large and clean. the street the hotel is located on was quiet and pretty and i would recommend this hotel to absolutely anyone. My friend and i were on a budget and although i dont remember the exact price per night i know we were under our budget so it definately wasnt too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: vegasbaby26
Reviews.Content: I just came back form here after staying 6 nights, The hotel overall was a nice place, good sized room, helpfull and pleasent staff and the breafast muffins are to die for. The location was perfect for those who want to do the whole touristy thing, you can get to hollywood and highland center through the back. The only reason I wouldn't stay here again is because apart from the hollywood and highland the rest of hollywood is pretty shabby, I prefered the west/ho area. But a great hotel, cheap and friendly
